They are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 SLL for each from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, increase their profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Serreh K..  Born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital, she is 45 years old, married, and has six children, all of whom attend school.  Her husband is a soldier. 

Serreh sells foodstuffs, including gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), palm oil, rice, ground nuts, and vegetable oil. She has been a businesswoman for 25 years. With her share of the loan, she will buy three bags of gari, two bags of rice, 25 gallons of palm oil, and two bags of ground nuts to add to her business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, such as gari, palm oil, rice, ground nuts, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing materials to sew dresses for her customers.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch S. is a married man who currently lives in Kompong Tom province. He has four children, all of whom are single. He is currently a recycled materials trader -- he buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other provinces and countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic.

Uch S.'s wife is a rice trader. She buys rice in bulk from people who live in the village, stores the rice in her stock supply, and sells it later for profit.   

As the rice-harvesting season is approaching, Uch S. has decided to seek a loan to help his wife buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price is higher.

loans.use: To stock up rice while prices are low for future sales

loans.name: Africana

texts.en:
Africana is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: food vending (barbeque); and buying and selling frozen products. Her husband Ernesto J., who is 45 years old, works as a multi-cab driver to earn his living. They have 4 children who are 5 to 22 years old.

Africana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Africana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her to earn a monthly profit of PHP 24,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase more goods to sell so that she can continue to save for the future. Her priorities are to educate her children and to repair their house. Africana is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva Lending Team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Ms. Eufemia is 55 years old, she is currently married and has a 33 year old daughter that has her respective family. Ms. Eufemia has a grocery store in her house for over 11 years (Ña Reina), where she sells top necessity products and drinks (there is a soccer court in which tournaments are held on the weekends.)

She is asking for the loan to invest in buying sugar, rice, flour and herbs in larger quantities to get a better buying price and higher profit in sales.

loans.use: Wholesale buying of sugar, rice, noodles and flour.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaire avec leurs  enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à dans le quartier Massablacoura à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de condiments et de céréales  avec  Rokia D.. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Rokia D., compte acheter, 2 sacs de 100kg de Maïs, 1 sacs de 100kg de petit mil, 3 sacs de 50 kg de Riz fumé.
Elle s’approvisionne au niveau cultivateur dans des villages environnants pour les revendre  au grand marché de BOUGOUNI en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group ("Harmony") is composed of married women, who on average are 34 years old and have four children. They live with their children and husbands in nuclear families in Massablacoura, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of kinship and neighborhood.

Faced with the need to increase their working capital to satisfy their clientele and boost their activity level, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They need the loans to finance their activities, namely selling food condiments and cereals (Rokia D.). This is their seventh group loan. All their previous loans have been repaid on schedule. 

Mrs Rokia D. intends to use her new loan to buy 2 sacks of 100 kilograms of corn, 1 sack of 100 kilograms of small millet and 3 sacks of 50 kilograms of smoked rice. She gets her supplies from farmers in nearby villages and retails at the great market in Bougouni, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, she expects to make an average profit of 20,000 CFA francs a month. She will use part of it to repay her loan and the remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, de 26 años de edad, natural del distrito de Kimbiri, convive con Jenny de 22 años de edad y tienen 02 hijos Javier de 05 años y Ruth de 02 años y juntos residen en su propia casa  donde reina la felicidad. La labor que realiza Roberto es labrar la tierra, donde viene cultivando plantaciones de piña, hojas de coca y plantaciones de café, en total cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno. Sus padres le enseñaron  a remover la tierra y creció con los anhelos de poseer su propia chacra, con los ahorros acumulados pudo concretar sus ansias de contar con su propia parcela. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo; donde viene trabajando 07 años en sus propias tierras, pero en los días  de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de trasladar los productos cosechados hasta cierto tramo; para luego poder comercializarlo. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas están muy productivas, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Menciona además que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos impidiendo el rendimiento con su trabajo. El préstamo que solicita es para poder comprar los útiles escolares como: libros, cuadernos, lapiceros; para su hijo Javier que viene cursando el primer año de nivel primario. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para así expandir sus sembríos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. Se siente muy agradecido con la institución por facilitarle el préstamo solicitado. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados,  comprará útiles escolares como: libros, cuadernos lapiceros;  para su hijo Javier que viene cursando el primer año de nivel primario.
texts.en:
Roberto, age 26, is a native of Cusco. He lives in his own house with Jenny, age 22, and they have two children, Javier (5 years old) and Ruth (2 years old). Roberto works cultivating the land, growing coffee, coca leaves, and pineapple. He has a total of 3 hectares.  His parents taught him how to plow the land and he grew up having dreams of owning a farm.  With the savings he accumulated, Roberto was able to fulfill his dream by acquiring a parcel of land.  He is an expert at working the land and has seven years of experience.  On the harvesting days, he has the help of workers who are in charge of loading the products onto a truck in order to be sold later.  Roberto feels committed to his work.  Thanks to his daily efforts he now has the pleasure of seeing healthy plants.  He says he does not like the winter season because of the abundance of insects that impede the development of his fruit.  After a while, he hopes to buy more land and vary his plantings so that he can provide better financial stability for his future family.  

This is his first loan MFP and he feels compelled to complete his payments on time.  The loan of 1000 of PEN that he requested will be used to purchase school supplies such as books and notebooks so that his son Javier can continue his first year of school.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for his son.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 47 años, vive al lado de su esposa y el menor de sus hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 15 años de experiencia en la confección de diversas prendas de vestir, su taller de confecciones esta en su misma casa en la cual todos los días trabaja en compañía de su esposa y su hijo, mientras tenga tiempo libre de estudio. Con los años de experiencia ha adquirido  destrezas  favorables en la calidad de su producción y adquirir más clientela mejorando así sus ventas, también se obligó así mismo a identificar las mejores oportunidades de negocio en el rubro de trabajo que se desempeña por lo que eligió confeccionar  gorros deportivos, que es una  de las prendas más usadas en su zona y lo que produce rápidamente se llega a vender. Su forma de venta es al por mayor a los comerciantes  minoristas, siempre recibe las sugerencias y aportes en cuanto a las preferencias en diseños y tiene el gran sueño de tener un taller grande de confecciones y tener más lugares de ventas. Es su crédito número 2 con MFP, se siente muy contento y respaldado financieramente ya que considera que acceder a un crédito es la llave al acceso de mejores oportunidades de inversión y crecimiento de su negocio por lo que esta agradecido. Con el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos necesarios e incrementar su producción de gorros como telas de diferentes colores, hilos y plantillas de gorros deportivos.
texts.en: Jose is 47 years old and lives with his wife, and the youngest of their children, in their own home.  He has 15 years of experience making various types of clothing.  He runs his shop from his home, which lets him work every day in the company of his wife and son, while he also has some free time to study.  With the years of experience he's gained, his high quality work has helped him grow his customer base and increase his sales.   It has also let him identify the best opportunities, such as sport caps, which are very popular in the region and easy to produce quickly and sell.   He sells his caps wholesale to the small shops, who provide him with suggestions on the latest preferences and designs.    Jose's dream is to have a larger business serving even more shops.    This is his second loan with MFP, and Jose feels content that he has this financial support, especially since these loans are key for him to grow his business.  He appreciates this support.   With this loan he will purchase materials needed to increase his production of caps, such as fabrics in different colros, strings, and sports logos.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabric and string needed to make his sports caps.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, es un joven de 23 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de medicina y ropa, vive actualmente con su esposa y una niña de dos años de edad, solo él trabaja para mantener a su familia.
Su trabajo en de forma ambulante, no tiene un horario fijo, y por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería ropa y medicinas, para salir a ofrecer a los clientes, contando con la mercadería necesaria para poder atender a las zonas donde normalmente va a vender.
Su principal aspiración es tener un local fijo donde vender, de esta manera no abandonar a su familia por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Jose is a young man, 23 years old, who lives with his wife and 2-year-old daughter in San Rafael Oriente, in the department of San Miguel. He works selling medicine and clothing, and he is the sole economic supporter of his family.
Jose sells his wares from a moving cart, and he doesn't have fixed hours of operation. He is currently applying for a loan to buy clothing and medicine to offer to his customers in the areas where he usually goes to sell his products. His main goal is to have a fixed place where he can set up his shop, and in this way, he would not have to leave his family for long periods of time to work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for sale.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes actividades como comerciantes y empelados de fabricas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Manuela, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos dos mayores de edad y una chica de 13 años, todos  aun vive con ella, el mayor de ellos estudia en Universidad y la menor en escuela. Su esposo es agricultor.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 16h00, sus hijos le  ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados, los productos los compra en Montecristi y algunos los  recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva 20 años con su negocio y que gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien, le gusta su negocio porque le ha permitido ganarse la vida y estar al tanto de todas las necesidades de sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta porque tiene buenas compañeras en el banco.

Sus metas son mantener su negocio y que crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" holds its meetings in Bajo de Montecristi in the province of Manabí.  It is a small place surrounded by plush vegetation and its inhabitants are involved in different business activities, some being merchants and others factory workers.

Here we meet Mrs. Manuels, age 42, who is married and has three children, two of which are adults and a daughter 13 years old.  They all still live at home and the eldest is in college and the youngest in school.  Her husband is a farmer.

She has a small grocery store in her home and sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oil and detergent, among other things.  She works from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. and her children help her when they are not busy.  She purchases her products in Montecristi and some are delivered to her.  For 20 years she has been in business and it has gone well and allowed her to earn a living while taking care of her children's needs.

The loan will be used to stock the store with more goods such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausage and other basic needs items.  She has been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because she has good friends there.

Her goal is to maintain her business and make it grow day after day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausage and other basic needs products

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité de Kadiamor est créé le 26 Mai 2001. il est composé de sept femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principal est le petit commerce. Le nom du groupe qui est un vocable Diola Signifiant entente. Le groupe fait du Banc Villageois de NIAGUIS NEMA

Madame Binta Sané qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main et la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est marié et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en charge quatre autres enfnats qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle a une expérience avérée dans ce domaine. Elle dispose également d'un congélateur qui lui permet de faire parallèlement la vente de glace et de crème 

Le prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité. les profits qui seront générés lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes. En dehors des besoin familiaux les recettes lui serviront à augmenter son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
The Kadiamor solidarity group was created on 26th May 2001 and is made up of seven women who live in the same village. They are mainly active in small trading businesses. The name of the group is a Diolan term meaning harmony. The group is part of the Banc Villageois in Niaguis Nema. 

Mrs. Binta Sané, who is on the left of the photo and raising her hand, is in charge of the group. She is 56 years old, married and mother to five children. She also takes care of four other children, who have been entrusted to her by relatives.

She has a small business selling vegetables and has a proven experience in this field. She also has a fridge which allows her to sell ice-cream and cream.

The loan will allow her to build up her business, and the profits which she will generate will mean that she can help her husband with the daily expenses. Apart from providing for her family's needs, her income will also allow her to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Mujeres Talentosas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó a través de la Sra. Eladia, quien se había acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. La misma invitó a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida.
Son 16 (Díez y Seis) mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. Ellas  son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas, tienen despensa, almacén, huertas comunitarias y comercializan sus propios productos. Venden artículos de limpieza, mercería, carbón, mandioca, etc.
La Sra. Teresa, con el deseo de superarse por su familia, solicita este crédito con el cual espera tener su propio de negocio de bijouterie, realizando ella misma los objetos con la compra de acrílicos, perlitas, alocates, cadenas, hilos, etc.
texts.en:
This Committee came together thanks to Eladia who had stopped by the Fundación Paraguaya office to get detailed information about the program of the Enterprising Women’s Committee.  She then invited her friends and acquaintances in the neighborhood who decided to add themselves to the group effort to get ahead thus improving their way of life.

They are 16 humble, hard working women who must earn their daily sustenance.  They work independently at their tasks.  Some sell clothes, others sell food or have grocery stores, general stores or community farms; they sell their own products.  They sell cleaning supplies, notions, charcoal, manioc, etc.

Teresa, hoping to get ahead with her family, is asking for this loan that she hopes will help her have her own costume jewelry business.  She will make the items herself.  She will buy acrylics, seed pearls, pincers, chains, string, etc.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry making supplies.

loans.name: José Domingo

texts.es:
Este cliente reside en esta ciudad capital   de Managua, el  señor  José Domingo se ha caracterizado por ser una persona  honrada  trabajadora con buenos valores y principios  morales como persona, debido a que ha sabido  ganarse el aprecio de todos sus  compañeros de trabajo. 
Se presento ante esta oficina  de  Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para ser invertido en  la ampliación de su negocio  tales como compra de materiales de construcción, como  arena cemento, bloques  estribos piedrín y  pago de  mano obra, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia con el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
This client lives in this capital city of Managua.  José Domingo has stood out as a hard working, honest person with good personal values and moral principles since he’s succeeded in winning the esteem of his coworkers.

He came by this Ceprodel office to request a loan to invest in the enlargement of his business.  He will buy building materials and supplies like sand, cement, concrete blocks, struts, gravel and will pay for labor costs to provide his family with a better quality of life with his business’ expansion.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Luisa Lidia

texts.es: La Señora  Luisa se dedica a la venta de juguetes usados americanos ella trae los juguetes en fardos de segunda calidad de Oruro y los vende en La Paz en el mercado de la zona su puesto es ambulante se ubica en la acera o en distintos lugares, es madre de dos hijos, el mayor tiene la edad de 27 años y el menor comprende en la edad de 14 años se encuentra en edad escolar, la señora esta casada con el señor Luis de ocupación carpintero (tallador en madera), realiza su trabajo en forma manual el propósito del préstamo es para traer juguetes de primera calidad de Oruro el cual daría una considerable mejora en sus ingresos elevando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Luisa sells used American toys. She gets the second-hand toys in bundles from Oruro and sells them in La Paz. She sells them in the local market. She has a traveling stand that is located on the sidewalk or in distinct places. She is the mother of two; the oldest is 27 years old, and the younger is 14 years old - school age. She is married to Luis, who is a carpenter. He does manual work. This loan is to get brand new toys from Oruro, which will bring in much better revenue, elevating the family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of toys

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 43 years old and married to Joseph, a driver and small-scale farmer. They have been blessed with nine children aged between nineteen and seven years old.

Emily runs a secondhand clothing shop in Kiptuno trading center which she opened six years ago. From her business Emily earns a profit of 5,000 KES a month.

Emily has asked for a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET Ltd. She anticipates using the loan to purchase stock for her business and top dressing fertilizers for their family’s farm.

Emily will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and save for her children’s education. Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman, be able to give her children the best education possible and to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothing for her shop.

loans.name: Vannessa

texts.es: Vannesa, tiene la edad de 26  años, está casado, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo que son sus mayores prioridades. Ella pretende con su crédito compra los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su finca que está sembrada de café. Ella tiene la plantación ya establecida hace años atrás y lo que querer es mejorarla y así obtenerle mejores resultados este próximo año. Ella quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar familiar y así también generar ganancias para ir saliendo con el crédito adelante y cumplir todas sus metas propuestas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Vannesa is 26 years old, married, and lives with her two children and husband who are her main priorities.  She plans to use her loan to buy the supplies she needs to look after her farm where she is growing coffee.  Vannesa set up her plantation years ago and what she wants is to improve it so that she can obtain better results in the upcoming year.  She would like to make profits for her family's well-being and also so that she can then take another loan and achieve all her goals. 

This is Vannesa's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR offered her this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to take care of her farm

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Like most farmers in his town, he grows rice because it’s the basic food of Filipinos and easier to sell. Eduardo has been a rice farmer for 10 years. He works hard to keep his crops healthy.

Eduardo is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
Nai, 58 years old, has five children. Two are in school while the other three are working, making $10 a day in all. Every month Nai has to spend $70 on food, $20 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.

Nai is a housewife while her husband is a fisherman who makes $5 a day. She is requesting a loan of $250 to buy a motorbike for her children to use to travel to work. In the future she wants to raise livestock at home so that she can make some money to help support the family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to use to travel to work.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.ru:
Анжела замужем. Она родом из Берегово. Анжела предприниматель, который занимается продажей мужской одежды. Она торгует этим товаром на базаре уже около 15 лет. Торговая точка расположена очень удачно, что способствует хорошим продажам. У Анжелы товара на 15 000 гривен. Ее прибыль составляет 3 500 гривен в месяц. 

Анжеле необходим кредит в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар для осеннего сезона. Анжела знает свою профессию и имеет богатый опыт работы, поэтому заранее готовится к похолоданию, что неизменно повлечет за собой повышение спроса на качественную и прочную обувь. Увеличив количество товара, она сможет и увеличить свой доход благодаря дополнительным продажам. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Anzhela is married. She comes from Beregovo. Anzhela is an entrepreneur who sells men's clothing. She has been selling these goods at the market for nearly fifteen years. Her shop is in a very good location, which contributes to good sales. Anzhela's goods are worth 15,000 hryvnia. Her profit is 3,500 hryvnia per month. 

Anzhela needed a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to buy goods for the fall season. Anzhela knows her profession and has extensive experience, so she plans ahead for cooler weather which invariably leads to increased demand for high quality, sturdy shoes. By increasing the quantity of her goods, she can increase her revenue through additional sales.

loans.use: to buy goods for autumn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic merchandise.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 46-year-old married woman, with three sons and two daughters. Her husband and one of her sons are workers with modest salaries. 
Hiyam has her own project, which is raising sheep. She benefits from the sale of sheep products and therefore shares in meeting life's expenses. Hiyam wants to improve her project by purchasing more sheep to increase her income, especially because the area where she lives is known for raising sheep. She has insufficient funds to do this, so she needs to take a loan of 1,500 JOD from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Hiyam gets her FATEN loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will improve her project and purchase more sheep. She will be able to sell more of their products to increase her income, which will improve her family life and bring about better living conditions. 
Hiyam and her husband are photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: to improve her project of raising sheep and purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Barchynai's Group

texts.en:
Barchynai is the leader of this group. She is 61, married, and has four adult children. In order to earn money to meet her and her husband's daily needs, Barchynai breeds cattle. Selling the dairy products, she earns about 2,000 soms per month. Barchynais has saved some money, but she is requesting a loan to purchase a calf for breeding. In the future, she wants to expand her business to leave a good inheritance to her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
Cherrylyn  is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Cherrylyn  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Cherrylyn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cherrylyn  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es:
A sus 51 años de edad Elvia Rosa es una microempresaria luchadora, dedicada a la venta de Aceites y Lubricantes para Vehículos, que nunca se ha dejado vencer por las dificultades, por el contrario se ha dedicado a su negocio.

Años atrás cuando su esposo murió pese al dolor y la tristeza, tomo la decisión de mudarse a vivir con sus padres que son personas ya de avanzada edad, con el fin de ayudarles con sus gastos, cuidar de ellos y al mismo tiempo contar con su colaboración. Por eso con la ilusión de seguir progresando, Elvia solicita un préstamo para comprar mas insumos ó inventario necesarios para aumentar sus ventas y proporcionalmente mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de sus padres ya que dejándolos trabajar en su negocio, los ayuda a sentirse útiles y felices.
texts.en:
At the age of 51 Elvia Rosa is a tenacious micro businesswoman who works selling oil and lubricants for vehicles.  She’s never let herself be defeated by difficulties; on the contrary, she’s dedicated herself to her business.

When her husband died years ago despite the sadness and pain she made the decision to move in with her parents who are of an advanced age in order to help them financially and take care of them while at the same time having their cooperation.  

Because of this and with the hope of continuing to make progress, Elvia is asking for a loan to buy more stock merchandise for her inventory to increase sales and improve her and her parents’ quality of life proportionately because allowing them to work in her business helps them to feel useful and happy.

loans.use: to buy oil and lubricant.

loans.name: Korokoro M.s.h.g Group

texts.en:
Kituyi is the facilitator of Korokoro M.S.H group. Kituyi and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Kituyi takes care of 11 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Kituyi had an excellent maize yield harvesting 22 bags on 1  acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Kituyi was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Kituyi and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Kituyi will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Korokoro M.S.H group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is married with four children. For five years, she has been owning a clothing business. However, she faces a challenge of the business being seasonal. Her personal goal is to build a permanent house for her family and educate her children.

She hopes to expand her business to new markets. Hadijah needs a loan to stock clothes to sell in order to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos 4 dos quais frequentam a Escola.Fez a 12ª clase e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo a procura de emprego,é recepcionista no Partido Frelimo ha mais de 9 anos e tem um salario de 5.390.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos,conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(blocos, areia, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros.).Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 6.000.00mt, 7.500.00mt, 11.000.00mt, e 13.500.00mt, para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Chibuto, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. He is married and has five children, four of which attend school. He completed 12th grade and stopped because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and does not support anyone else.
He left Gaza for Maputo in search of a job. He has been a receptionist for the Frelimo Party for over nine years and earns a salary of 5.390mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 12.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (cinder blocks, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.). The other loans were for 6.000mt, 7.500mt, 11.000mt and 13.500mt, for personal housing.
He pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building and furnishing his house. For that purpose he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (cinder blocks, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Abdellahatif

texts.en:
Abdellahatif is a 35-year-old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of 11 and 2 months. Two of them go to school. 

Abdellahatif has run a food store for three years. He has no employees. Abdellatif heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion done by the loan officers in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 2,000 to purchase items like wheat flour, washing soap, detergent, sugar and many others. Abdellahatif has no other source of income aside from this business. 

In 5 years time, Abdellahatif hopes he will have a better life and maybe have a good house.  

His major challenges include the low income and high cost of living in Juba.

Abdellahatif says that he appreciates that Finance Sudan also considers men for loans because some of the MFIs only consider women.

loans.use: to purchase items like wheat flour, washing soap, sugar and many others.

loans.name: Ta`e

texts.en:
Ta`e is 49 years of age and is married with 6 children.
Ta'e owns & operates a business venture, providing dress making services to local community members.  She has 5 years of experience in this business.    Ta'e needs a loan of WST $2450 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Ta'e joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ta'e's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her dress-making business

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es: La señora Diana María a sus 31 años es una emprendedora quien conciente de la necesidad de sacar a sus tres hijos adelante, decide iniciar hace tres años en la acera de su casa la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas y fritos, trabajando todos los días en las mañanas y noches, gracias a este negocio puede generar los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. Con el ánimo de ingresar a sus hijos a estudiar para que se preparen y tengan un mejor futuro, la señora Diana María necesita de la compra de un carro para preparar comidas rápidas e insumos con el fin de mejorar el servicio que presta y así a la espera que sus ventas mejoren para poder cumplir sus sueños y brindarle un mejor bienestar a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Diana María is 31 years old. She is an entrepreneur who knows the necessity of providing for her 3 children. 

She began 3 years ago on the footpath outside her house to make and sell fast and fried food, working every day, morning and night. Thanks to this business she can earn income to take care of her home. 

With the idea of putting her children in school to prepare them to have a better future, Diana María needs to buy a food cart in order to prepare fast food and get supplies to improve the service she has and thus she hopes that her sales will go up, and she can fulfill her dreams of giving her three children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a food cart so she can prepare fast food and to buy supplies

loans.name: Rean

texts.en:
Rean is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Rean has a vulcanizing shop that provides motorcycle and vehicle repairs . She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and materials for the vulcanizing shop.

Rean has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials for the vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Leena is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Majdi appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the herd next to sheep he owns.

Leena is a 29-year-old young woman. She is married to Majdi and a mother to one son and two daughters. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Leena's husband has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Leena is requesting a $2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and improve the herd's condition

loans.name: Constantin

texts.en: Constantin lives in one of Moldova’s most wine production intensive regions. He knows and loves wine, as someone accustomed to working the vineyards and tasting the harvest. He sells most of the grapes from his own vineyards to the many local wineries, of course keeping a few for traditional house wine. In the future, he also hopes to open a small bed-and-breakfast to capture some of Moldova’s growing rural tourism market. For now, Constantin will try simply to further develop his vineyards, and for this needs a small cultivator, fertilizer and new vines.

loans.use: Vineyard Expansion

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia M., aged twenty-nine years, is a youth and an elei printer by experience. Both her husband and she are self-employed in their business. Itagia came up with the idea of developing this business through our culture. In Samoan villages, we are not allowed to walk around with shorts; we must have a lavalava--a piece of material wrapped around the waist. From this Itagia came up the idea of printing flowers and different decorations on the lavalavas to persuade people to buy from her. Her business has become successful with not only the locals but also the tourists buying this lavalava  to wear as a sarong to the beach. She’s now aiming to learn more about printing on different types of materials and to expand her market overseas.

loans.use: Buy paints, glitter, and materials for printing

loans.name: Silalotalie

texts.en:
Silalotalie has a vision for the future. Silalotalie is one of the older members in the program, and she is an honest and hard worker. This is Silalotalie’s seventh loan, and she has no arrears on her repayment performance.

Silalotalie is a woman who can do a man’s work. She may look fragile when you see her, but she is very strong. She operates two businesses together: a shop and a plantation. The ideas and planning are hers. She thinks that the plantation is helpful and supportive for the shop and for family food so that no money will be spent on buying taro or bananas. She would like to use the loan to restock the shop and buy planting tools.

loans.use: To purchase goods to restock the shop and planting tools for the plantation

loans.name: Edwin Omar

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Edwin Omar, I’m a merchant, I have a small business of selling new clothes for both men and women, located in the market of my city. I have been doing this type of activity for several years; it generates an income to cover my family’s expenses and other obligations I have with suppliers. Thanks to this income I’m being able to build my house little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Edwin Omar, soy comerciante, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva para ambos sexos, ubicado en la plaza de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a los ingresos que percibo de este negocio estoy construyendo mi casa poco a poco.

loans.use: Buy trousers, jeans for both men and woman, blouses, dresses for girls, underewear, etc.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 49 years old and married with seven children. He and his family live in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region. Every day, Murad goes to his shop to sell goods. However the turnover is very low, because having so big a family (10 people) he is not able to save enough money to invest in his business, once he has paid for his family's basic living expenses.

Therefore, Murad has decided to request a $600 loan from Normicro Saatli branch to enable him to purchase a greater variety of goods for his shop and increase the shop's daily turnover. It makes good business sense for him to repay this loan in small monthly instalments. This arrangement will allow him to maintain a steady monthly income as well as save some money each month which he can use to invest in his business.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 32 years old, married with four children. She sells cotton materials in the market of Kabala in Sierra Leone. She started her business on a very small scale, purchasing the materials by the meter and selling them in the neighborhoods.

With her previous loans, Jerry got a stall in the market and also increased her stock. Jerry’s plan now is to purchase the materials wholesale so she can make a better profit. A loan of US$ 275 will provide her with a good chance at expansion.

loans.use: Purchase her materials wholesale for additional profit.

loans.name: Gulshemen

texts.en:
Gulshemen A. is a 52-year-old widow who keeps her sheep herd in the southern region of Azerbaijan in the Bilasuvar region. She is an internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. She has fifteen years of experience in sheep breeding. Gulshemen lost her husband many years ago and raised her son alone. Now her son is a second year high school student, and her sheep herd is the only  source to cover her son's needs.
Gulshemen sells mutton to the local bazaar traders and it brings her good income. The mutton is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use meat in their everyday cuisine. October-December are the weeding season months in Azerbaijan. During this time price for mutton rises and demand is getting very high. That’s why Gulshemen decided that it is her chance to improve her life conditions. She has applied for  800 USD with a repayment term of15 months. She is going to purchase ten sheep each for 60 USD and fodder for 200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Mohammad Ali

texts.en: Mohammad Ali lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two sons. He lives with his own family. He has a retail shop in one of the crowded places of Kabul. He has a lot of clients. He would like to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock. He wants to make a good income to help his family and enroll his two sons in a good education center in Kabul. He is happy now.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur J. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli city of Azerbaijan. Now he lives with his family in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. He has been engaged in sheep-breeding for more than five years. He has good experience in this business. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $1200 to purchase 15 sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Elegantes, Group 2

texts.en:
Edlina is a young woman who lives with her husband in small community in Puerto Plata. They are both originally from Haiti but have come to the Dominican Republic to find better work and a more prosperous life.

Edlina travels once a week to Santiago, a city about an hour away, to purchase clothing and other miscellaneous items. She sells these items in her community, either from her home or by walking up and down the streets showing people her merchandise. It has been very hard for her to make enough profit to pay for the bus rides and to cover other business expenses. Currently, she and her husband are renting a small house but her biggest dream is to one day have a home of her own.

She wants to thank everyone who is supporting her loan and has taken the time to read about her life and business. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and on behalf of Edlina, we thank you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase clothing and miscellaneous accessories

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is 40 years old and is married with three children, ages 12-20 years old. She and her husband also take care of three other children, ages 12-20 years old. Aysha sells clothes and food, which she started doing in 2006. She works every day from 10:30 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Judith's Tusshiamane Group

texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old and is a widow with 4 children, ages 23, 18, 15 and 12 years old. Judith owns a small food vendor store and she is a charcoal seller, which she started in 2004. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have a shop and businesses dealing in vegetable sales and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.name: Ly Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
A Village Bank in Khsom Village consists of twenty-nine members. Mrs. Ly C. is the Village Bank President. She is a 38-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are studying in state school. Her husband, Mr. Sopha Mao, is a farmer in the local village.

She is a fish-seller, so she buys fish to re-sell in the village. Her business is doing well, but she would now like to expand the business. Unfortunately, Mrs. Ly C. has insufficient money to purchase more fish; thus, Mrs. Ly C. is requesting a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mrs. Ly C. obtained a loan from Amret Co., Ltd., which enabled her start her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing more fish for resale purposes.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun V. is a 28-year-old widow who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her child. Since 2005 she has been running a small shop selling rice and coffee. She also lives with her sister, Chhun Tola, who handles renting out rooms from their home to workers who live in the area. V. is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to invest $300 into her rice business and to put $700 towards the construction of additional rooms onto her house so that she can expand her room rental business.

loans.use: To invest more into her rice business and to finance construction of adding rooms to her house to rent out

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben started his business because he wanted to become more independent and have his own business rather than earning his wages elsewhere since, as his family grew so did their expenses and he wanted earn more to support his family. His eldest daughter has started school and he wants to see his children succeed. Ruben has worked since he was young selling household items, at one point helping his brother who was a travelling salesman. It was in 1981 that he opened his own business. Things have gone well for him and he has been able to buy a truck which he now uses to transport his products.

Ruben is looking for a loan of US $400, which he will repay in four months, to purchase more merchandise to provide a greater variety of products for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Ruben inició el negocio porqué quería independizarse y tener su propio negocio y no estar asalariado, en ese entonces contrajo matrimonio y como la familia comenzó a crecer, también los gastos se fueron haciendo más grandes, ante la falta de dinero para poder mantener a su familia, ya que su hija mayor comenzó a estudiar y el quería sacarlos adelante. Comenzó a trabajar en la venta de artículos para el hogar desde muy joven como ayudante de su hermano que era vendedor ambulante, pero fue en al año de 1981 cuando se independizo e inició su propio negocio y le empezó a ir muy bien, lo cual le permitió adquirir una camioneta donde actualmente transporto sus productos.

El necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más artículos para el hogar que le permitan tener un mejor surtido para atender las necesidades de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mirnesa

texts.en:
Mirnesa has one child. She lives with her family in the village of Ba Igovci, near the town ŽIvinice. Her husband has a full-time construction job in Slovenija.

This is Mirnesa's first loan, and she will use the money to buy chickens. Her wish is to buy and sell poultry in order to make more money for her family as well as produce healthy meat for them to eat. Mirnesa will sell some chickens during the winter and use others in her household. Her wish is to sell chicken as much as she can in order to earn money and to save it for the spring when she will buy new chicken.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell and eat during the winter.

loans.name: Bir Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Bir Maiya M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Khokhana. Khokhana is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. M. opened her grocery store three years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different verieties of grocery items such as rice, maize, biscuits, noodles, etc. in her shop. In this coming month, the Nepalese celebrate their main festivals, Dashain and Tihar. People buy lots of goods for these festivals, so Mrs. M. is requesting for Rs 15000.00 loan to invest in her shop to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Dipendra M., works in a private office. Both her daughter and son are studying in Higher Secondary School.

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Omer

texts.fr: Monsieur D. K. Omer est un jeune homme marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est né à Afagnan en 1969 où il réside encore. Mécanographe de profession, il associe à son travail l’activité de photocopie. Connaissant bien les recettes qui sortent de cette activité, Monsieur D. Omer veut acheter un nouveau photocopieur par un financement afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins de sa famille notamment sur les plans sanitaire, alimentaire, scolaire et professionnel.
texts.en:
Mr. Omer K. D. is a young married man, father of 2 children. He was born in Afagnan in 1969 and he lives there still. Computer operator by profession, he also offers photocopy services. Since he is well aware of the remunerative nature of this business, Mr. D. wants to buy a new photocopier with this loan, in order to better satisfy the needs of his clientele. The profit will allow him to better cater for the numerous needs of his family, especially those concerning health, food, schooling and professional training.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a photocopier

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.es:
Sulpicia es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Sulpicia es casada, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Sulpicia vende comida de manera ambulatoria en un lugar llamado 5 esquinas que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza hace muchos años, la especialidad de Sulpicia son anticuchos (preparados a base de corazón), rachi (preparada con los intestinos), durante el día prepara y condimenta la carne con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Sulpicia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne, papa, pollo.
Los sueños de Sulpicia son terminar de cancelar de unos terrenos que compro, techar el tercer piso de su casa y el matrimonio de su ultimo hijo.
texts.en:
Sulpicia is a member of the Banco Comunal Claveles. Sulpicia is a 53-year-old married mother of three children. She sells food at a place called five corners in the center of the city. She has been selling food for many years. Her speciality is anticuchos (a quechuan skewered meat prepared in a base of the animal's heart) and rachi (a grilled beef tripe prepared with the animal's intestines). During the day she prepares and seasons the meat with the help of her children. Sulpicia asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of meat, potatoes and chicken. Sulpicia's dreams are to finish paying off territories she purchased, to shingle the third floor of her house, and to see her oldest son marry.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of meat, potatoes and chicken

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 19 años, es conviviente, tiene una sola hija, por el momento están viviendo en la casa de sus padres. Es de familia de agricultores, su esposo también es agricultor, entonces existen los mismos deseos de reprosperar en esta actividad, por ello han decidido sembrar varias hectáreas de papa y otras de arveja, porque para ellos la agricultura es muy rentable cuando se le dedica tiempo, eso aprendió de sus padres. Esta joven pareja tiene muchas esperanzas de prosperar en la agricultura para comprarse una casa en la ciudad, pero para conseguir eso, tienen que seguir sembrando papas, verduras y flores. Es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, Nilda es una pagadora puntual y responsable. En esta oportunidad solicita el dinero para mandar a labrar 2 hectáreas de sus tierras para la siembra de papa y olluco, y de ese modo generarse más ingresos económicos para el próximo año.
texts.en:
Nilda is 19 years old, lives with her partner and has just one daughter. Currently she is living in her parents´ house. She is from a family of farmers. Her husband is also a farmer so they have the same desire to succeed in this activity. They decided to plant several hectares with potatoes and peas because agriculture is very profitable for them when they devote time to it; they learned this from their parents. This young couple hopes to be successful in farming so they can buy a house in the city. But to achieve this they must keep planting potatoes, vegetables and flowers. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Nilda is a punctual and responsible payer. This time the loan she requests is to hire someone to work 2 hectares of her land to plant potatoes and olluco (a small, potato-like tuber), and in this way generate more earnings for the next year.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay workers to cultivate her fields.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: La señora Flora tiene 61 años, es madre soltera, en la actualidad vive con su hijo y sus nietos a quienes ama mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y cigarrillos en las instalaciones de un recreo turístico muy reconocido en su región, esta labor la viene haciendo desde hace 5 años atrás y le gusta mucho porque conoce a mucha gente que la aprecian mucho por su buena atención y amabilidad, además este negocio le es rentable porque es la única persona que vende estos productos en este recreo. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a construir un kiosco para ya no tener que caminar por toda la zona y vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Flora is 61 years old, is a single mother, and currently lives with her son and her grandchildren who she loves a lot. She works selling sweets and cigarettes in the installations of a very recognized tourist complex in her region. She has been doing this work for the past 5 years and she likes it very much because she meets many people who appreciate her for her good attention and kindness. In addition, this business is profitable for her because she is the only person who sells these products in this complex. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has committed to make her payments in a punctual way. With the money requested she will have a kiosk built to not have to walk through the area and sell with greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for the sale of her products

loans.name: Grupo Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Las Flores es originario de la comarca Palo Quemado que pertenece al municipio de Diriomo, está compuesto por tres integrantes : Rosa del Carmen O. R., Sadia Isabel M. M., Araceli de los Ángeles S. L.., son mujeres trabajadoras y humildes.
Doña Rosa del Carmen de 35 años, una mujer joven que vende refrescos, helados, enchiladas, etc.; los elabora y vende  en su casa, tiene clientes de su comunidad. Es casada, su esposo es trabajador del campo, tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar que estudian en la escuela cercana. 
Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad desde que compró su refrigeradora y pensó en apoyar a su esposo en los gastos. Además va a vender golosinas y surtir su negocio para un día poder llegar a tener una pulpería, sueña ver un negocio instalado que atienda a la comunidad.
texts.en:
The group Las Flores (The Flowers) are natives of the Palo Quemado region in the Diriomo municipality. The group is comprised of 3 members: Rosa del Carmen O. R., Sadia Isabel M. M. and Araceli de los Ángeles S. L. who are humble and hard-working women. Mrs. Rosa del Carmen is 35 years old, a young woman who sells soft drinks, ice cream, enchiladas, etc. which she make and sell in her home to clients in her community. She is married and her husband works in the field. They have 4 school age children that study in a nearby school. It has been 5 years since she bought her refrigerator and thought to help support her husband with the expenses. She is going to add the sale of snacks and supply her business for a day when she will be able to have a store installed to cater to the community.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan is needed to buy fruit, perishables, bags, etc.

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Elles sont toutes mariées, les membres du groupe Wassa  ont  en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies  dans le village de Tinimbougou, préfecture de Dioila région de Koulikoro, république du Mali. 
 Avec l’idée de développer leurs activités commerciales, ces femmes ont intégré l’institution  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Tous les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles veulent acheter avec ce prêt, 30 pièces de 6 pagnes auprès des commerçants grossistes de Dioila pour être revendus en détail au comptant et à crédit dans le village de Tinimbougou. La clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ces femmes espèrent  avoir avec ce prêt,  7500 FCFA de bénéfice chacune qui sera utilisé dans l’entretien de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
All married, the women of the Wassa group average 32 years of age and 3 children. They live in extended traditional families in the village of Tinimbougou, in the prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. In view of bolstering their businesses, these women joined Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). All former loans were repaid without problems.

With this loan, they intend to buy 30 pieces of 6 pagnes (colorful African cloth) from wholesalers in Dioïla, to retail them for cash or on credit in Tinimbougou. Their clientele comprises both men and women. With this loan, these women hope to turn a profit of XOF 7'500 (ca US$ 15) each, to be used to provide for their children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia S. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, vive en el Jr. Leticia Nº 1090, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que todavía dependen de ella. 

Se inicio con S/. 500.00, por iniciativa propia decidió a sacar el préstamo. Y abrir su propio negocio. Tiene 05 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continua con la  venta de Abarrotes, con el préstamo de S/3,000.00  para ser pagado en 6 meses comprará nuevos  productos para surtir su negocio como: útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, cartulinas, en cientos  que tendrán demanda en esta época de inicio de clases. 

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, ahora se siente más Mujer, comunicativa y orgullosa, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Sonia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Sonia S. C. is a member of the Tesoro Escondido (Hidden Treasure) Village Bank and lives in the Department of San Martín. She is 37 and has two children who are still dependent. On her own initiative she decided to take out her first loan, for 500 soles, to open her own business. She has been working with the Village Bank for 5 years. She still sells groceries, and with her loan of 3,000 soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, she'll stock her business with school supplies by the hundreds, including notebooks, pens, pencils, and cardstock, that will be in high demand as the school year begins. It's Sonia who decides how to use her business's income and now she feels more empowered as a woman, communicates better and has more pride in herself. She is more responsible with her payments and makes her own decisions. Sonia is very appreciative of Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businessperson and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new products in bulk, including notebooks, pens, pencils, and cardstock.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul A. is 36 years old and married with a child. He sells planks. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. The demand for his planks is high and he hopes to meet the demand of his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks  to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
JUANA GARCÍA A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Madre de Dios Nº 547, en el barrio “El Arenal”, en el distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 66 años de edad,  es comerciante independiente y su esposo es pensionista.  Tienen 8 hijos.

Ella tiene 4 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar materiales para dedicarse a la costura, oficio que desempeño durante muchos años, pero por motivo de dolores en sus piernas lo abandonó e incursionó en la venta de gaseosas y lencería. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará prendas de vestir (ropas), lencería, gaseosas, golosinas y dará mantenimiento del motokar de su hijo, quien la ayuda a solventar gastos del hogar.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya por medio de los créditos  a financiar sus gastos en momentos difíciles.
texts.en:
JUANA GARCÍA A. belongs to the community bank “Las Margaritas”. Her home is located in Jr. Madre de Dios Nº 547, in the neighbourhood “El Arenal”, in the district of Callería, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 66 years old and is an independent merchant. Her husband is a pensioner. They have 8 children. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 4 years. The first loan she received was for S/ 300 Nuevos Soles. She used it to buy materials to work as a seamstress, work that she has done for many years, but because of pain in her legs she abandoned it and began working with selling soda pop and lingerie. With this loan of S/2,000 Nuevos Soles, she would buy things to wear (clothing), lingerie, soda pop, sweets, and do maintenance on her son’s motorcar, who helps her to meet the household expenses. She feels grateful to Manuela Ramos, because of the help of the loans to finance her expenses in difficult times.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy things to wear (underwear).  To buy sweets, soda pop.  To maintain a motorcar.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juanita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Prolongación Alfonso Ugarte   Nº 114 –, Distrito D. Juanjui, Departamento D. San Martín. Es viuda, tiene 73 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, 02 D. los cuales aun dependen D. ella y son los que le ayudan en el negocio. Con la seguridad D. tener una buena sazón para la preparación D. diferentes tipos D. comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio D. venta D. comida diaria tipo menú, ubicando su negocio en los interiores del mercado D. Abastos D. la ciudad D. Juanjui. En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuD. a su puesto D. venta, donD. ella los atienD. con el carisma que le caracteriza. 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00 que cancelara en un plazo D. 06 meses, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como sacos D. arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Pese a la edad que tiene se siente aun con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vejez tranquita, Juanita, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Juanita belongs to the “Las Trabajadoras” community bank. She lives at Prolongación Alfonso Ugarte Nº 114 –, Juanjui district , San Martín department. She is a 73 year old widow with six children. Two of her children are still dependent upon her, and they help her with the business. With the security of having a special touch for preparing different types of foods, with her own initiative, and with her first loan for 300 PEN, she started her business. She sells menu item type foods daily. Her business is located insiD. the food market in the city of Juanjui. In spite of all the time passed, she continues with the same business. She can count on loyal customers who go to her stall daily where she waits on them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 1,500 PEN, which she will repay in six months, she will buy ingredients for daily food preparation like sacks of rice, sugar, packages of oil, live chickens in crates, and some kitchen utensils to use in her business to give her customers better service. In spite of her age, she still feels she has lots of strength to keep working and get ahead to assure herself of a peaceful old age. Juanita is grateful to the Moviemiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the completion of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy supplies like rice, sugar, packages of oil, chicken, utensils

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Reyna H. tiene 38 años de edad, habitante del barrio loma de Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos. Los planes de corto plazo es la terminación de su humilde vivienda.
Doña Reyna es comerciante de productos de gran consumo entre la comunidad vende cuajadas, tortillas y cabeza de chancho. Desde hace 10 años ella tiene centralizada a su clientela ya que inicio por la  calle vendiendo tortillas.Como toda mujer emprendedora tiene planes de expandirse como tortillería obteniendo mayores ganancias.
Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara puertas y ventanas para instalarla en su habitación. Teniendo seguridad y protección ya que se cubren con cortina y unos reglones de madera en el centro para proteger.

loans.use: Comprar puertas y ventana para estar segura

loans.name: Mirsada

texts.en:
Mirsada D. was born in 1979 and comes from the suburbs of the town of Živinice. She is married and has one son who is in primary school.

Mirsada’s husband works now outside of Bosnia and Mirsada spent all the savings to provide him with needed documents, paying all the costs related to that. She had to sell two calves to survive the time before her husband got his salary.

Mirsada was already a user of a Kiva loan. She repaid her previous loan on time and is now requesting the new one. Mirsada requested the loan of 1,200 KM from WWI (Žene za Žene International) to buy a young steer. She has enough cattle feed and hopes to earn a good profit from reselling that steer. Mirsada`s wish is to have a food stall.

loans.use: To purchase a young steer

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina N. is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of three children who are in school.

Faustina sells washing supplies like detergents, soaps, bleaches, etc. She does her selling through hawking - that is, house to house selling. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to sell to her customers at their doorsteps.

Faustina needs the loan the enable her to inject more capital into her business to make progress. She plans to use the loan to buy more supplies of detergents to increase her stock. This will make more income to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy more washing supplies like detergents, bleach, soap, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice O. is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She fries and sells chin-chin. "Chin-chin" is a type of pastry in Nigeria that is made from flour, sugar, and baking powder. She is requesting the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more bags of flour to fry more chin-chin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour to sell

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. Currently her child is in school. She sells smoked fish and started her fish sales eight years ago at the community market where she lives. She buys her stock of fish from Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She has a customer base that she supplies with fish when she returns from her trek. She sometimes sells some in the city center of Kumasi. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She requests a loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her child and the unborn children a quality education through the proceeds from the business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Juana es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Juana venD. materiales D. construcción en un local propio, además reparte los materiales a domicilio con el apoyo D. su esposo.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arena.
Los sueños D. Juana son tener una ferretería y comprar un carro granD. para su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de arena.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthy L., age 43 (shown in the picture with his wife), and his wife, Mrs. Sreymao Em, age 41, live along national road number one approximately 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have got five children: four daughters and one son. Two of them were married and live outside the family home and other three attend school. 

Chanthy has been driving remoque taxi for 15 years, while his wife has been growing vegetables for 10 years. A remoque is a motorbike attached with a trailer at the back. He carries goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh and back. He is able to earn 20,000.00 riel/day (about 5 USD).

Unluckily, Chanty’s remoque beaks down in some parts and it doesn’t work properly so he is applying for his first loan of $500 to repair it and he will use a part of the loan to repair a house where he lives as well.

loans.use: To repair his remoque and repair a house where he lives.

loans.name: Angela Veronica

texts.es:
Ángela Verónica Z. López  es socia del  Banco Comunal Dinámicas ubicado en el cantón  Tosagua a una hora de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí. Ella está casada desde hace 24 años fruto de su matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 22 y 21 años, el mayor de ellos está casado, el esposo  de Angela tiene un transporte público de pasajeros en la localidad. Actualmente ella junto a su familia viven en la casa de su suegra en un departamento independiente.

Ángela se dedica al comercio  informal desde hace veinte años,  se inició vendiendo  ropa puerta a puerta,  con el pasar del tiempo fue incrementando  otra mercaderia   logrando  que su negocio crezca.  Ella ha improvisado un pequeño bazar en su casa con unas vitrinas para exhibir su mercadería, tiene a la venta carteras, ropa para damas caballeros y niños, productos de belleza, zapatos y mas, en la mañana  atiende en el  local  y por la tarde  visita a sus clientes en sus domicilios dejándoles mercadería a crédito, de esa manera se gana la vida, recorre a pie la ciudad y esta contenta con su trabajo y no piensa  cambiarlo.

En  esta época del año  Ángela invierte mas capital ya que considera una buena época para las ventas por eso esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir  en la compra de  mas mercadería pues tiene ya varios pedidos de pantalones, blusas, zapatos, bisutería y más.

Para  Ángela al igual que muchas otras socias del banco comunal  estan seguras que realizar sus sueños no es imposible y con la ayuda de la Fundación  ella espera poder construir su propia casa y esta segura poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
Ángela Verónica Z. López is member of the community bank Dinámicas, located in the Tosagua County, one hour from Portoviejo, in the Manabí province. She has been married for 24 years. The offspring of this marriage are her two sons, 22 and 21 years old. Her older son is married. Ángela’s husband has a public transportation service business in the city. Currently, she and her family live in her mother-in-law’s house, in an independent apartment.

Ángela has been dedicated to the informal market for 20 years. She started selling clothes door-to-door. With time, she incremented her merchandise, which helped her business grow. She has improvised a small bazaar at her house, with some showcases to exhibit her merchandise. She sells wallets, women, men and children clothes, beauty products, shoes and other products.
