In the morning she receives her customers at the house bazaar and in the afternoon she visits her customers at their homes, offering them on credit merchandise. She makes a living this way. She goes around the city on foot but she is happy with her work and does not think of switching it.

This time of the year, Ángela invests more capital, since she considers this period a good selling season. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan to invest in buying more merchandise. She has many pre-orders for pants, blouses, shoes, costume jewelry and others.

Ángela, as many other members of the community bank, is certain that it is not impossible to realize her dreams. With the help of the Fundación she hopes to build her own house and she is confident that she will able to do it.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the buying of merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shoes and costume jewelry

loans.name: Anadina Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Anadina del Carmen tiene la edad de 30 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino, su esposo conductor en una empresa constructora, tiene tres hijos de 5,9 y 15 años de edad, estudiantes, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante y venta por encargo, lleva tres años de experiencia en el negocio. Su meta es terminar de construir su casa para darle mejor comodidad y seguridad a su familial como objetivo es incrementar sus ventas y tener mejores utilidades. Con este nuevo crédito comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento y hierro para poder hacer un cuarto seguro y cómodo, ya que cuando construyo su pequeño y humilde casa la hizo con zinc, con la esperanza de que cada día podrá construir lo mejor para sus hijos, y que todo comienzo es difícil. Se siente feliz por el financiamiento ya que lograra comenzar la construcción.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer un cuarto

loans.name: Burmabubu's Group

texts.ru:
Мамбеталиева Бурмабубу – лидер данной группы. Бурмабубу разводит скот и продаёт молоко. Бурмабубу начала разводить хозяйство после того, как родители оставили часть скотины ей в наследство. Бурмабубу с детства была хорошо знакома с этим занятием и не испытала особых трудностей в продолжении семейного ремесла. Род деятельности супруга Бурмабубу немного иной. Её муж работает учителем физкультуры в средней школе. Вместе они вырастили пятерых детей. Старшей дочери тридцать три. Младшему сыну двадцать один. Обе дочери замужем, живут отдельно. Двое сыновей работают в Бишкеке, а один работает в милиции и живёт с родителями. Все дети и муж по мере возможности помогают Бурмабубу по хозяйству. Совместными усилиями Бурмабубу и её семье удалось построить большой дом, сарай. Хозяйство, которое развела Бурмабубу, сыграло большую роль при выдаче дочерей замуж, а также когда женили сыновей. Только от продажи молока Бурмабубу зарабатывает 1700 сомов в месяц ($40). Сейчас главная цель Бурмабубу – это женить младшего сына. Но прежде она хочет как следует подготовиться, увеличив предварительно поголовье скота. Для этого она решила обратиться за кредитом и купить двух телят.

А также в группе Бурмабубу есть Дамира Бакиева, Абишева Улбосын и Куланчиева Дарья.

Дамире Бакиевой почти шестьдесят. Дамира мать шестерых детей. Из них только младшая дочка живёт с родителями. Дамира занимается животноводством, хотя многие люди её возраста уже давно сидят дома и за ними ухаживают дети. Дамира также продаёт молоко, что позволяет ей вполне удовлетворять свои повседневные потребности. Ведь её доход от молока составляет ни многим, ни меньшим две тысяча восемьсот сомов. Дамире нужен кредит, чтобы купить двух баранов. 

Абишевой Улбосын сорок семь. Вместе с мужем Улбосын уже занимается животноводством, перепродажей скота, а также продажей молока. Их ежемесячный доход составляет около десяти тысяч сомов. Это примерно седьмая часть их первоначального взноса. Улбосын хочет получить кредит и купить четыре овцы. В будущем она планирует разводить овец в кашаре, а на доходы от продажи скота, обучить дочку зарубежом.

Куланчиевой Дарье сорок семь лет. Она вырастила троих детей. Вместе с сыновьями она разводит скот и занимается перепродажей скота, а также продаёт молоко. Благодаря животноводству Дарья без особых тягот вырастила детей, и улучшила жизненный уровень. Она обучила детей, как правильно следить за скотиной и потихоньку передаёт всё хозяйство в их руки. Дарья решила получить кредит с целью купить четыре овцы для разведения.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Burmabubu M. is the leader of this group. Burmabubu breeds livestock and sells milk. She started to develop this business after inheriting some of the livestock from her parents. Burmabubu familiarized herself well with this trade since childhood and experienced no real difficulties with continuing the family business. Her husband’s specialty is a bit different. He works as a physical education teacher at a secondary school. Together, they raised five children. The oldest daughter is thirty years old. The youngest son is twenty-one. Both of the daughters are married and live separately. Two of the sons work in Bishkek, and one works for the police and lives with the parents. All of the children and the husband help Burmabubu with the household business as much as possible. Burmabubu’s and her family’s joint effort enabled them to build a big house and a barn. The business that Burmabubu developed played a significant role in marrying off the daughters and also marrying the sons. Burmabubu earns 1700 som ($40) per month just from milk sales. Burmabubu’s current main goal is to marry her youngest son. However, she has to get well prepared for this by increasing the livestock headcount. She decided to request a loan and purchase two calves for this purpose.

Burmabubu’s group also includes Damira B., Ulbosyn A. and Darya K..

Damira B. is almost sixty years old. Damira is a mother of six children. Out of all the children, only the youngest daughter lives with the parents. Damira is involved in animal husbandry, even though many people her age stay home and get cared for by their children. Damira also sells milk, which allows her to fully provide for her daily needs. Her income from milk sales is no more and no less than two thousand eight hundred som. Damira needs a loan in order to purchase two rams.

Ulbosyn A. is forty-seven years old. Together with her husband, Ulbosyn is already involved in animal husbandry, sales of livestock and also sale of milk. Their monthly income is about ten thousand som. This is approximately one seventh of their original contribution. Ulbosyn wants to obtain a loan and purchase four sheep. In the future, she plans to breed sheep in a shed and use the income from sale of livestock to educate her daughter abroad.

Darya K. is forty-seven years old. She raised three children. Together with her sons, Darya breeds livestock and is involved in livestock sales, and also sells milk. Thanks to animal husbandry, Darya raised her children without real difficulties and improved her quality of life. She educated her children how to correctly take care of livestock and is slowly transitioning the business to them. Darya decided to obtain a loan with the goal of purchasing four sheep for breeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet R. is from the village of Dullan. She is 32 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Juliet and her husband own and operate a quarrying business, selling sand and gravel in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Phann Chok Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people living in Kruos village in Takeo province made up this village bank loan.  Phann C. is a bank president who selected the members.  They will use their loans for different purposes.  She is a fruit seller.  Her husband is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice.  They have a child who is a tailor.  Since her business is going well, she wants to expand by purchasing more cloths for sewing to support her customers.

loans.use: Buy more cloths for sewing to increase sales.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - J.” desde hace 12 años atrás, del distrito de J., provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, cuenta con estudios primarios incompletos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella.
Juana se dedica a la artesanìa y ganaderìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, fideos.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar bayeta.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en J..
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
For twelve years Juana has been a member of the "Santa Rosa de Lima--J." Village Bank in the J. District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 42 and did not complete primary school. She's married and has three dependent children. She earns her living making handicrafts and raising cattle. She tells us that she used her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 300 soles, to buy groceries, including sugar, rice, and noodles. She is seeking a loan for 500 soles which she'll use to buy fabric. Her dream for the future is to have her own house in J.. What she likes most about her village bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth D., 34 years old, is a mother of two children. Her eldest child is 9 years old. Her livelihood is rice farming. She has a 1-hectare farm that she  hopes could provide her with enough income to buy an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs. She started her business in 2000 and joined the CEVI credit program last year in 2008.

She would like to request for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to augment her harvest and income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Otilia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito Lamas, Provincia D. Lamas, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Lleva 25 años en la venta D. plantas, las ganas D. salir adelante y cumplir parte D. sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico D. su hogar. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a  su casa a comprar sus plantas y es ella quien, personalmente les atienD.  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, comprará plantas como: Llama plata, rosas, los dólares, las begonias, girasoles, Adán y Eva y palmeras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. insecticidas y vitaminas, abonos, tierras especiales, para mejorar el crecimiento D. sus plantas. 

Otilia, se siente con muchas ganas D. continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Otilia, 55, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are independent. She has sold plants for 25 years. Her desire to get ahead in life and fulfill part of her dreams motivated her to start her own business whose profits would contribute to meeting household expenses. Today, she has regular customers who come by her house to buy plants from her; it is she, herself, who tends to the customer with her characteristic charisma. With this 1200 sol loan she will buy plants like: Llama plata (a popular ornamental plant; they're good luck plants believed to 'call the money'), roses, begonias, sun flowers, palm trees, among others. Part of the money will be used to buy insecticides, vitamins, natural fertilizers, special soils to improve her plant growth. Otilia has a lot of push to continue working and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her have opportunities to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plants and flowers.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en: Rahmatullo is a businessman from Kumsangir where he lives with his wife and three children. He sells flour, ice-cream and soft drinks in the market. Rahmatullo does a good business because he keeps his merchandise well stocked and makes sure it is good quality. Presently, he is making about $400 USD each month. Rahmatullo is very honest and polite with both his suppliers and his customers. It has helped him to gain a reputation as a trustworthy and friendly vendor and to build a solid client base. Rahmatullo is applying for a loan of $3000 USD to re-stock his merchandise and hopefully generate additional profit. This will be his second loan with IMON international and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase flour to increase his stock of goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a variety of products such as school supplies, beauty products, fabric, and sewing supplies

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alberto H. tiene ya mas de cuatro años con su negocio de venta de ropa el con el cual le ayudado a salir a delante.
A su negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de ropa y de verano ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que tenga ese tipo de mercancía ya a la venta.
Pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así comprar la mercancía y satisfacer a sus clientes. 
Don Jorge Alberto también es empleado de una compañía de mensajeria como chofer repartidor, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Elia Lara esposa del señor Jorge Alberto, quien le ayuda ha tender el negocio cuando el se encuentra en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Alberto H. has sold clothing for over 4 years now; this has helped him to get ahead in life. His business is needing inventory, espceially a variety of clothing and Summer clothes, because his customers are requesting this type of merchandise. For the moment, however, he lacks the necessary funds to make this investment. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy merchandise so that he can satisfy his customers. Jorge Alberto is also employed as a deliveryman for a currier service; he plans to use part of his earnings to repay the loan. The person in the photo is Elia Lara, Jorge Alberto's wife, who helps him tend to the business when he's at work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Generose

texts.en: Generose D. plans to sell fish for her small business. The loan she is requesting from Kiva presently will be used to purchase fish, which she will directly sell to people around their village. She hopes that through the profits that this business will be making she will be able to support the needs of her four children, ages ranging from three to 11 years old. She also hopes that her husband would support her in her own business ventures so that she will find the success she has been looking for, after having been several types of businesses already. Generose also thinks that she will be successful with this one and she will never stop doing business and find the one that will bring her and her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: To purchase fish for selling.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Félix Pedro tiene 45 años de edad.  Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de mecánico automotriz. Desde hace 26 años, pues su papa fue quien le enseño este trabajo, el es un buen hombre y ha logrado salir adelante con mucho empeño. Félix necesita este préstamo para invertir en su capital de trabajo y poder comprar equipos automotrices como taladros, herramientas y otros utensilios necesarios. Su deseo es tener un taller más grande y acondicionado con equipos modernos y de alta tecnología.
texts.en:
Sr. Félix Pedro is 45 years old and has two dependent children. He offers his services as an auto mechanic. When he was 26 years old, his father taught him how to perform this type of work. Félix is a good man who has been able to get ahead with great determination.

He needs this loan to use as operating capital to purchase automotive equipment such as drills, tools, and other necessary utensils. Félix hopes to have a larger repair shop that contains modern equipment of the latest technology.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase automotive equipment

loans.name: Mumia

texts.en:
Mumia N. J. is 29 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. She lives in Nambale, Busia District where she runs a dairy farming business. She started this business in the year 2002. Before this she was involved in crop and food farming.

She would like a loan of Kshs. 10,000 that will go to buying feed for the dairy cow, renovating the cow shed, and the rest into vaccines. Her plan is to build and expand her business, and guarantee education for her children.

loans.use: Dairy feed

loans.name: Javier Aldo

texts.es:
Javier 36 años de edad, posee casa propia, vive  con su esposa  y sus hijos. El labora 
como maestro albañil  ya dedicándose a esta actividad 16 años, en la actualidad se 
encuentra laborando para una empresa constructora de la región, demostrando 
responsabilidad y honradez en sus labores diarias y por este motivo es que ya tiene 
varios años laborando en dicha empresa, el sueña con poder reconstruir su vivienda la 
cual fue afectada por el terremoto, y por el momento su familia se encuentra viviendo 
en malas condiciones, requiere el crédito para la compra materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Javier, 36, owns his own house, where he lives with his wife and their children. He works as a master bricklayer; he has done this work for 16 years. Currently he is working for a construction company in the region, demonstrating responsibility and honor in his daily work. For this reason he has been working for this company for a number of years. He dreams of being able to renovate his house, which was affected by the earthquake. For the time being, his family is living in poor conditions; he needs a loan to buy construction materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda G. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Linda is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Linda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Linda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Linda is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Linda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice crop

loans.name: Powerful Women Group

texts.en:
Gloria M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Powerful Women. She is 42 years old, married and has five  children who range from 2 to 22 years old. She was only able to attend school through 4th grade. 

For 15 years, she has been selling rice, oil and pepper at Thinkers Village Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She says customers are attracted to her business because she talks to them in a friendly manner.

She plans to use her 18,000 LRD portion of this 82,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, oil and pepper. Her goal is to improve her business and to continue to support her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and pepper

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian F. is a 31-year-old married woman. To earn a living, her husband works as a driver. She and her husband have 2 children, one of whom is in school. At present, she is in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $175 to stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant. With the expected additional profits generated by the business as a result of the loan, she would like to extend the floor of her restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. All of these services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To improve and expand her restaurant business by purchasing additional food

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann P. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Mary Ann is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling dried fish, shrimp, and rice in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Bella Angelica

texts.es:
Bella de 56 años, Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una tienda de vivieres. 

Ella tiene la tienda para ayudar con los gastos familiares y a su esposo , comenzó comprando arroz, verduras y lácteos. Desde ese tiempo ella a continuado trabajando para asegurar su vejez porque ya sus hijos son mayores de edad. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Con el presta quiere comprar arroz, y bebidas para surtir mas su tienda, en el futuro quiere comprar una casa con su esposo.
texts.en:
Bella is 56 years old and lives in the Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban area in which the majority of its residents are informal vendors). She owns a general store.

She runs the store in order to help her husband with the family expenses. She started out by purchasing rice, vegetables and dairy products. Since then, she has continued to work in order to be able to support herself during old age, since her children are now over age. She works from 8:00am until 9:00pm every day.

With this loan, she would like to purchase rice and beverages in order to better stock her shop. In the future, she would like to buy a house with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and beverages

loans.name: Ana Yolima

texts.es:
Ana Oliveri es una joven  casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 8 y 10 años,  que se mueve responsablemente frente a entre las funciones que genera ser madre y esposa y su compromiso personal de generar ingresos a partir de su negocio como comerciante y manicurista. 
En el año 2002 llegó a Barranquilla procedente del Banco en el departamento del Magdalena. , inició su negocio cuando después de hacer un curso de belleza y ya trabajando como manicurista en práctica, aumentaron sus gastos y un cliente le recomendó vender por medio de guías especializadas, fuè así como, desde ese momento en que lo decidió, empezó a conseguir clientes y no ha parado de hacerlo porque le ha ido muy bien.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su primer financiamiento, notó que obtuvo más ganancias y que en las temporadas  de mayor  repunte de las ventas, debía buscar financiamiento como lo está haciendo en este momento con su credikiva, que adquiriéndolo, le ayuda a  prepararse para la segunda temporada del año, época en que hay mayor movilización de mercancías pues ya se aproxima las fiestas  de fin de año con primas y bonificaciones y sus clientes aprovechan para comprar los productos que justamente Ana vende. Por eso su credikiva lo invertirá en productos de maquillaje y perfumería, crema y accesorios, blusas, pantalones  e insumos como esmaltes y uñas postizas  para su negocio como manicurista.
Ana Yolima se prepara para esta temporada de mucho trabajo y seguramente lo hará de manera  persistentemente, porque quiere cumplir sus sueños de tener un punto de venta en una miscelánea y lograr adquirir su vivienda propia, que es su gran anhelo.
texts.en:
Ana Oliveri is a young married woman who has 2 children, aged 8 and 10 years old. She moves responsibly through her duties as mother and wife, as well as her personal commitment to create income through her business as a saleswoman and manicurist. In 2002, she came to Baranquilla from Banco, in the department of Magdalena. She started her business when, after taking a beauty course and already working as a manicurist, her expenses went up. A customer suggested that she go into catalog sales. From the moment that she decided to do so, she started gaining customers and she has not stopped since because it's gone very well. This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With her first loan, she noted that her income increased and she decided that she should seek financing in the seasons of higher sales, which she is is doing right now with her "credikiva," or Kiva loan. Getting this loan will help her to prepare for the second part of the year, a period when she moves more merchandise as the end-of-year holidays approach and people receive premiums and bonuses. Her customers take advantage of this to buy the products that only Ana sells. She will invest this "credikiva" in makeup and perfume products, creams and accessories, blouses, pants, and supplies for her manicure business, such as polishes and artificial fingernails. Ana Yolima will prepare for this busy period and she will most surely do so with persistence, because she wants to achieve her dream of having a sales counter in a general store, and her greatest dream is to acquire her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy makeup and perfume products, creams and accessories, blouses, pants, and supplies for her manicure business, such as polishes and artificial fingernails

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina D. is from the village of Dicoyong. She is 44 years old. Cristina is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cristina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cristina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty G. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old and is married with four children. She is involved in farming and hog-raising: she plants and harvests rice crops and grows hogs for fattening and sale. She was also able to put up a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various products. Betty hopes that her ventures will work out so that she has a stable income.

Betty joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Betty is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs, feeds for her pigs, and additional store inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her businesses to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, feeds for her pigs and additional store inventory

loans.name: Aurore

texts.en:
Aurore was born in 1984. She is married and has a 1-1/2-year-old child. Aurore owns a business selling various styles of clothes. Her husband is a driver. This small family is working hard to save money before they become a big family. Aurore is new entrepreneur with just one year of experience in her business. Her business hours are from 8 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except on Saturday. 

Aurore is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more bales of clothes. With this expansion, Aurore will be able to satisfy her customers and this satisfaction will allow her to earn some profits to use for her family and her business.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Chacupe Bajo del distrito de La Victoria. Una zona rural situada a media hora del distrito de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la comercialización y venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega ubicada en un ambiente de su domcilio. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a que es el único que existe en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía de su familia.

Teresa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más abarrotes para implementar su bodega y percibir mas ingresos. Por ell ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Teresa es una mujer tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 43-year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Chacupe Bajo section of the district of La Victoria.  This is a rural area, located ½ hour from the district of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, she has dedicated herself to selling basic needs products and groceries from a store located in her house. The business is very busy, as it is the only one like it in the zone.  In addition, she raises and sells small livestock.  With the income she generates, she helps her husband cover the family’s expenses.

Teresa would like to expand her business by buying more groceries with which to supply her store and, therefore, increase her earnings.  For this reason, she has requested her first loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to meet her goal.  

Teresa is a calm and responsible woman.  Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as an entrepreneur in order to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Magongola Zinunula Group-Mityana

texts.en: 46 year old Robina N. who belongs to Magongolo Zinunula Omunaku group in Mityana has for the past 10 years been operating a bakery business in Magongolo, an up and coming trading center.  She says it has been a worthwhile experience given the headway her business has made over the years. She has mostly been selling chapattis, pancakes and mandazi (fried bread) which are especially appealing to school kids who eat them during breaks at schools. Robina is happily married with 6 children. Before she embarked on this business she was into retailing. With this loan, Robinah wants to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.use: The purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en: Marguerite is 33 years old. She is married and has three children who are between five and thirteen years old. Two of her children go to school. She is married to a farmer.  Marguerite runs a retail shop and sells variety of items such as rice, sugar, salt and maize flour.  She has had this business for two years. Marguerite is requesting this loan to buy more rice, sugar, and maize flour to sell. The profit from this business will be used to buy a cow and build an extension to her business building.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros A. owns a small rice field. She tills the land and shares her harvest with her children. Most of the products from her farm are saved for family consumption and the rest is sold to rice traders. In addition to a rice farm, she also ventures into selling processed meat. 

She is looking for other income opportunities that could help her earn more. She would like to apply for a loan to expand her rice farm. The loan will be utilized in buying fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: buying fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Yorleny Andrea

texts.es:
A sus 26 años de edad, Yorleny Andrea P. R. ya ha trabajado en algunas cafeterías y ha tenido hasta su propio negocio de ropa, el cual abandonó hace 6 meses para volcarse a la aventura de tener su propia microempresa: “El Ranchenato”, un lugar para el esparcimiento ubicado en el Parque Principal del municipio de Yarumal-Antioquia. 

Yorleny, invirtió sus pocos ahorros y los de su esposo para adquirir este local, el cual aún necesita más surtido para solventar las necesidades de sus clientes. 

Posicionar el negocio en el sector, generar empleo y mejorar su calidad de vida son los propósitos de esta joven empresaria, quien ve en su negocio la oportunidad para salir adelante.
texts.en:
At her 26 years of age, Yorleny Andrea P. R. has already worked in some cafés, and she has had her own clothing business.  Six months ago she left her clothing business to immerse herself in the adventure of having her own small business, El Ranchenato.  It is a place for relaxation located in the main park in the Yarumal-Antioquia municipality.

Yorleny invested her small savings and those of her husband to get this place.  It still needs to be better stocked to meet the needs of her customers.

Establishing her business in the area, generating work, and improving her quality of life are the objectives of this young businesswoman. In her business she sees the opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and snacks to stock her business with more products

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is a widow who lives in the municipality of Cordova in Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  making leather straps and a general store. 

Feliciana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Feliciana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly income of approximately $300, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her businesses and for the renovation of their house. 

Feliciana is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
								
								
								
								
								
								
								
								
								
								
								
								
								
								
								
								
								

"

loans.use: to fund the operation of her business

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana, de 56 años, es separada de su esposo, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus dos hijas mayores y que son independientes. Adriana, se dedica a la confección de blusas, camisas, pantalones, buzos, polos  y sábanas, prendas que son vendidas en diversos mercados de su zona. Asimismo elabora bocaditos y platillos especiales, que son preparados para algún evento que se presente, ya que una de sus mayores características es la de ser una experta cocinera. Pero la actividad que más disfruta es la de confeccionar prendas, ante esto ha logrado captar muchos clientes,  y ellos no dudan en requerir de sus servicios.  Lleva 30 años en esta labor que tanto le apasiona, sin embargo sabe que debe aumentar sus ingresos, por ello debe intensificarse en la venta de alimentos, es así que se ha propuesto instalar una fuente de soda en su casa. Es el segundo crédito con MFP,  y sabe que este aporte le será de mucha utilidad para el desarrollo de su negocio, por ello se compromete pagar sus cuotas sin ningún retraso. De obtener el crédito, comprará telas en cantidades, para confeccionar polos  y short, de esa manera lograr abastecer los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Adriana is 56 years old.  She is separated from her husband and lives in her own home with her two independent, adult daughters.  Adriana, makes blouses, shirts pants, sweatshirts, polo shirts, and sheets. She sells these garments at several markets in her region.  Likewise, she makes snacks and special dishes for events since one of her best attributes is being an expert cook.  But the activity she enjoys the most is making clothing.  Before, she managed to attract many customers and they didn’t hesitate to request her services.  

She has spent 30 years in this work that is her passion. However, she knows that she must increase her income.  For this reason, she must increase food sales. So she has proposed to install a soda fountain in her house.  

This is her second loan with MFP, and she knows that this support will be very useful for the development of her business.  For this reason, she promises to make her payments without delay.  She will use the loan to buy material in bulk, to make polo shirts and shorts and in this way, fill her pending orders.

loans.use: To buy material to make polo shirts and shorts.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba N. is married and has two children. She has received a senior high education. For the past eight years, Araba has been selling fried fish at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. Her husband is a driver. Araba uses her income to pay for their children’s school fees and their family’s utility bills.  Araba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to fry for resale.

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Chay D., 45, resides with his family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. D. is a motorcycle taxi driver, and earns U.S. $10 per day. His wife is a masseuse at the night market in the town, and earns U.S. $6 per day.

Each month, the family has to spend U.S. $50 on food and U.S. $50 on the other necessary expenses. D. is requesting a loan of U.S. $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Fabiola Azucena

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

La señora Fabiola es socia fundadora del Banco comunal además de ser la presidenta,  le gusta por la puntualidad con que se realiza todo en la institución. Tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos una niña de 10 y un niño de 3 años  de edad, la mayor estudia en  escuela. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta pero  también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva mercadería. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h00 ya que tiene que esperar que llegue su hija de la escuela, luego en la tarde a veces va a vender, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Su mercadería  la compra en Portoviejo. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, pero de preferencia ropa de temporada. Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
The members of the La Mocora community bank meet every 15 days in La Mocora, which is in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo.  Portoviejo  is known for its hardworking folk, who dedicate themselves to farming and ranching.

Fabiola is a founding member of the community bank, as well as its president.  She is well-liked for the prompt way in which she directs the institution.  She is 33 years old, married, and has two children:  a girl of 10 and a boy of 3.  Her daughter is in school.  Her husband is a professional driver.

She sells different kinds of clothing door to door, although she also makes sales out of her home, where clients come when she brings in merchandise.  She works every day from 8 am to 11 am, since she has to wait for her daughter to get home from school; sometimes she also goes out selling in the afternoons. She gives her clients credit and charges them weekly.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo.  She has been working in this way for the last five years, and it is going well.

Fabiola will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, but above all seasonal clothing.  She hopes to get ahead in her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, and seasonal clothing

loans.name: Tututepec San Pedro Group

texts.es:
Grupo Tutepec San Pedro se llama así porque al lugar donde pertenecen se llama Tututepec y San Pedro por que es el patrón del pueblo. Este grupo pertenece a Villa de Tututepec que significa “Cerro del Pájaro”.
Este grupo tiene una  representante que se llama Alma Eva M. García de 35 años de edad quien vive en unión libre con el señor Jorge Luis Cerrano Cruz, tiene 3 hijos, ella es estilista tiene una estética, solicitó el préstamo para poder comprar artículos de belleza para su estética como son tintes, decolorante, tubos, cremas, entre otros productos.
Otra de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Alejandrina López M. de 53 años de edad esta casada con el señor Fernando Díaz Nicolás quien se dedica ala campo. Alejandrina se dedica  a la elaboración de tortillas hechas a mano, tamales, elotes, papaya, sandia, ejotes y jicama. Ella junto con su marido desde que viven juntos se han dedicado al campo a cosechar diferentes productos como: maíz, ejotes, calabaza, sandia, jicama de estos productos el 35% lo venden y el resto lo utilizan para consumo. Del maíz utilizan el maíz y el totomoztle para elaborar el tamal. Todos sus productos los vende en su casa por medio de un cartel que pone en la entrada de su casa y a través de una bocina que anuncia los productos.
Estas actividades han ayudado mucho a su familia ya que con ello pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, darles una educación y comida. Alejandrina comenta que a pesar de que cosecha varias cosas no obtiene muchas ganancias por que hay ocasiones que la plaga acaba un poco con ellos o en las épocas que llueve mucho de igual manera se daña y con lo que le queda pues lo utilizan para comer.
Ella comenta que actualmente le va bien con sus ventas y ha tenido que comprar algunas cosas para comprar sus productos, es por ello que solicito el préstamo para poder comprar insumos para la elaboración de tortillas y tamales, como son: cal, comal, leño, manteca, chile, cebolla carne de cerdo, carne de pollo. 
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Cristina X Ramírez: De 49 años de edad se dedica a la compra de hilos para la elaboración de servilletas para la venta.
Claudina M. X: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes, pollos, pan y tortillas para la venta.
Isabel E. López: De 62 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de atole para la venta.
Lorenza García E.: De 44 años de edad se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de tortillas para la venta.
Enma Margarita López A.: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra de calzado colchas y perfumes para la venta.
Alma Eva M. Gracia: De 35 años de edad se dedica a la compra de artículos de belleza para su estética.
Alejandrina López M.: De 53 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas y tamales para la venta.
Francisca Aragón Hernández: De 66 años de edad se dedica a la compra de maíz e insumos  para la elaboración de tortilla y tamales para la venta.
Eva García Pérez: De 67 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes y compra de insumos para la elaboración de tortilla y tamales para la venta.
Ciria E. Juárez: De 51 años de edad se dedica a la compra de res, cerdo y pollos para la venta de carne.
Rosario S. Ríos: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pollos para la venta.
texts.en:
The Tututepec San Pedro group is named after the town's patron saint and is located in Tututepec village, which means "Bird Hill". This group is represented by Cerrano Cruz, she has three children and works as an aesthetician. She is requesting this loan to buy beauty products for her salon such as hair dyes, bleaching dyes, curlers, and moisturizing creams, among other products. 

Other group members include Alejandrina López M., who is 53 years old and married to Fernando Díaz Nicolás, who is a farmer. Alejandrina prepares homemade tortillas, tamales, sweet corn, squash, watermelon, and jicama. She sells about a third of what she prepares, and keeps the rest for her family's consumption. Alejandrina uses the maize and dried maize leaves (totomoztle) to make tamales. She sells all her products from a cart in front of her home and advertises her products through a car-mounted loudspeaker.   

This work has helped her family a lot, as she is able to feed and provide education for her children. Alejandrina says that despite farming many crops, she doesn't earn much from the harvest due to crop pests or too much rain. The family also consumes much of what is produced on the farm. Currently, Alejandrina's sales are good and she needs to buy some ingredients to continue making her food products. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making tortillas and tamales, such as whitewash (to coat the inside of the wood-burning oven), a tortilla pan, firewood, lard, chilies, onions, pork and chicken.

The following individuals are group members:
Cristina X Ramírez: Age 49, needs to purchase thread to embroider napkins that she sells.
Claudina M. X: Age 39, needs to buy groceries, chicken, bread and tortillas for sale.
Isabel E. López: Age 62, needs to buy ingredients for making atole (hot maize drink).
Lorenza García E.: Age 44, needs to buy ingredients for making tortillas.
Enma Margarita López A.: Age 39, needs to buy footwear, bedding, and perfumes.
Alma Eva M. Gracia: Age 35, needs to purchase beauty products for her salon.
Alejandrina López M.: Age 53, needs to buy supplies to make tortillas and tamales that she sells.
Francisca Aragón Hernández: Age 66, needs to purchase maize and ingredients to make tortillas and tamales.
Eva García Pérez: Age 67, needs to buy groceries and ingredients to make tortillas and tamales.
Ciria E. Juárez: Age 51, needs to purchase beef, pork and poultry for butchery.
Rosario S. Ríos: Age 39, needs to purchase chicken for sale.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for salon.

location.town: Villa de Melchor Ocampo, Tututepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Fredys Arsenio

texts.es:
Fredis, reside en Concepción Batres departamento de Usulután, tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su familia, su esposa y un hijo de un año de edad, su esposa trabaja y él se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y como motorista de una moto taxi.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos para comercializar, ya que quiere ampliar su granja y la manera para hacerlo en comprando cerdos pequeños y dar seguimiento al crecimiento y alimentación de estos.
El quiere convertirse en comerciante mayorista, tener éxito en sus negocios y dar a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Fredis lives in Concepción Batres in the Usulután department. He is 33 years old and lives with his family, his wife and his one-year-old child. His wife works and he devotes his time to raising pigs and driving a motorcycle taxi.

Hi is currently seeking a loan to buy pigs to market, as he wants to expand his farm by purchasing piglets and monitoring their growth and feeding.

He wants to become a wholesaler, to succeed in his businesses and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: José Simón

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Jesús de Nazaret del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

José se dedica a brindar servicio de mecánica y ensamblaje de mototaxi y motocicletas, esta actividad la viene ejerciendo hace más de 5 años y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos de su familia. El negocio tiene buena acogida debido al buen servicio que brinda José. El desea comprar herramientas para su negocio y un motor para ensamblar una mototaxi que le permitirá alquilar e incrementar sus ingresos, de modo que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jose is a 43 year-old father who lives with his wife and their 3 children in the Jesus de Nazaret neighborhood of José Leonardo Ortiz district. This is one of the most populated districts in the Lambayeque region, and it is characterized mainly by its high poverty rates, as people generally live in marginal urban neighborhoods that lack basic utilities.

Jose has a business where he works as a mechanic and assembles mototaxis (motorcycles with attached cabs used to transport people and goods) and motorcycles.  He has been doing this work for more than 5 years, and thanks to this business he is able to cover his family's household expenses.  Jose's business is well accepted in the area because of the good service that Jose provides.  He wants to buy tools for his business and a motor to assemble a mototaxi that he will rent out to increase his income so that his family can have better living conditions.  To do this, he is requesting a loan from the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to buy tools and a motor

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José y su querido hijo David de 24 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Ella se dedica desde hace 06 años a la administración de su taxi, además de ser profesora en una de las escuelas de la zona en la que vive. El taxi es de su propiedad y de su esposo, quien lo trabaja diariamente desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y hasta prolongarse la tarde ya que las ganancias que obtenga le es de importancia para el sustento de su familia. María quiere en el futuro tener un negocio más rentable y que pueda realizar en su casa, es por ello que esta ahorrando el dinero necesario para hacerlo realidad, pero sabe que todo lo logrará en base a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación al igual que su esposo quien se esfuerza mucho por lograr sus objetivos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y promete ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, lo enviará al mecánico para arreglar su auto, y así pueda brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old.  She is a simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband José and her beloved son David who is 24.  She would like to provide her family with a better quality of life.

For six years, María has been managing a taxi as well as working as a teacher in a local elementary school.  She and her husband own the taxi and he drives it every day from very early in the morning until late in the evening as the money that he makes is important in supporting their family.  In the future, María would like to have a more profitable business that she can carry out at home.  For this reason, she is saving up the money she needs in order to do this.  However, she knows that everything is achieved through a lot of effort and commitment.  She and her husband both work hard to achieve their goals.

This is María's fifth loan from MFP and she pledges to be very punctual in making her loan repayments.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles she has requested to send her car to the garage to be repaired so that they can provide a better service with it.

loans.use: to send her car to the garage

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
María Olga tiene 34 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

María se dedica a la agricultura siembra en el terreno de los padres maíz, habas, papas y trigo además se dedica a la comercialización de chanchos. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia y comprar un terreno  para seguir sembrando.

En los momentos libres le gusta descansar, pasear por el campo y hacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
María Olga is 34 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has five children.

The Pucara Group community bank is located in Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  This bank has 22 members who work in farming, livestock raising and vegetable sales.

María is a farmer who grows corn, beans, potatoes and wheat on her parents' land.  She also sells pigs.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Guaranda.

María is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home and to buy a plot of land so that she can continue growing her crops.

In her free time, María enjoys resting, walking in the countryside and taking part in sports together with her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco Tulio, tiene la edad de 60  años, está casado, el  vive con su hija y su esposa  que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de los abonos y  hacer la renovación de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado en producción y lo  que le quiere es generarle las próximas cosechas una buena producción. el quiere establecer un cafetal bueno y así obtenerle ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia y de el también Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is 60 years old, married and lives with his daughter and wife who are his greatest priorities in life.  He intends to use the money to buy manure to renew his coffee plantation.  He has the field already planted and in production and what he wants to do is generate better production in the next harvest.  He wants to establish a good coffee plantation so that it will produce good income for his family’s and his own wellbeing.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has had no previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy manure and to care for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic with which to protect her nursery during the winter

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 29-year-old married man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His family goal is to develop a bigger tea plantation estate so as to be able to have sustainable income, as well as to educate his children to tertiary levels. He started his tea business 10 years ago on family land and later bought his own. The major challenge he faces is inadequate funds to clear more land and scarce tea plantation laborers. He has hope that if he gets enough funds, he will have a bigger tea estate.

Robert needs this loan for clearing land to enable him to plant more tea for selling.

loans.use: to pay for labor that will clear more farm land for tea planting.

loans.name: Luz De Bendicion 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Marie is one of the members of the “Luz de Bendicion 1 & 2” (Light of blessing) group which is comprised of 10 micro-businesswomen. They are involved in clothing sales, natural products sales, shoe sales, food sales, etc. Marie lives in the city of La Romana. Its economy depends on tourism and the sugarcane industry. 

Marie is very excited to receive her second loan from Esperanza Internacional, having satisfactorily repaid her previous loan and taken an important step in her business growth. She has had her business for about eight years; she started it with her saving. She is running a cosmetics and shoes sales, and she is planning on investing the new loan to have capital and be able to buy what her clients order. She does her sales by walking around with products and with a catalog. When her clients order an item, she buys it and most of them pay on credit. 

Marie’s family is made up of herself, her long-term partner and their three children, of whom two live in her house. She tells us that her greatest challenge is to build her house into a better structure. She will use her profits to save and start making change to her house by building little by little. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Supiaty

texts.en:
Supiaty is a 54-year-old widow with five children:

•\tAlberth, 32 years old and married •\tAgustinus, 31 years old and single •\tSerly, 29 years old, a pastor and married •\tPuteri, 18 years old and studying at a University in Surabaya •\tKatty, 17 years old and planning to study at a University in Surabaya

Supiaty is a teacher at an elementary school. Since the death of her husband, Supiaty has been the breadwinner for her family, not an easy task as she works hard to support her children's educational costs and meet their daily needs.

Because her teaching income is insufficient to meet those needs, since 1992 Supiaty has been selling clothes, men's and women's shoes, and women's hand bags to earn additional money. A skilled woman, she also operates a beauty salon offering such services as hair cream baths, hair maskers, hair straightening, and facial and bridal makeup. This business is operated only when she has spare time.

Supiaty plans to improve her business as her daughter Katty will soon be studying in Surabaya for several years. Supiaty is therefore requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM to purchase additional stocks of clothes, bags and shoes. She is hoping that TLM will assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase business stocks such as clothes, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 54 years old and a widow with 5 children.

Jeana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jeana has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from fish and vegetable vending, frozen foods, and raising pigs.

Jeana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es: Anderson, de 25 años, es un hombre trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Conni, con quien convive desde hace 2 años. Ambos tienen una hija: Juliet  a quien cuidan y educan en la comunidad nativa de Alianza. Los esfuerzos en cuidado y fertilización que Anderson realiza en sus cultivos, se ven reflejados en la calidad de sus productos, ya que los plátanos, café, cacao y achiote que siembra son muy cotizados en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, que es donde vende sus productos. También comenta, que en épocas de buena cosecha los mismos comerciantes llegan a sus terrenos agrícolas a comprar sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha alegría, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es mantener la calidad de sus cultivos, ya que el capital para ello es muy escaso; pues necesita grandes sumas de dinero. Pero eso no es impedimento para qué continúe en la mejora continua y con el tiempo desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde sus primeros pagos fueron muy puntuales, ya que es un hombre responsable y agradece al apoyo recibido de parte de todos ustedes. Anderson de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios mamones (plantitas de plátanos), para plantarlos en su hectárea de terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Anderson, age 25, is a hard-working man.  He lives in his parents’ house with his wife, Conni.  They have lived together for two years.  They have a daughter, Juliet.  They take care of her and educate her in the indigenous community of Alianza.  

The efforts that Anderson puts forth in caring and fertilizing his crops are reflected in the quality of his products.  His banana, coffee, cacao, and annatto crops are sought-after in the market in the city of La Merced.  That is where he sells his products.  He also comments that when there are good harvests these same merchant come to his fields to buy his crops.

The thing he likes the most about his work is harvesting his land, and he does so with much joy.  He has been doing this for nine years.  He considers the most difficult part to be maintaining the quality of his crops because capital is very scarce.  He needs large sums of money.

However, this is not an impediment to continued improvement.  In time he wishes to buy more land in order to increase his production.

He is a member of the “Alianza al Progreso” (Alliance to Progress) Communal Bank.  This is his fifth loan with MFP, where his first payments were very punctual.  He is a responsible man, and he is grateful for the support he has received from all of you.  Upon receiving your support Anderson will use the requested money to buy various “mamones” (small banana plants) to plant them on his hectare of farm land.

loans.use: to buy banana plants.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 42 años, es natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, vive en su propia casa al lado de su amado esposo Paulino de 49 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes les brinda una educación justa para el mejor porvenir de su futuro. Saturnina es una mujer de ardua labor, se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno para los miembros de su familia y luego se dirige a la chacra con su amado esposo para cumplir con sus labores cotidianas. Ella cultiva plantas de cacao, café y frutas de piña, productos significativos que le sirven de sustento para sobre salir y educar a sus queridos hijos que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Ella cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas oriundas de la zona selvática de la amazonia peruana y en tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesariamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Saturnina necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar acabo sus actividades, tiene planeado combatir la plaga de insectos que asechan los brotes de los frutos por lo cual necesita comprar fertilizantes ya que ella no cuenta con recursos suficientes. Es por ello que  acude a los prestamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a prosperar. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante  sus sembríos. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para poder comprar los productos necesarios, a la vez se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles solicitados comprará fertilizantes para combatir la plaga de insectos que atacan los frutos de su cultivo.
texts.en:
Saturnina is 42 and from the city of Quimbiri where she lives in her own house with her husband, Paulino, 49, and their three dear children.  She is giving them a good education for the future.  Saturnina is a hard-working woman who gets up very early in the morning to make breakfast for all the members of the family.  She then goes to the cropland with her husband to carry out the daily chores.  She grows cocoa, coffee and pineapple which are important crops that provide an income for her family and for her children's education.  She has three hectares of land where she grows plants native to the Peruvian Amazon Jungle climate.  During harvest season or when it is necessary to remove weeds she hires workers so she can keep to schedule and get the work done on time.

Saturnina is in need of a loan to carry out work such as fighting insect plagues that affect the fruit in its early stages.  She does not have enough funds and needs to buy fertilizer.  She is requesting a loan through MFP which provides loans to people with low income so they can get ahead.  In order to continue with her work she hopes to be able to maintain her strengh and determination to ensure her crops grow successfully.  This will be her fourth loan through MFP.  She is committed to paying it back on time because she would like to continue having access to such loans.  With the 2,500 PEN she has requested she will buy fertilizers to combat the insect plagues that threaten her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 43 years old and married. She has two children.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Marites has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from vegetable farming and raising livestock.

Marites aspires to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 28 years old and single. He is a livestock trader, and  most of his clients are male. He has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES 8,000 per month.


Emmanuel was introduced to KADET LTD by a client of KADET. He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD which whole amount he plans to use to purchase more livestock. He will use the extra profit to start a dairy farm.


Emmanuel hopes to be the largest livestock keeper in town. He is very hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years. Gloria earns more income from food vending.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Victoria, es casada; la socia tiene 54 años D. edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes,ella venD. arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabja desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas al por mayor para implementar la tienda D. abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old and is married with 3 children.  She continues to devote her time to her grocery store business, where she sells rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  She works from 9am until 10pm, and she wants to expand and improve her grocery store business.  She requests a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale to stock up her grocery store.

Victoria is happy to have this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies at wholesale for her grocery store

loans.name: Leena

texts.en: Leena is a young Palestinian woman.  She is married and has four sons and one daughter.  Her husband is a worker with low income. Leena wants to finish work on her house and make it suitable to live in by installing tiles, painting, and installing windows and doors.  Because she does not have enough money to complete the work, she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Leena receives the loan, she will be able to pay the expenses necessary to finish her house and live there with her family in better and healthy living conditions. Leena is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: to pay the expenses to finish work on her house.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru:
Гульнара родилась в Чуйской области, в селе Сокулук. Окончив среднюю школу, она приехала в город Карабалта и 1995 году поступила  в Карабалтинское медицинское училище по специальности фельдшер - акушер.  В 1998 году , Гульнара, окончив училище с красным дипломом (degree with distinction), устроилась на работу в  роддом медицинской сестрой.
