Luis desea desempeñar un buen trabajo para estabilizar la situación económica en su hogar, al igual que cancelar puntualmente este préstamo.
texts.en:
Luis lives in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. He is 29 years old and lives with his mother and his wife. He has been employed by a financial business for one year.

For his work, Luis must travel to the outskirts of the city, which he finds difficult because he has no means of transportation. This situation has prompted him to apply for a loan to buy a motorcycle. The loan will help him acquire the means of transport that he needs to carry out the activities demanded by his job.

Luis wants to do a good job, to stabilize the economic situation in his household and to promptly pay off this loan.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn B. is a 31-year-old married woman. She has an 8-year-old child who goes to school. Analyn dreams for her child to finish college someday and find a decent job.

Analyn is engaged in rice farming. She earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. Analyn works hard to increase her harvest and earn better. She currently needs fertilizers for her farm. She also needs to pay the laborers she hired to help with the tilling.

Analyn requests a loan of 17000 PHP to be used for her farm needs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of cement and sand.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
La profesora Gloria  de 46 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad los cuales estudian y trabaja, permitiendole incrementar sus ingresos y mantener mejores condiciones de vida, ella trabaja como docente en el Instituto Ruben Dario desde hace 30 años desempeñandose como maestra de secundaria, es una persona responsable que ha sabido aprovechar su trabajo para beneficiarse en su hogar, realizando mejoras al mismo.  

Solicita credito con el apoyo de kiva para arreglar la cocina de su vivienda. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia goce de excelente salud y tener estabilidad laboral .
texts.en:
Professor Gloria, 46, has three adult children who study and work which allows her to increase income and maintain the best possible living conditions.  She has worked as a Secondary School Teacher at the Rubén Darío Institute for the last 30 years.  She is a responsible person who has known how to take advantage of her work to benefit her home making improvements to it.

She is asking for Kiva financing to repair her kitchen.  Her greatest wish is that her family enjoys excellent health and to have steady employment.

loans.use: To repair the kitchen.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is 42 years old and married with three children.  He owns and operates a poultry farm to earn a living.  He earns extra income from other employment.  He is able to run his business well because he was trained in business management skills through Faulu Kenya. He hopes to improve his business and become self-employed in the future. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy more layers and broilers.

loans.use: To buy more layers and broilers.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mon V. is a 68-year-old woman, married to Tith Hoeurn, age 64, and both of them work in the field of agriculture as rice farmers in Kompong Tom province. This old couple lives with three married children and all of them are employed in a variety of jobs for a profit. One of their children sells beds from a mobile place by using his trailer to transport his products. Currently, his old trailer has broken down while using this process and it has influenced his selling business. Mon V. actually wants to assist her child, but her present capital is not sufficient to make it possible. To help her son's business, Mon V. has decided to seek a loan in order to purchase a new trailer to replace the broken one so that he can go on selling his furniture as usual.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for her son to use in his business.

loans.name: Casa De La Monarca Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Casa de la Monarca", el grupo lo integran 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras, el grupo se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de la Mesa, está comunidad es muy bonita, tiene una vista hermosa, hay mucho monte y arboles de varios tipos, tambíen se encuentra entre los linderos se un santuario muy conocido por su paisaje y porqué es el lugar que escogio la Mariposa Monarca para Hibernar y despues emigrar a los paises de Estados Unidos y Canada. El grupo se llama así precisamente por la zona en la que viven, como una representación en nombre de esta Mariposa ya que para el grupo es un orgullo vivir tan cerca de este santuario. Las 11 mujres son casadas y la mayoria tienen el negocio de tiendas de abarrotes y las otras mujeres tienen un molino de maiz, solicitaron su prestamo para hacer mas grande su negocio y las que venden maiz poner ahi mismo una tienda y vender refrescos y pan, que estos alimentos son los mas vendidos en esta parte. Los nombres de las 11 integrantes son los siguientes.
1.-Angelina C. C., tiene 42 años de edad
2.-Raquel G. M., tiene 37 años de edad
3.-Maria Elena C. P., tiene 37 años
4.-Berenice R. G., tiene 21 años
5.-Gloria F. C., tiene 23 años
6.-Juana G. M., tiene 36 años
7.-Maria Guadalupe S. S., tiene 31 años
8.-Guillermina S. G., tiene 32 años
9.-Margarita M. C., tiene 56 años
10.-Jenoveva S. S., tiene 48 años
11.-Angela F. N., tiene 39 años.
Estas son las 11 muejres que buscan salir adelante y tener una mejora economica para una mejor calidad de vida. La representante de este grupo se llama Angelina C. C., ella se dedica a moles maiz, cria borregos y solicito su prestamo para comprar ampliar se negocio del molino y quiere meter una tienda de abarrotes y vender refrescos, jugos y pan. Doña Margarita es una integrante del comite de este grupo, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, tambien se dedica a ser una guia de turistas, nos platica que vienen a visistar el santuario personas de Estados unidos y Brasileños, Los meses donde mas trabaja como guis de turistas son desde el 4 de Noviembre hasta los ultimos dias de Marzo, porque en este tiempo es cuando la Mariposa Monarca termina de Hibernar y parte su vuelo a Estados Unidos y Canada, y regresa de nuevo en los meses de Diciembr, Enero y Febrero para aparearse, nos dice que son experiencias muy bonitas y de las cuales todo los vecinos de este lugar se sientes orgullosos, Doña Margarita tiene 35 años de casada, tiene 10 hijos es una familia grande, son cinco hombres y cinco mujeres, de sus 10 hijos 8 ya son casados y solo tiene dos que viven con ella, de sus hijos solo depende 1 que lamentablemente es discapacitado y esta en tratamientos, el esposo de doña Margarita trabaja como carpintero en su comunidad, viven en casa propia y ahorita le estan echando muchas ganas para salir adelante en sus negocios y con su hijo.
texts.en:
The group called “Casa de La Monarca” (House of the Monarch) consists of eleven hardworking women from the community of La Mesa. This beautiful community has a picturesque view of mountains and trees of various types. Located on the outskirts is a sanctuary that is known for its beautiful landscape and for being the place where the monarch butterfly chooses to hibernate. After hibernation, the butterflies migrate to the United States and Canada. The group is named after the area where they live, since it is represented by the monarch butterfly, and its members are proud to live near this sanctuary. The eleven women of the group are married. Most of them have groceries businesses, while the remaining women operate businesses in which they grind corn. They are requesting a loan to expand their businesses by selling corn, soft drinks, and bread since these products generate good sales in this area. The names of the eleven members are as follows:

1. Angelina C. C., age 42 2. Raquel G. M., age 37 3. Maria Elena C. P., age 37 4. Berenice R. G., age 21 5. Gloria F. C., age 23 6. Juana G. M., age 36 7. Maria Guadalupe S. S., age 31 8. Guillermina S. G., age 32 9. Margarita M. C., age 56 10. Jenoveva S. S., age 48 11. Angela F. N., age 39

These eleven women seek to move forward and advance economically so that they can have a better quality of life. The group representative is Angelina C. C. who has a business grinding corn and raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to expand her grinding business and open a grocery store where she can sells soft drinks, juices, and bread.

Doña Margarita is another member of this group who has a grocery store. She also works as a tour guide, assisting visitors from the United States and Brazil who want to see the butterfly sanctuary. Margarita works as a tour guide from November 4th until the last few days of March when the monarch butterfly ends its hibernation and begins its migration to the United States and Canada. The butterflies return during the months of December, January, and February to mate. Margarita says these events are beautiful to watch and that her neighbors in the area are proud to witness them. She is 56 years old and has a large family of ten children, five sons and five daughters. Eight of her children are already married and only two still live with her. Unfortunately, one child is disabled and requires treatments. Doña Margarita’s husband works as a carpenter in the community. She lives in her own home and now has great desire to move forward in her businesses so that she can help her child.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to restock a grocery store.

loans.name: Sonia Carolina

texts.es:
Sonia, tiene 25 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Elena, departamento D. Usulután, se dedica a vender ropa, zapatos y accesorios, vive con su madre y dos hijos, también su esposo, inicio el negocio hace dos años por iniciativa propia, debido a las necesidades económicas que enfrentaba, no tiene un horario definido y actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería: ropa y accesorios D. belleza.
Esta inversión le será D. mucho beneficio, pues contara con más productos para ofrecer a los clientes y estará encaminando el negocio hacia el logro D. sus metas y objetivos que como comerciante tiene, también velando por el bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en: Sonia, who is 25, lives in Santa Elena in Usulután department, where she sells clothing, shoes, and accessories. She lives with her mother and two children, as well as her husband. She started the business on her own initiative two years ago because of the economic hardships she faced. She has no set schedule and right now she requests a loan in order to purchase merchandise: clothing and beauty accessories. This investment will be of great help to her, since she will have more products to offer her customers. She will also be steering the business toward accomplishing the goals and objectives she has as a businesswoman, as well as watching over the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and beauty accessories.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo (independiente).  Felicitas cuenta con estudios secundarios.
La señora  trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo inicial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de libros, útiles escolares y materiales de oficina.
Con este crédito de  S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará juguetes educativos, títeres, un ciento de mandiles,  un ciento de cuaderno especial de dibujo doble y triple ralla.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo quien se desempeña como chofer de taxi.
Su sueño es tener una librería bien implementada que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son los ahorros, el préstamo de la cuenta interna y la puntualidad de los pagos
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Victor Echave Communal Bank which is located in the District and Department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married, and has a son who is independent. Felicitas has a high school education.

Sra. Felicitas has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan of 500 PEN was invested in her business of selling books, school supplies, and office supplies.

With this loan of 2000 PEN, she will buy educational toys, puppets, one hundred aprons, and one hundred special notebooks with double-ruled and triple-ruled paper. In her business, she has the help of her husband who also works as a taxi driver.

Her dream is to have a well-established bookstore that will enable her to improve her income. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank are the savings, the ability to borrow against the internal account, and the promptness of the payments.

loans.use: to purchase educational toys, puppets, aprons, and notebooks.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana, de 37 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Andrés de 44 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es una mujer que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar muy duro para el bienestar de los suyos, desde pequeña tuvo la necesidad de apoyar a su madre, quien se desempeñaba como costurera, para poder mantenerlos. Felizmente  con el pasar del tiempo, su arduo trabajo dio frutos y pudo comprar un pequeño terrenito donde se trasladaron a vivir en un pequeño espacio con esteras, en el distrito de Ventanilla. Hoy en día a sus 37 años, recuerda el esfuerzo de su madre, de sus hermanos y el de ella misma, por los diferentes oficios que tuvieron y tuvo que realizar para generar ingresos a su hogar y no hay nada que ella no haya hecho desde la confección de joyas (bisutería), venta de gelatina, organización de polladas (actividades donde se vende platillos de pollo), venta de ropa, entre otras actividades más.  Aún tiene muchas ideas de negocio en su mente; actualmente monto una pequeña bodega el cual ha ido abasteciendo poco a poco para obtener los ingresos que desea. Liliana piensa que no hay nada difícil en el trabajo, que uno simplemente debe ponerle muchas ganas y esfuerzo ya que el éxito viene detrás, ella espera hacer crecer su negocio y seguir incursionando en nuevas ideas de negocio ya que su imaginación nunca para, cuando de hacer negocio se trata. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Liliana is 37 years old. She is a very kind and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Andres, 44 years old, and their three beloved children. She wants to provide them with a better quality of life. Since she was very young she needed to work very hard for the well-being of her family. As a young girl she needed to help her mother to support them. She worked as a seamstress. Gratefully with the passage of time her arduous work yielded results and she was able to purchase a small plot of land with a small living space equipped with sleeping mats, located in the district of Ventanilla. Today, at the age of 37, she remembers the effort that her mother, her siblings and that she herself invested on the different businesses they had and what they had to do to generate an income for the family. There hasn't been anything that she didn't do, including the crafting of jewelry (fashion jewelry), gelatin sales, prepared chicken meals (business where prepared chicken dishes are sold), clothing sales, and others. She still has many business ideas in mind. Currently she has a small grocery store which she has been supplying incrementally to obtain the profits that she wants. Liliana doesn't think that anything is difficult pertaining to her work, saying that one must only put a lot of energy and effort and success will soon follow. She hopes to expand her business and to keep exploring new business ideas. Her imagination never stops with respect to business ideas. This is her tenth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she has always been very timely with her payments. With the two thousand nuevos soles that she requests, she will purchase more products to supply her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more products to supply her store.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria Rosa  tiene 50 años, es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

María se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería tiene media cuadra de terreno en el sector y cinco cuadras en la ciudad de Ambato donde siembra habas, papas, zanahoria tiene 10cabezas de ganado. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando en la agricultura, dar el estudio a los hijos para que sean profesionales. 

Le gusta ir los domingos a la iglesia.
texts.en:
María Rosa is 50 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the canton of Guaranda in Bolivar Province. She and her husband have six children.

The members of the Communal Bank “Grupo Pucara” meet in the community of Pucara, Guanujo Parish, Guaranda Canton. This area is located 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The 22 members of this group engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and selling legumes.

María is a farmer and a livestock breeder. She has a half plot of land in the local area and five plots in the city of Ambato where she grows beans, potatoes, and carrots. María also has 10 heads of cattle. She buys her supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells her products at the wholesale market in the same city.

María is requesting a loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals. The support she is receiving through this loan will help meet her financial needs. Among the challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. Her dreams include continuing to work in agriculture and providing for her children’s education so that they can become professionals.

María enjoys going to church on Sundays.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Rolia

texts.es:
Rolia es una joven de 27 años vive con su conviviente el señor Sergio y juntos tienen un hijo pequeño de 1 año y  medio, ella vive en la comunidad Pucarita chica en la casa de la madre, ella y su marido con mucho esfuerzo han logrado comprar un terreno y construir una pequeña casa la cual aún está en obras y falta la terminación de la obra fina para que de esta manera puedan mudarse, ya que en la casa de la madre están muy incomodos  en una sola habitación. Rolia ha logrado estudiar una carrera técnica Prótesis  dental, pero no ejerce dicha profesión al no contar con la maquinaria necesaria, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente cuenta con 12 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción y el producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos y el esposo es agricultor cuenta con chaco en el trópico del Chapare en al cual produce fruta.
El crédito está destinado para la compra de forraje para el ganado, ya que en esta temporada de invierno los productores de leche recolectan mucho forraje para la temporada de sequía.
Entre sus principales sueños y metas esta de trabajar de su carrera para la cual estudio , y lo  más importante terminar de construir su casa para poder mudarse y de esa manera vivir más cómodamente ella y su familia.
texts.en: Rolia is 27 years old and lives with her husband, Sergio, and their 1-and-half-year-old son. She lives in the community of Pucarita in her mother's home. With a lot of hard work Rolia and her husband were able to purchase some land and begin building a small home, which is still under construction and needs the finishing touches before they can move in, since her mother's house is uncomfortable with only one room. Rolia has a degree as a dental technician but doesn't practice that profession because she doesn't have the necessary equipment, so she makes a living milking cows. She currently has 12 milk cows and delivers the product to a company that produces dairy products. Her husband is a farmer and produces fruit in the topics of Chapere. Rolia plans to use the loan to purchase forage for her livestock, since in the winter milk producers gather a lot of forage for the dry season. Among her biggest hopes and dreams is to practice the career she studied for, and the most important is to finish construction on her home so she and her family can move in and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase forage for her milk cows.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, a 54-year-old married mother of six children, lives in the Philippines where she has been selling rice cakes or bibingkas for 10 years. A new member of HSPFI, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making more of these products. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make rice cakes or bibingkas.

loans.name: Roben

texts.en:
Roben, a maize trader who hails from Kyenjojo District, is a Ugandan father of six children. Married to a farmer, he owns a four-bedroom temporary house and dreams of educating his children so that they can be self-sustaining. 

In his business for 15 years, Roben began as a farmer and later started purchasing maize from other farmers. He is requesting this loan to buy more maize to sell. Roben's main business hardship are fluctuating prices, and his dream is to own a food store.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar.  Estudió hasta la primaria.
Victoria se dedica a la venta de animales caseros como ovinos y chanchos, trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ocho años, su préstamo anterior fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de animales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco animales.  Nos cuenta que  los compra y lo vende en la plaza de ganados, a veces los engorda por cuatro meses.
En el negocio la ayuda sus hijos y su esposo, quien trabaja en el municipio.
Su sueño es ver a sus hijos todos profesionales.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Asunción,” which is located in the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno.  She is 52 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children.  She has an elementary school education.

Victoria has a business selling animals such as sheep and pigs.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 8 years.  Her previous loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she used the money to invest in her business selling animals.

With this new loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy 5 animals.  She tells us that she buys and sells her animals in the livestock market in Puno, and she fattens her animals for about 4 months.

She is assisted in her business by her children and her husband, who works for the municipality.

Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

What she likes about her communal bank is that the members are punctual and responsible.

loans.use: to buy 5 animals

loans.name: Eziel

texts.en:
Eziel is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Eziel has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish and also hypo (calcium hypochlorite, a disinfectant) in plastic containers. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy dried fish to sell.

Eziel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Eziel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sheenalyn

texts.en:
Sheenalyn lives and works in Ilagan in Isabela Province. She is an active and hardworking wife.

For four years Sheenalyn has sold food and daily-use products such as sweets, drinks, sugar, etc. from her own grocery store. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more food items such as drinks, snack foods, milk, coffee and soap in order to increase the assortment of goods in her store and so expand her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods, milk, coffee and soap to sell.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery, de 58 años, es una mujer emprendedora. Ella tiene una casa propia que pudo comprar gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio que hicieron junto a su esposo.El trabajo de Mery consiste en la elaboración y venta de pizzas y menús desde su casa. La casa de Mery esta muy cerca al Hospital II Esalud de Pucallpa, y sus clientes son en su mayoría los médicos y trabajadores del hospital que siempre la llaman para hacer delivery. Mery lleva cuatro años realizando esta actividad y tiene dos personas que le ayudan en su negocio.
El trabajo que hace a ella no le gusta mucho, pero tiene que hacerlo por que necesita solventarse ya que su esposo esta un poco delicado y no le puede ayudar mucho, espera poder mantener su negocio ya que como esta se siente a gusto.Este es el préstamo numero 17 entre Mery y la institución MFP, ella es también una de las socias fundadoras y le gusta mucho su grupo ya que es muy quería y todos son responsables, esta muy agradecida de los prestamos que le dan ya que gracias a eso pudo crecer y hacer su casa y comprarse algunas otras cosas mas con la ganancia adquirida.Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, ella comprará víveres, bebidas y algunos materiales que le hacen falta para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mery, 58, is an enterprising woman.  She has her own house which she was able to buy thanks to the effort and sacrifices that she and her husband made together. Mery’s work is the preparation and sale of pizzas and set meals from her home. Mery’s home is very near the Hospital II Essalud de Pucallpa [ESSALUD Hospital Level II of Pucallpa] and the majority of her customers are the hospital’s doctors and other workers who call for deliveries.

Mery has been running her business for four years and has two people helping her. She does not like her work much, but she has to do it because she needs to pay the bills now that her husband is not well and cannot help her much. She hopes to be able to continue her business inasmuch as this is the easiest thing for her to do. This is the 17th loan she has borrowed from MFP. She is also one of the founding members and she likes the group very much since it is very dear to her and everyone is so responsible. 

She is very grateful for the loans she has received because, thanks to them, she was able to fix up her house and buy some other things she needed with her profits. With the sum of 1,500 soles she is requesting she will buy food, beverages and other supplies she needs to continue working.

loans.use: to buy the food supplies and beverages she needs to continue working.

loans.name: Irabiya

texts.en:
Irabiya is a 59-year-old woman. She lives with her family in her own house in Agsu. Irabiya works hard, along with her husband, to provide for her family. They have one son who works in agriculture and two daughters. 

Irabiya has a business of a small retail shop, which she has had for 15 years. To help expand her home products sales business, Irabiya has requested a loan of 1500 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) from AqroInvest and Kiva. This is her second loan. Irabiya is grateful to all creditors in advance for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Yusufali

texts.ru: Юсуфали проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Юсуфали занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Yusufali lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 44 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is taking care of the household. Yusufali does animal husbandry and breeds large horned cattle. He mainly feeds and sells the cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en: Batmunkh drives a taxi besides his raw materials business. His wife stays at home to look after their daughter, aged 5. Batmunkh is a very hardworking and diligent person who always wants to increase his earnings. His living conditions are not very comfortable and the Mongolian tent is cold during winter. He requested a loan to increase his working capital to buy more raw materials which will raise his income considerably.

loans.use: To increase his working capital to buy more raw materials which will raise his income considerably.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Esmeralda;  La socia tiene 25 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, la socia trabaja vendiendo carne de vacuno, la socia lleva a la Convención Quillabamaba la carne de primera, ella tiene a sus clientes y para esto viaja 8 horas para llegar allá, la socia  vende cordero y res al por mayor, y repartiendo en el poblado de Quillabamba ella vuelve y nuevamente en 2 semanas realiza el largo viaje para llevar otro grupo de carne de vacuno y cordero. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vacunos y cordero para la venta de carne y los gastos de viaje al poblado de Quillabamaba.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Esmeralda is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Trinufadoras” (The Winners) which is located in the District of Andahuaylillas, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 25 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a six-year-old son. Esmeralda has a job selling beef. She carries her merchandise from Convención to Quillabamba, since she has customers who live there. It takes eight hours for her to reach her destination. Esmeralda sells mutton and beef in bulk. She distributes her products in the village of Quillabamba and returns every two weeks with another large shipment of mutton and beef.

Esmeralda is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of cattle and sheep so that she can sell the meat. She will also pay for her travel expenses to the village of Quillabamba. Esmeralda is grateful for this loan and promises to complete her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep so that she can sell the meat and to pay for her travel expenses to the village of Quillabamba.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Enock is a hardworking business man who is 29 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. For two years, he has been selling rubber stamps to make a living. Previously, he was a farmer. He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a rubber-stamp engraving machine. In the next five years, he wants to establish his own company.

loans.use: to buy a rubber-stamp engraving machine.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de trois enfants.Elle a fait une formation en teinture et en blanchisserie et offres ces services à domicile aux habitants de sa localité.A l'approche des fêtes, elle est très sollicité surtout pour la teinture.L'activité est très rentable et lui permet de participer fortement à l'entretien de sa famille et de prendre en charge ses propres besoins.Elle sollicite auprés de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 200000f pour acheter des produits de teinture et de blanchissement.Elle ambitionne d'élargir son activité et d'ouvrir une cantine pour exposer ses produits de teinture.
texts.en:
Khady is married and the mother of 3 children. She is trained in the techniques of laundering and dyeing, and works for local customers in their homes. Her skills are much in demand during the festival season, especially her dyeing skills. She earns good money and can both take care of her own needs and contribute heavily to the household expenses.

Khady is requesting a 200 000 franc loan from UIMCEC so that she can buy some dye products and laundry supplies. She would like to expand her business activities and, one day, open a small shop in which she can display her dyed merchandise.

loans.use: to buy dye products and laundry supplies.

loans.name: Deysi Yant Giraldo Garcia

texts.es: La señora D. a sus 31 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y niñas en su propio almacén localizado en la sala de su casa ubicada en el municipio de Marinilla situado al oriente de Antioquia. Esta labor la realiza la señora D. desde hace diez años. Con el fin de atender la demanda por temporada de fin de año que se aproxima, la señora D. desea comprar surtido para su almacén de ropa infantil y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ventas e ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia compuesta por su esposo y dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad. La señora D. sueña con tener otro punto de venta de ropa infantil.
texts.en: At 31 years of age, D. sells childrens clothes in her own shop based in the sitting room of her house.  She lives in Marinilla, to the east of Antioquia and has worked in this fashion for ten years. With a view to meeting client demand for the coming end of year season, D. wishes to buy stock for her childrens clothes shop.  This way she will be able to increase her sales and income which will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family - her husband and two children aged 8 and 3.  D. dreams of having a second childrens clothing retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy stock for a childrens clothes shop

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert runs a butcher shop as his primary business and also sells clothes, a business managed by the wife.  He has been doing these for the last five years, and earns a monthly profit of KES. 25,000. His other source of income is through farming. He is 32 years-old and married to Mary.  They have two school going children. 

He has applied for his third loan of  KES. 50, 000 from Kiva partner KADET LTD, and he plans to use part of the loan to buy more stock of meat to sell,  and also buy more clothes for sale during high season.

The anticipated profits he will save and provide for the family basic needs. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat to sell and  also buy more clothes for sale during high season .

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Mrs. Seang is a mother of 2 children and works in the farming business. She and her husband grow rice crops twice a year on her farmland. She has been trained in this type of work by experience, so even though she works in the field for the whole day, it is nothing to her. The important matter is that the business is providing for the basic necessities of her children. She is able to earn approximately $2.00 per day through this business. 

Mrs. Seang would like to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy rice seeds and to pay local laborers to plow her field. This loan will enable her to start growing her dry-season rice crops. She is very happy and very thankful.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and to pay local laborers to plow her field.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un paysan qui exploite des terres situées à quelques kilomètres de sa ville.Il pratique la culture sous pluie avec le mil et l'arachide.A la fin de la saison des pluies qui ne dure que trois mois, il fait du maraîchage à l'aide d'un puits creusé dans son périmètre.Il arrive ainsi à produire des légumes qu'il vend aux commerçants avec des bénéfices consistants suivants les variétés.Son activité lui permet d'entretenir correctement son épouse et ses cinq enfants dont les trois vont à l'école. Toutefois, son problème majeur reste l'accès à l'eau du fait de la profondeur de la nappe phréatique et de la difficulté de l'extraction manuelle du liquide.C'est pour apporter une solution à ce problème qu'il sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 100000f pour acheter une petite pompe qui l'aidera à tirer l'eau du puits.Son ambition est d'équiper et d'élargir son exploitation.
texts.en: The borrower is a farmer who works the land situated a few kilometers from his town.  He engages in rain-fed farming with millet and peanuts.  At the end of the rainy season that only lasts three months, he truck farms with the help of a well dug at his site.  He manages thus to produce vegetables that he sells to merchants with consistent profits according to the varieties.  His business allows him to properly support his spouse and five children, three of which attend school.  However, his major problem is access to water due to the depth of the water table and the difficulty of manually extracting the liquid.  To provide a solution to this problem, he is requesting a loan from UIMCEC for 100000 francs to buy a small pump that will help him draw water from the well.  His ambition is to equip and expand his operations.

loans.use: to buy a small pump.

loans.name: Ma.marivit

texts.en:
Ma. Marivit is 31 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Marivit works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Ma. Marivit has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Ma. Marivit aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Diana Janeth

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Diana, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  8 y 3 años de edad el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se  dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas, deja sus productos  a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez  que necesita. Este negocio empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco y le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace dos años y le gusta la ayuda que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte the members of the communal bank La Unión Hace La Fuerza (Unity is Strength) meet twice a month. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by the locals and are recognized throughout the country.

In this place we meet Diana, who is 26 years old, married and from this relationship she has two children who are 8 and 3 years of age and the oldest attends school. Her husband is a merchant.

Besides being a housewife she also sells all kinds of clothing. She sells door to door and also sells from her home where she has a little store. She works three days a week mostly in the mornings. She leaves her products on credit and collects every fifteen days. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever it is necessary. She began this business with the first loan that she received from the bank and is doing very well.

She is going to use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts and children’s clothing. She has been in this communal bank since it began two years ago and she likes the help that she receives from the institution. 

Her dreams are to get ahead and to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Kesilai

texts.en: Kesilai is 45 years old. She is married and has 7 children. She is a trained councilor and she has helped her community to resist and abolish female genital mutilation (FMG) practices. Through various trainings, she has been able to gather a lot of knowledge and she shares it with her group members especially the dangers of this practice and HIV-AIDS. Kiselai is a member of Inkiramat Women group which operates in Isinya as a self help group. Through the trainings she has learnt the importance of savings and greatly appreciates it. The group runs a group revolving fund; Kiselai accessed a small loan of $200 in 2005 and bought two local cows. She started selling milk after some time and up to today, the business is ever growing. She has five cows which are second class cross breeds. She repaid her loan promptly and this encouraged her to apply for another loan. In addition to selling milk, she sells items made of beads at Isinya town. Along with dairy cows, she rears steers for sale. She fattens them and after 6 months, they are sold at Isinya market. She has been able to educate her children, her first born has finished college whereas others are still in secondary school. Her major concern is to get school fees for her children and give them the best education which she did not receive.

loans.use: Kesilai would like to buy 4 Medium size steers.

loans.name: Perviz

texts.en: Perviz M. is 26 years old and single living in Agsu city. He started selling men's and women's clothing in the local bazaar two years ago. Perviz wants to increase his inventory by purchasing more of a selection to satisfy his local customers' needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Suluvale

texts.en:
Suluvale is motivated to start a small shop business as she has six children to support. She is from the village of Papaigalagala and she is 55 years old. She is wearing many hats, which include her mother’s responsibilities at home, her role in the village and church, but also her role as businesswoman.

She makes $300 profit per week which greatly assists her family financially, especially in supporting her six children. She has applied for another loan to keep her business going well.

loans.use: Buy more stock for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.en:
My name is Maria Martina and I have a small business selling firewood and dairy products from my home. I have been in business for several years and this business generates income that allows me to help cover my family's expenses and pay my suppliers.

I am requesting this loan to buy additional inventory to help me meet demand. Thanks to this business, my family's standard of living has increased.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria Martina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de leña y producto lacteos, ubicado en mi casa de habitación en el centro de mi colinia, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de activida, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y hacerle frente a los compromisos con los proveedores. Actulamente necesito de mayor inversión para satirfacer la demanda existente, gracias a los ingresos de este negoco hemos mejorado nuestro nivel de vida.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, cheeses and butter

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
SILVIA is an artist who works with handicrafts; she is 25 years old, with three children. She makes and embroiders comforter slips. She belongs to a group called Bajucu 2 together with Ms. Carmelina Vázquez Méndez (handicraft artist) and Ms. Dolores Hernández Vázquez (handicraft artist). With their loan they will invest in the purchase of more cloth and thread so as to be able to lower the prices of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

SILVIA es artesana, tiene 25 años, tres hijos. Ella confecciona y borda blusas de manta. Pertenece al grupo llamado Bajucu 2 junto con doña Carmelina Vázquez Méndez (artesana) y doña Dolores Hernández Vázquez (artesana). Con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de telas e hilos al por mayor para abaratar precios..

loans.use: With their loan they will invest in the purchase of more cloth and thread so as to be able to lower the prices of their products.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dovi A., 44 years old is married and the mother of three (03) children. She is a children clothes retailer. It is a very flourishing business but her means are too limited to satisfy the demand on the market. The big selling season is approaching with the year end holidays. She is requesting a financial help of $300 to stock up accordingly and to avoid running out of stock which would have an effect on her income.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 44 ans, Madame Dovi A. est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse d’habits d’enfants. C’est un commerce très florissant mais ses moyens sont très restreints pour satisfaire la demande sur le marché. La grande saison de vente approche avec les fêtes de fin d’année. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $300 pour s’approvisionner en conséquence afin d’éviter toute rupture de stock qui pourrait agir sur ses revenus.

loans.use: Stocking up on children clothing

loans.name: Ratna Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratna Devi M., 36 years old, lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district, Nepal. Mrs. M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children. Her husband, Mr. Bhai Gopal M., works in a furniture manufacturing shop. Her son is studying in grade 12. Her older daughter is studying in grade 10 and her younger daughter is studying in grade 4.

Mrs. M. is a cotton weaver, weaving in her own house. She has been doing her work for 18 years. She took 6 months training for her work from Small Cottage Industries near her area. She makes dresses to order out of the material she weaves. Now she is requesting her second loan of US$ 250 to buy thread for weaving and also to repair her loom.

loans.use: To buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria has been a member of the community bank “Retoño” for two years.  In that time she has learned that she has self worth, and can be independent. Ana Maria is 26 years old.  She has two daughters, one of whom is four and the other one.  
 Ana Maria’s business is selling wood products.  She has been selling them for four years.
Ana Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in her business.  Ana Maria hopes to improve her business by buying more wood and also a greater variety of wood.  
The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest earning account.  Ana Maria is saving to buy a car, which will help her transport her merchandise.  Her dream is to have a nice home and to be comfortable.

loans.use: Ana Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in her business.  Ana Maria hopes to improve her business by buying more wood and also a greater variety of wood.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocío Del Pilar A. Sánchez is 37 years old and studied through primary school. She has 4 dependent children. She lives in Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department.

Her business consists of buying animals such as cattle, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she then sells on Sundays at the Julcán market in Agallpampa. Before she began this business, she prepared and sold salchipollo (French fries with fried chicken), salchipapa (French fries with sausage), and fried fish. It didn’t work out well for her because she working in an area where there wasn’t much commercial activity; so, she quit that business and began selling livestock animals.

She is a member of the “Jesús Nazareno” communal bank, from which she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00. With that money she bought 1 sack of potatoes, cooking oil, and vegetables, for preparing the foods she was selling at that time. With this loan of S/. 1000.00, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 10 chickens, 15 guinea pigs, and 5 ducks. Rocío's dream is for her children to be educated and have good livelihoods.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rocío Del Pilar A. Sánchez tiene 37 años de edad, estudió solo primaria completa. Tiene 4 hijos y todos dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad. Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de animales como huachos, reses, cuyes y gallinas, los cuales ofrece y vende los domingos en la feria de Julcán y Agallpampa. Antes que entrara a este negocio, se dedicaba a preparar y vender salchipollo, salchipapa y pescado frito, no le iba muy bien ya que por la zona no había movimiento, por eso dejó ese negocio y se dedicó a la venta de animales. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús Nazareno” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró 1 saco de papas, aceite, verduras; para la preparación de los alimentos que en ese entonces vendía. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 10 gallinas, 15 cuyes y 5 patos. La señora Roció sueña con ver a sus hijos realizados.

loans.use: She will buy 10 chickens, 15 guinea pigs, and 5 ducks

loans.name: Sangimurod

texts.ru:
Sangimurod H. lives in Gissar district. He is 47 and married with four children. He does not have a formal education, but he works as an on-demand apartment repairman. This job allows him to earn money, but the work is seasonal and there is not always demand for repairs. The money he receives is not enough to feed his family, so he also raises livestock. Sangimurod buys calves, fattens them over 40-45 days, and then sells them on at a profit. He has been doing this for ten years. This business is popular and widely accepted in rural places, and for this reason it brings him income. At the moment, the amount of money Sangimurod can put into his business has decreased and he needs a loan to purchase more livestock. This will allow him to re-establish his business and bring his family needed income. He plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Холиков Сангимурод живет в районе Гиссар. Возраст 47 лет , женат и имеет 4 детей. Образования не имеет, но подрабатывает, занимаясь ремонтом квартир на заказ. Эта работа позволяет зарабатывать деньги, но заработок не дает ему нужный доход , так как деятельность является сезонной. Поэтому клиент дополнительно занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их необходимый срок , около 40-45 дней , а затем продает и получает прибыль , которую использует для расширения бизнеса. Занимается этим 10 лет. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности. Сейчас клиенту нужно увеличить товарооборот, что поможет получить дополнительный доход. Поэтому клиенгт обратился к нам за кредитом. А погасить кредит клиент сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-one years old and a young married woman. She has been retailing mobile phone credit cards for the past two years. In Ghana many of the city and town dwellers use mobile phones but are unable to pay for full credit. Therefore selling rechargeable cards in smaller units to phone users serves as an alternative way to enable users to afford credit on their phones.

Beatrice wants to use her loan to buy more rechargeable cards to retail them. She hopes that this loan will help her to save some money from her income to get herself back into school again.

Beatrice is a member of the group called “Gye Nyame” (meaning: except God). Members of the group agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy phone rechargeable cards and credit

loans.name: Anorhol

texts.ru:
Anorhol A. lives in the city of Vahdat. she is 42 years old, is married and has 6 children. She has a High School education. She is in the business of raising cattle. She purchases young calves on the market, raises them and sells them at a better price. This business is the main source of income for her family because Anorhol's husband is temporarily unemployed. Currently Anorhol would like to purchase a milk cow because the price of milk products has drastically increased on the local markets. The children need milk and this is why Anorhol has decided to get a loan. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдуллаева Анорхол жительница города Вахдат . Возраст 42 года, замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Анорхол занимается животноводством . Она разводит крупный рогатый скот . Клиентка покупает на рынке молодых бычков, откармливает их и продает по более выгоднй ей цене. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода ее большой семьи .Так как муж Анорхол временно не работает. В данный момент клиентка хочет купить дойную корову. Так как рынке очень сильно подорожала кисло-молочная продукция. А детям необходимо покупать молоко. Поэтому Анорхол решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing a milk cow

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Mr. Ke S. is a 36-year-old boat driver who lives in Phnom Penh. His wife, Le Hongfeu is 34 and sells groceries from home. Together, the couple can generate up to $25 each day in revenue to help support their three children, all of whom are students.

Mr. Ke is applying for a loan of $1000. He would like to use $500 to purchase more groceries for his wife's business. With the remaining $500 he would like to invest towards opening a new business and start a fish-selling stand.

Becasue Mr. Ke was unavailable when we visited, his wife is pictured above.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services throughout both rural and urban communities in Cambodia.

loans.use: Half to purchase more groceries for his wife's business, and half to open another stand to sell fish.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru:
Rohat R. lives in Jaloliddini Rumy. She is married and has three children. She has a higher education. She works in a dining hall. She bakes pies and sambusas (Tajik dumplings). She sells these at the market. Because the price of flour is growing, she has decided to take out a loan to buy flour. This will allow her to maintain her low prices and thus attract new clients. This way, she can earn more and further help her family. She plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Раупова Рохат жительница района Джалолиддини Руми. Замужем , имеет троих детей. Имеет высшее образование. Работает в столовой. Выпекает пирожки и самбусу. Реализовывает на рынке.В связи с тем , что цены на муку возраствают она решила получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить муку. Это даст возможность поддерживать цены и таким образом привлечь клиентов. Этим она сможет больше заработать и помочь семье. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing flour

loans.name: Afi Dogbéda

texts.fr: G. Afi Dogbéda est née le 13/09/1974 à lomé. Elles est mariée et a un enfant. Son mari est topographe. C’est une commerçante expérimentée dans la vente du poisson fumé et frisé. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour accroître ses achats de marchandises et augmenter ainsi ses revenus.
texts.en:
Afi Dogbéda G. was born on September 13, 1974 in Lomé. She is married and has one child. Her husband is topographer. She is an experienced seller of smoked and fried fish. She is requesting this loan so as to be able to purchase more goods to sell and thus expand her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of smoked fish

loans.name: Khairia

texts.en:
Khairia, 32, is married with four children between the ages of 15 and 6. A clothes seller since 2002, she works daily from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Khairia is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for resale to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale to improve her business.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov V., age 27, is married and lives with her husband in Memot district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

Because government-provided electricity is not yet available in her area, the people in her community either buy electricity from a private service provider or they buy a battery to generate electricity for their household. Mrs. V. and her husband operate a business recharging batteries for the people in her community. Basically, whenever the battery is out of its power, the battery owner has to find a recharging service. Mrs. V. and her husband can make around $5 for their services. 

This couple would like to request for a loan to purchase a machine which can charge many batteries at once. This will allow them to increase a number of batteries they charge as well as a their profit margin.

Her husband appears in the photograph, because Mrs. V. was not available.

loans.use: To buy a machine that can charge many batteries at one time.

loans.name: Jaemie

texts.es:
La señora Jaemie tiene 30 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Astopilco 1096 Río Seco, distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Jaemie estudió para Auxiliar de Educación, pero no ejerce su profesión porque no hay plazas disponibles. Se casó a los 21 años y tiene un hijo de 3 años.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de productos de belleza y joyas por catálogo, pero como es una mujer emprendedora, entonces los fines de semana hace parrilladas o polladas y los días miércoles cebiche. Realiza su negocio en su casa y en forma ambulatoria.
Su primer crédito fue de S/. 300, el cual canceló en 4 cuotas y compró insumos para preparar combinados.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, alquilará un puesto en el mercado de su zona.
Jaemie sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jaemie is 30 years old. She belongs to the "Mientras Tanto Decisiones" Group and lives on Astopilco street, 1096 Rio Seco, El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad region, Peru.

Jaemie studied as an Education Assitant but has not gone into her profession because there are no available positions. She married when she was 21 and has a three-year-old son.

Her business consists of selling beauty products and catalog jewelry. However, since she is an entrepreneurial woman, on the weekends, she cooks barbecue and chicken and, on Wednesdays, ceviche. She conducts this business from her home and on foot.

Her first loan was for S. 300, which she reapid in four parts and bought ingredients to make her dishes. With this loan of S. 500, which will be repaid in four parts, she will rent a stall in her area's market. Jaemie dreams of having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will rent a stall in the market in her area.

loans.name: Roya

texts.es: La señora Roya, de 41 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que están estudiando, vive junto a su conviviente quien siempre la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a crianza  de pollos en las instalaciones de su vivienda, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año atrás, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen cuidado a sus pollos, para luego llevarlos a vender con un buen pezo y sobre todo sanos. Este  negocio le es rentable, ya que cada 45 días está enviando sus pollos al mercado. Es su 5to préstamo con MFP, ella es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un galpón para sus animales y comprar alimento balanceado para ellos.
texts.en:
Señora Roya is 41-years-old and is the mother of 3 children, who are in school. She lives with her husband who always supports her a lot. She raises chickens in cages at her home. She has done this work for one year. What she likes about it is giving good care to her chickens and then taking them to sell at a good weight, and above all, in healthy condition. This business is profitable for her, since she sends her chickens to market every 45 days. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is punctual with her payments. With the money she is requesting, she is going to have a shed constructed for her animals and she will purchase balanced nutrition for them.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a shed where she can raise her chickens

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee  es socia del Bancomunal San Juan 
Haydee es casada  tiene 35 años, dos hijos de 10 y 13 años están en la escuela. Ella tiene un negocio de cabinas de Internet que se llama C & S Carmen Y Stephany hace dos años empezó con dos maquinas ahora tiene diez maquinas y un control con lo que maneja todo, también da servicio de impresiones, scaneos, fotocopiadora y otros 
En Finca se siente contenta por que ha podido logra muchas metas, invertir y los intereses son bajos   
Necesita un préstamo de 800.00 soles para implementar su negocio de cabina de Internet 
El sueño que tiene es abrir un locutorio e implementar su casa
texts.en:
Haydee is a partner of the San Juan Community Bank. She is 35 years old and married, with two children. Her children are ages 10 and 13, and both of them attend school. Haydee owns an internet cafe called C & S Carmen Y Stephany. She started two years ago with two computers and now she has ten, as well as a system to manage all of them. Haydee also has a printer, scanner, photocopier, and other equipment. She is happy with Finca because she's been able to achieve many of her goals, she's able to invest, and the interest rates are low. Haydee needs a loan of 800.00 soles to implement her internet cafe business. Her dream is to open an international calling center in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Implement her internet cafe business

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
For the past five years, Augustina has been a merchant in the local market of Bawalashie community, a suburb of Accra in Ghana. She is a forty-year-old woman, married with four kids who are schooling. She lives with her family in the same community in a rented apartment.  She is a busy petty trader who sells cassava, charcoal, tinned tomatoes, yams, maize, etc. on the top of a table in the local market. 

Augustina loves trading, the business through which she earns a living for her family. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. She is a member of the community group called ‘To God Be the Glory’ Trust Group. In this group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Modinut

texts.en: Modinut sells kitchen items and drinks. Modinut is 27 years old. She is married and has a child. Modinut has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for almost 2 years. She used a loan to start her business and the business is  growing gradually. Modinut is asking for a loan of N50,000 ($350 USD) to purchase more kitchen items and drinks. She is very happy with LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial assistance and promises to be faithful with her repayments.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen items

loans.name: Hipólita

texts.es:
La señora Hipolita G. se dedica a su actividad de crianza de ganado en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario da lugar a la crianza del ganado que con mucho esfuerzo alimenta y vela por su desarrollo para luego que crezcan extraer la leche para la venta o comercializar dicho ganado.

El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra del ganado ya que requiere de dichos animales para continuar en su actividad y así continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hipolitia Garcia works raising livestock in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega. Every day she cares for these animals, feeding them and watching over them so that when they are grown she will be able to sell them or their milk to earn a living. The reason she has approached Kiva partner Ceprodel is to obtain a loan to buy more cattle, as she needs these animals to continue earning money and taking care of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Dios Es Amor 2 Group

texts.en:
Bank of Hope is starting its fifth loan cycle with Esperanza International. A large number of members in this group are Haitian immigrants looking for better opportunities than the ones available in their home country. The lack of employment opportunities available in their area have taken them to self-employment, which allows them to guarantee some income for their families, and in many cases, send some relief money to their families back home.

Maria V. is the representative for this group of five. She has been appointed by her mates to collect their payments and in general, she watches over the others and knows the general status of everyone's businesses. This is a position of much respect. Maria sells shoes and clothing. Her highest selling items are tennis shoes. She will use this loan to buy more tennis shoes and some clothing items that sell well, like jeans. Maria hopes one day to have her own store, where customers will come to her. This would allow her to have a more relaxed lifestyle and spend more time with her children.

Please support these entrepreneurs' businesses through this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: Buy tennis shoes and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Wilfredo Antonio O. S. tiene la edad de 46 años, su estado civil es soltero. Wilfredo tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es brindar el servicio de enderezado y pinturas para automóviles. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda por lo que anteriormente laboraba con su hermano, pero decidió establecer su propio negocio y es con mucho esfuerzo que lo ha logrado. Los propósitos de Wilfredo para su negocio son de brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes y además ofrecer la mejor calidad para obtener más clientes. El financiamiento que esta solicitando  es destinado solamente par capital de trabajo y comprar productos como pintura, base, lija y otros materiales. El sueño de Wilfredo es el costo de los materiales bajen de precios para trabajar de manera mas factible.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo Antonio O. S. is 46 and single. He has two children who go to school. Wilfredo has run a body shop for more than ten years. He operates his business from home, but he used work with his brother. Wilfredo decided to set up his own business and with a lot of hard work, he has achieved it. Wilfredo's goals for his business are to give his clients the best possible service as well as offering the best quality to attract more customers. The loan he is requesting will be used as work capital and to buy products such as paint, base, sandpaper and other materials. Wilfredo's dreams is that the cost of materials will decrease making his work possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
For many years, Merina has owned a small store for selling local alcohol in the Ruaha neighborhood of Iringa. She is married and belongs to the Ipogolo D group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for local alcohol prepation. She is hoping to increase her profits and grow her business through this loan.

loans.use: To buy more items for local alcohol preparation.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es: Ulises tiene 34 años, vive con sus hermanos en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir de manera industrial, la ropa que confecciona es del tipo deportiva y casual.  Cuando se inició solo brindaba el servicio de costura, pero la experiencia lo dotó de las habilidades de confección y ahora él mismo está diseñando su propias prendas. Su labor la realiza de lunes a miércoles, los jueves y viernes viaja a otras ciudades para vender su mercadería a los comerciantes de ropa, vende al por mayor, y su margen de ganancia muy bueno cuando tiene mayores ventas y contacto con clientes nuevos. Para más adelante, Ulises desea expandir sus horizontes y vender sus prendas en otras ciudades. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se siente muy contento de la oportunidad brindada para trabajar, mejorar y crecer. El  dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales básicos para sus confecciones, tales como telas, hilos y demás implementos para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Ulises is 34 years old. He lives with his siblings in their own home. For the past 3 years he has sewn sports and casual clothing commercially. When he started he only offered tailoring services, but with experience he became skilled at sewing and now he designs his own clothes. He works Monday to Wednesday, and Thursday and Friday he travels to other cities to sell his merchandise to clothing vendors. He sells wholesale and his profit margin is very good when he has high sales and contact with new customers. In the future, Ulises would like to expand his horizons and sell his clothes in other cities. This is the first time he has received a loan with MFP and he is very happy with the opportunity to work, improve, and grow. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase basic sewing materials, such as fabric, threads and other tools so he can increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials

loans.name: Maston

texts.ru: Мастон Имонова проживает в районе Руми. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Возраст 45 лет. Мастон по профессии 15 лет работала учителем. В данный момент Мастон вместе со своим супругом и старшим сыном занимаются земледелием. Они выращивают картофель и продают на рынке. Мастон хочет получить кредит и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Maston I. lives in the Rumy region. She is married and has eight children. She is 45 years old. Mason has worked as a teacher for fifteen years. At this time Maston together with her spouse and oldest son are in agriculture. They grow potatoes and sell on the market. Maston wants to get a loan and expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For expansion of business

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria Auxiliadora M. tiene la edad de 42 años, reside en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos de 15,16 y18 años los cuales estudian. Sus planes es remodelar su casa para darles a sus hijos una casa digna, su esposo es abogado y asesor administrativo. Su negocio es un preescolar donde imparte clases a niños, también vende cosméticos y imparte clases por la tarde en el colegio del barrio de esta manera tiene varios ingresos, son dieciséis años laborando de maestra. Este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios que ha logrado, con este préstamo lo quiere invertir para remodelar una aula de su colegio y cambiar un inodoro para darle un buen servicio a sus alumnos. Como madre desea apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio. Y poder crecer en su negocio en la venta de cosmético
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora M. is 42 years old, lives in the Casimiro Sotelo district of the capital city of Managua and is married with three children, ages 15, 16, and 18 who are all students. She plans to remodel her house in order to give her children a worthy home. Her husband is a lawyer and an administrative advisor. She runs a preschool where she gives lessons to children, she sells cosmetics and teaches classes in the afternoon at a high school in her neighborhood. She's been teaching for 16 years and through all these endeavors she has many forms of income. This is her sixth cycle through Afodenic, and she is grateful to this institution for the benefits it has afforded her. Maria plans to invest this loan in remodeling a classroom in her school and to purchase a new toilet in order to better serve her students. As a mother she wants to support her children in their studies and be able to grow her cosmetic business.

Translated from Spanish by Shane Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to remodel a classroom and purchase a toilet

loans.name: Nakasero East Nasozi Joyce Group

texts.en:
N. Joyce is a married woman of 28 years blessed with five children, who all are going to school. She is also looking after two dependents who are also schooling. She is a group leader of Nakasero East. She has been in the banana business for more than four years. 

She is using the loan to purchase bananas from villages to supply to the markets. She is adding capital as well as stock to her business. She is a young, hardworking businesslady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase bananas from villages to supply to the markets

loans.name: Clotilde Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Reyna es soltera, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Reyna viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende verduras, cereales y de la selva compra fruta que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Reyna sueña con que sus hijas culminen sus estudios y tener un puesto estable para su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is a partner of "Banco Comunal Solución." Reyna is 25 years old and a single mother of two children. She travels to the Ayacucho forest to sell vegetables and cereals. While in the forest, she buys fruits to sell in the supplies market of the city. Reyna needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles for the purchase of cereals. Reyna dreams of her children completing their education and having a permanent location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cristina Bejarano, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereals.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla Patricia R. S. tiene 29 años de edad. Es casada y vive con sus 2 hijos. Desde hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella es una joven muy emprendedora y siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar muy fuertemente. Anteriormente se dedica a estudiar, pero debido a las circunstancias  tenía que generar más ingresos a su familia ya que sus hijos necesitaban el pan de cada día y además no podía seguir estudiando, por lo que decide hacerse cargo de este negocio ya que le generaba ciertas ganancias. Ella solicita este financiamiento para invertirlo en capital de trabajo como pantalones, camisas, faldas, camisolas, perfumes, cremas y colonias. Su deseo en un futuro es lograr establecer su propio tienda.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia R. S. is 29 years old, married and lives with her 2 children. For the past 3 years, she has sold general merchandise. She is an enterprising young woman who always dedicates herself to working extremely hard. She used to be a student, but her circumstances dictated that she start working so that she could generate an income to meet her children’s daily needs. As a result, she quit school and started this business.

Karla is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, camisoles, perfumes, crèmes, and colognes. She hopes to open her own store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Phakkdey

texts.en:
Mrs. Phakkdey U., age 45, is widow with a 19-year-old daughter. She lives along National Road Number One approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Phakkdey has been operating a grocery store for many years. She is also a tailor. Phakkdey is applying for a loan of $200 to purchase additional grocery items to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa C. Solís es socia del banco Comunal Dapreydi en Tosagua en la provincia de Manabí, ella está casada y sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes

María Teresa es  comerciante desde hace 7 años,  tienen su negocio de artículos de primera necesidad ubicado en el mercado de la localidad donde atienden solo los sábados,   junto a su esposo  comparten las actividades ya que él tiene un negocio de venta de platos en el mismo mercado.

Además tienen una pequeña tienda en su casa donde atiende de domingo a viernes, su esposo se encarga de comprar los productos a los mayoristas y distribuir en los dos locales.

Con  el préstamo que ha solicitado a la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra productos  de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, fideos, etc. Para abastecer mejor sus tiendas de abastos.

El sueño de  María Teresa es poner un local de venta de ropa para toda la familia así como sabanas y edredones, pero sin dejar su tienda que es su sustento diario.
texts.en:
María Teresa C. Solís is a member of the Dapreydi Community Bank in Tosagua in the province of Manabí. She is married and her children are older and independent. María Teresa has been a merchant since she was seven years old. She has a business selling basic necessities located in the local market which she attends only on Saturdays.
