Alongside her husband, they share the work since he has a business selling dishes in the same market. Additionally, they have a small shop in their home which they attend to Sunday through Thursday. Her husband is in charge of buying products at wholesale and distributing them to the two locations. With the loan that she has requested from the foundation, she is going to invest in the purcahse of basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, oil, salt, noodles, etc. in order to stock her shops better. María Teresa's dream is to start a shop selling clothing for the whole family as well as sheets and duvets but without neglecting their shop which is their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as rice, sugar oil, salt, noodles to stock their shops.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía trabaja en una tienda vendiendo ropa, esta en ese trabajo temporalmente ya que con el crédito que solicita comprará una vaca la cual criará en la casa de sus padres y así poder producir y vender leche, es soltera vive en la comunidad de Río Abajo ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Es el segundo crédito, su crédito anterior fue cancelado puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Rosalía.

loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera para iniciar el negocio de venta de leche.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed M. is 29 years old and single. He lives in Shanzu, Mombasa, where he operates a video showroom. He has been operating the business for three and a half years and mainly targets the youth and school children. He also performs acrobatics and dancing and hopes to make the art thrive both locally and abroad.

Mohamed is borrowing his first loan from KADET, a Kiva partner, and with it plans to purchase better furniture and a power meter and to complete some electronics repairs.

In the future, he intends to acquire a bigger screen and to expand the business premises to accommodate more customers. 

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase furniture and a power meter and to conduct electronics repairs for his video (movie) showroom

loans.name: Mr. Bol Va Group

texts.en:
Mr. Bol V. is the group leader of four people who all live in Thum village in Takeo province. He and his wife are farmers and they also are egg sellers. Since this business is going well, they want to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more eggs to re-sell.

Mr. Bol V. is the father of two children who are both too young to work or study because they are at the age of three and five years old.

loans.use: To buy more age to re-sell

loans.name: Tark

texts.en: Tark P., 57, is a widowed farmer who lives with one of her daughters in the Takeo province. She typically makes US$2 each day and would like to increase her profits. Her daughter who pictured with her from home is a hotel staff member. She typically makes US$5 of profit a day. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Tark P. included. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer for the farm, increasing her current profits and prospects for the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Marivet

texts.es:
Marivet es una socia activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 37 años, es madre de cinco hijos menores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es tècnico de electricidad.
Marivet se dedica a la preparación y venta de caldo de gallina, negocio que realiza en su casa de lunes a viernes, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano ya que la venta es realizada por las mañanas. Forma parte del Banco Comunal  “Las Libertadoras” desde hace dos años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que le permitieron invertir en mesas y sillas para un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de dulces, panes y biscochuelos para la venta desde su casa. La meta de Marivet es tener un restaurante bien implementado y seguir apoyando a su familia para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marivet is an active member and lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali district. She is 37 years old, is the mother of five young children, and has the support of her husband, who is an electrician.

Marivet prepares and sells chicken stock. She runs her business from her home, Monday through Friday, and gets up very early since sales occur in the mornings. She has been part of the “Las Libertadores” communal bank for the past two years. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to invest in tables and chairs to be able to better serve her clients.

Currently, she needs a loan of 500 PEN, which will be used to purchase candy, bread, and cakes to sell from her home. Marivet’s goal is to have a well-run restaurant and to continue helping her family to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candy, breads, and cakes to sell from her home

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
La señora Daniela D. tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Asunción Martines, tienen 3 hijos pequeños y viven en su propia casa que esta situada en Barrio Las Mercedes Cambyreta. 

La señora Daniela es propietaria de una Lavandería de ropas que posee en su domicilio particular, ademas realiza trabajos de costura, y como tiene conocimientos de peluquería realiza cortes de pelo los fines de semana. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mas de 5 años y mediante esto tiene varios ingresos que le ayudan a solventar los gastos de la casa y mantener a sus hijos. Su esposo es chofer de una empresa de Taxi por lo tanto también posee un buen ingreso que aporta al hogar y asi pueden salir adelante y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se les presente.

El destino del crédito es para realizar algunos arreglos en su local.
texts.en:
Daniela D. is 36 years old, is married to her long-time husband, Asunción Martines, and has 3 small children. They live in their own home in the Barrio Las Mercedes Cambyreta neighborhood. Daniela is the owner of a laundromat that she operates out of her home. She also does sewing projects, and with her knowledge of hairdressing, she gives haircuts on the weekends. She has been doing this work for the last 5 years, and these several sources of income have helped her to cover her household expenses and care for her children. Her husband is a driver for a taxi company, and he also earns a good income that goes to support the household and that way they can get by and cover any emergency that might come up. The loan will be used to do some remodeling of her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling of the shop

loans.name: Vang

texts.en: Mr. Vang S. is a villager in Thmei village in Takeo province. He is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it. So, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks to breed. His wife, Mrs. Nim Nak, helps him with the duck breeding. Mr. Vang S. is a father of five children, two of whom help their parents with the duck breeding while the others are attending the local school. His wife is on the left side of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en: Fabian has been a New York City cab driver for nine years. Knowing that his current cab needed upgrading to meet more rigorous safety requirements, Fabian's family urged him to contact ACCION USA for a micro-loan. Fabian’s loan will be used to purchase a new car, without which he would lose his livelihood. Since both Fabian's family in New York and his relatives in his native Ecuador rely on his income, Fabian is very glad that he was able to get the financing needed to keep his business afloat. While he was able to learn how to navigate New York City streets on his own, he credits ACCION USA with helping him navigate the US financial system. Fabian hopes to eventually save enough money to buy a house here, and realize his own American Dream. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy a newer taxicab

loans.name: Denis Isaac

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, el señor Denis T. se dedica a la actividad pecuaria por medio de la crianza de ganado que ha sabido desarrollar y adquirir gran experiencia en esta actividad.
 
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de dos terneros de desarrollo con el propósito de proceder a su crianza y sacarles el máximo provecho para así obtener los ingresos para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Nagarote, Sr. Denis T. raises livestock. He has acquired extensive experience in this activity. At the moment, he is requesting a loan to buy two calves that he will raise so that he can generate income to improve the standard of living for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en: Enhbayar is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. They have been living in their current home for 15 years. In 1999, he rented a counter at a local market and started his used product trading business. Since he started his business, Enhbayar has been able to pay his children's university tuition fees and afford his household expenses. Currently, he has a working capital of 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD). His wife has been supportive of him and his business since the beginning. Enhbayar is a very hard-working person. He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase additional inventory in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou L. is from the city of Matatalaib, Tarlac. She is 29 years old and married with one infant child. To make a living, Marilou owns a specialized retail store where she sells mobile phone credits. Marilou has been in business over 2 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP monthly.  Marilou has recently joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to expand her business.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her mobile phone business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia A. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Lucia is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a specialized retail store making and selling charcoal in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tat

texts.en: Mrs. Tat H. is 28 years old and is a resident of Siem Reap, a province of Cambodia. She and her husband own a small business in which they mainly buy big pieces of wood and chop them up into small pieces to sell to earn a living. Tat H. has two young kids who are dependent on their income. Tat H. is applying for a loan to purchase gasoline for her cultivating machine, which she uses to deliver wood from the forest.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline for her cultivating machine

loans.name: Ollantay De Wayracpuncu Group

texts.es:
Gregoria, tiene 53  años, es casada, tiene nueve hijos y vive en la comunidad D. Phiry  a 10 minutos D. Ollantaytambo.

Gregoria nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Ollantay D. Wayracpuncu”  somos 15 integrantes (7 mujeres y 8 varón), la junta directiva está conformada por Juan que es el presidente, Elva que es la Tesorera,  José Darío que  es la secretaria y Augusto que es la fiscal. Las reuniones  son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa seD. Ollantaytambo y en esta oportunidad  me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi principal actividad económica.  

“Gregoria hace 3 años que participa en el banco comunal Ollantay D. Wayracpuncu la Unidad D. Micro finanzas D. la  Asociación Arariwa”.

Gregoria su principal actividad económica es la venta y compra D. animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, etc.  Sus clientes vienen D. las ciudades Machupicchu y Ollantaytambo a comprar  cuyes. Sus actividades económicas complementarias son cultivar verduras  y crianza D. truchas.  Gregoria requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas.  

La mayoría D. los socios son comerciantes por ejemplo  algunos se dedican a la  venta D. comestibles,  alimentos preparados, artesanía, comida, alimentos, medicamentos, cd’s y otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo son obreros, albañiles, transportistas, etc. La mayoría D. los socios son puntuales y responsables con las cuotas.   

La ciudad D. Urubamba se encuentra a una hora y diez minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 53 years old, married, and has nine children. She lives in the community of Phiry, which is ten minutes away from Ollantaytambo.

Gregoria says that her Communal Bank “Ollantay D. Wayracpuncu” consists of 15 members (7 women and 8 men). The board of directors consists of Juan who serves as president, Elva who serves as treasurer, José Darío who serves as secretary, and Augusto who serves as auditor. They meet every thirty days at the central office of Asociación Arariwa in Ollantaytambo. Gregoria says she was selected to represent the Communal Bank by providing testimony about her business activity. She joined the Communal Bank “Ollantay D. Wayracpuncu” three years ago as part of the microfinance unit of Asociación Arariwa. Gregoria buys and sells small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, etc. Her customers come from the cities of Machupicchu and Ollantaytambo to buy guinea pigs. Her business activities complement her other pursuits, which incluD. farming and raising trout. Gregoria needs a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Most of the members are merchants who sell products such as groceries, prepared foods, handicrafts, snacks, medicines, and CDs. Others proviD. services such as farm labor, bricklaying, transportation, etc. The majority of the members are punctual and responsible with their loan payments.

The city of Urubamba is located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs & chickens

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is 46 years old. He is married with 5 children  between 8 and 20 years old. Three of his children are attending school. Charles is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years. His main products are maize, beans, millet and milk which he sells to institutions like schools and at the local market. His main challenges are lack of an organized market and transport and communication problems. 

Charles has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.30, 000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for consumption and sale. In future, he hopes practice dairy farming on a larger scale and to produce over 20 litres of milk daily. 

Charles  is grateful to Kiva lenders  for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Panamericana, se reúnen cada dos semanas la  Asociación Comunal EL SOL. Su presidenta es María C. C., ella se dedica a producir y vender helados hace 25 años, aprendió esta actividad sola, con el primer préstamo que obtuvo en Pro Mujer compró una garrafa y poco a poco fue equipando su taller, ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la gelatina y el azúcar. Ella también cuenta con un lugar de venta  cerca a un complejo deportivo, le ayuda en su negocio su hija y considera que su grupo es como una familia porque todas se ayudan.

Las demás  integrantes de esta Asociación tienen variados negocios que se dedican a la comercialización, producción y servicio.
texts.en:
The community group EL SOL meets at Panamericana, one of Pro Mujer's offices. Its president, Maria C. C., has operated a business making and selling ice cream for 25 years. She picked up the skills for the work on her own. With her first Pro Mujer loan, she bought an ice cream maker and she has slowly equipped the business ever since. She now needs a loan to buy basic supplies like gelatin and sugar. Maria sells her product at a spot near a sports field. Her daughter helps her with the business but she considers the whole community group to be her family because of the help they have provided. The other group members operate various kinds of sales, production and service businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Essential supplies for various businesses

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a 40-year-old member of Faulu Kenya under a group called 'Ikinu Clean Shine'.  He does dairy farming and sells kerosene to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years and has employed two people.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to stock kerosene for sale in his Kwa Solo Kerosene Shop.  Solomon is happy because he was able to open up his kerosene shop with Faulu Kenya's help.  He hopes to open a petrol station in the future.

loans.use: To stock kerosene for sale

loans.name: Ariunzul

texts.en:
Ariunzul A. is 37, married, and the mother of a three children. She and her family live together in a ger (the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent), in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter, Azzaya, attends a local secondary school; her son Nyam-Erdene is 8 years old and attends a Buddhist monastery; and her younger daughter, Azjargal, is 2 years old and stays at home.

Ariunzul successfully operates a bicycle repair service. She also owns a small car repair business that they started in 2009. At first, the couple rented a small tire-repair shop but, after a year of successful business operation, she managed to open a new sales point and expanded her services.

Ariunzul and her family have been planning to grow their business in the future. Ariunzul is a helpful person with a good personality. She says, “My dream is one day to change my repair place into a large and warm auto-repair service.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to start a grocery store.

loans.use: To start a new grocery store business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El señor Alfredo N. Solís, es un hombre muy trabajador, el vive con uno de sus hijos y se ayudan en los gastos de la casa, ellos quieren una mejor calidad de vida y  requiere de este crédito para reparar un techo de madera de su vivienda, ya que con las lluvias tan intensas que han caído, el techo esta muy dañado y temen que con la humedad que guarda la madera ocurra un accidente y se pueda caer. El Señor Alfredo les agradece la ayuda que le brindan por que de verdad que si necesita la reparacion de este techo.
texts.en:
Alfredo N. Solís is a very hard-working man. He lives with one of his children, and they both help with household expenses. They want a better quality of life, and he needs the loan to repair the wooden roof of their home, since with the recent intense rainfalls the roof is quite damaged and they fear that with the humidity in the roof, there will be an accident and the roof could fall.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of a wooden roof

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El señor V. labora para AFUNIC, donde se desempeña como, es soltero tiene una persona a su cargo.
CEPRODEL me ha otorgado 2 créditos  han sido para gastos personales de salud. 
 CEPRODE me ha brindado la  oportunidad de resolver mis problemas de salud.
texts.en:
Mr. V. works for AFUNIC (Association of United Pharmacies in Nicaragua). He has one person under his care. “Ceprodel has granted me two loans that have been for personal health expenses. Ceprodel has given me the opportunity to resolve my health problems.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses for eye exams and to buy glasses

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob F. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 44 years old. Jacob is married. To make a living, Jacob owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jacob has been farming for more than 20 years. He now owns a tricycle that he uses to transport people around his community. He says his income from driving helps in their daily needs.

Jacob joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacob is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jacob from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Faamamalu

texts.en:
Faamamalu F. is 29 and married with two children.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Faamamalu has 2 years of experience in this business.  Faamamalu needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $162 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Faamamalu joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faamamalu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is 53 years old and is married with seven children. He is well-known in the business of selling cosmetics. He has been in this business for about eight years and his business hours are from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Yusufu, after realizing how much the number of his customers has increased and how small his business place is, is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase the size of his business as well as the size of his business place.

If successful, Yusufu hopes that he will earn more profits than previously. With these profits, he will keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics such as body lotion, soap, etc.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa D. Jesús C. D. P. D. 50 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo que se dedica a estudiar, y junto a quien vive en San Martín departamento D. San Salvador. Teresa posee un comedor en el mercado municipal D. San Martín, lugar en el cual posee muchos clientes, los cuales en su mayoría son personas que trabajan en el mismo lugar. Ella se encarga D. elaborar desayunos y almuerzos y diferentes tipos D. bebidas naturales. Teresa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. frutas, verduras, granos básicos y otros más, los cuales son la materia prima para elaborar los platillos. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder mejorar sus ventas y D. esta manera contribuir con los gastos del hogar, y brindarle todo lo que su hijo necesita como alimentación ropa y hogar.
texts.en: Teresa D. Jesus C. D. Perez is 50 years old and lives with her husband and their son, who is currently studying in school. They live in San Martin in the state of San Salvador. Teresa owns a diner in the San Martin town market, where she has a lot of clients, the majority of whom work in the same place. She is in charge of making breakfast, lunch, and different types of natural drinks. Currently, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a greater quantity of fruits, vegetables, basic grains, and other things, which serve as the main ingredients in the meals she prepares. She is doing all of this with the desire to improve her sales and thereby help with the domestic expenses and proviD. her son with everything he needs, such as food, clothing, and shelter.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fruits, and basic grains to prepare food.

loans.name: Manth

texts.en:
Manth M., 45 years old, is a housewife who lives Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She always takes care of her children and does all the housework such preparing house, cooking meals and other duties every day. The main source of family income is from the business of her husband, who is pictured here. 

Manth M.' husband is a grocery seller. For instance, his products are cooking materials, plastic products and clothes as well. He always goes to the other province in Cambodia to sell his items. This couple has five children, all of whom are single. 

Manth M.’ husband needs more capital for improving his business. That is why Manth M. will use 80 percent of her loan to purchase more inventory for her husband's business and the rest of money for daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her husband's business and the rest of money use for daily expenses

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Diakité est âgée de 49 ans,  mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  au quartier Sokala de la ville de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Secrétaire de Direction, parallèlement à cette profession, elle mène des activités commerciales. Elle a appris le commerce dès son jeune âge, auprès de ses parents qui étaient des commerçants. Fatoumata  commença son activité  par le commerce de céréales, par la suite la vente d’articles divers importés du Burkina Faso. En cette époque, elle était intermédiaire dans le circuit de la vente, elle prenait chez les grossistes pour les placer auprès de ses clients qui étaient généralement des collègues de services. 
Après son licenciement, pour ne pas rester inactive, elle continua mais en intensifiant la même activité. 
Dans  le but de satisfaire sa demande clientèle surtout pour les fêtes qui s’approchent (Tabaski, Noël et le Réveillon), elle décide de continuer avec Soro Yiriwaso en demandant un nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 42 mois, il  a déjà eu 3  prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés. 
Elle  est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 4 cartons de parfums et 15 chemises. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et
Effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et à  aider son mari. Son ambition est de développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Diakité is 49 years old, married and the mother of four. She lives in a traditional family in the Sokala district in the town of Ségou (the fourth administrative district of Mali).  In addition to being an administrative secretary, she is also a merchant. She has learned this trade very early on from her parents who were merchants as well. She has started her business by selling cereals, and later also various other items imported from Burkina Faso. Back then, she was an intermediary in the selling chain; she would purchase goods from wholesaler and sell them to her customers, mostly her co-workers. After she lost her job, in order to avoid being idle, she continued with her business, concentrating on it more fully.

In order to be able to better meet customer demand, especially in view of approaching holidays: Tabaski (Eid), Christmas and New Year’s Eve, she decided to continue collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and request another loan. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 42 months. She already had three solidarity loans and two individual loans, all duly repaid. She is now on her third individual loan, which she plans to use for purchasing four boxes of perfumes and 15 shirts. She stocks up in Burkina Faso and sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed of both men and women.  She plans to achieve a monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband. Her goal is to expand her business further.

loans.use: Purchasing various items

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn L., age 33, sells firewood products in her local community. Genelyn has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have five school-aged children and live in the village of Romarate, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 
 
In 2007, Genelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Genelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Genelyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Genelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional firewood products to sell

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio   solicito 800 $us; trabaja como enfermera auxiliar en una clínica. Vive en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. Está casada y tiene un hijo pequeño de dos años.
 El crédito lo destinara para la continuación de sus estudios como fisioterapeuta, y así aspirar a un mejor cargo dentro  su trabajo. Es el tercer  crédito en impro y el segundo vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Roció requested $800 USD.  She’s employed in a clinic as a Nurse’s Aide.  She lives in the Rio Seco neighborhood of El Alto.  She’s married and has a two year old son.

The loan will be used to continue her studies to become a Physiotherapist and be able to aspire to a better position within her work.  

This is her third Impro and second Kiva loan.

loans.use: To pay educational costs to become a Physiotherapist and improve her income.

loans.name: Ernedz

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ernedz; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte y con el negocio de venta de camisas, el socio se dedica a transporte, el es propietario de una combi que hace servicio público, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de transporte. El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the community bank "Comuzone I". It is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco. 

The member's name is Ernedz. He is 45 years old, he is married and he has 2 children. He has a public transport business and a retail t-shirt business. He owns a minivan with which he offers public transport services. He wants to improve his transport business. He requests a loan to carry out some maintenance repairs to his van.

He is very happy for the loan and he is committed to payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: To carry out maintenace repairs to his van.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap E., married since 2006, has one son and lives with her mother on an island in the Mekong River, approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband is a motorcycle repairman.

A weaver for more than 20 years, Sopheap sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes thE. to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Sopheap hopes to continue her weaving business because it is a traditional profession and so is requesting another loan of $400 to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Kassim K.. He is married and has four children, ages 5, 7, 9 and 14. In 1991, Kassim established his food market because he wanted a source of income to support his family. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about 400,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Kassim has already received and successfully repaid one loan. Now he requires a new loan in order to buy more inventory for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Kassim plans to sell wholesale to other traders, educate his children and dependents to university level, and buy land to build a house for his family. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 4 Group

texts.es:
Carmen es madre de 2 hijos, su familia esta compuesta por ella, sus hijos y su pareja sentimental, todos viven en la misma vivienda, ubicada en unos de los barrios de escasos recursos y limitaciones con el acceso a agua potable y energía eléctrica de la ciudad de Santiago, la segunda mas grande de República Dominicana. Junto a su pareja proveen a su familia, con mucho esfuerzo pero tratan de luchar juntos para salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Carmen pertenece al grupo Fe y Amor 4, un grupo formado por 4 mujeres y un hombre, y son parte de un grupo mayor de pequeños empresarios, que utilizan el micro crédito para reforzar la inversión de sus negocios. Carmen se dedica a la venta ambulante de medicamentos de primera necesidad, en el país se le llama botica, donde personas de la misma comunidad pueden tener acceso a un pequeña farmacia, con medicamentos específicos para aliviar, dolores de cabeza, cuerpo, gripe, entre otras síntomas, por lo general a un precio asequible. Su inversión va directamente para ampliar su inventario. Esta recibiendo su 4to. préstamo en Esperanza. 

Unas de las actividades favoritas de Carmen es cantar, lo cual disfruta igual que el trabajo. Su gran sueño es poder tener su casa propia. Carmen les da las gracias por su apoyo, y por todos los de su grupo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a mother with two children.  Her family consists of herself, her children and her partner.  They all live in the same house which is located in a poor neighborhood with limited access to drinking water and electricity, in the city of Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic.  Together with her partner and with a lot of effort, Carmen provides for her family.  She and her partner both work hard to get ahead and improve their quality of life.

Carmen belongs to the 'Fe y Amor 4' (Faith and Love 4) group.  This group consists of 4 women and 1 man.  They are part of a larger group of small businesspeople who are using micro loans to strengthen investment in their businesses.  Carmen sells basic medicines as an itinerant street vendor.  In this country, 'botica' refers to a system where people from the same community are able to have access to a small pharmacy, with specific medicines to treat headaches, other aches and pains and flu, as well as other symptoms, generally at affordable prices.  Carmen's investment goes directly into increasing her inventory.  This is her fourth loan from Esperanza.

One of Carmen's favorite activities is singing which she enjoys as well as her work.  Her big dream is to own her own home.  Carmen thanks you for your support on behalf of all the members of her group.

loans.use: To buy basic medicines

loans.name: Pitahaya Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pitaya está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Antonia del Carmen M. desde hace 5 años se dedica al comercio de plátanos y maní en el M. de Masaya. Ella con el crédito comprará mayor cantidad de plátanos y maní.
Las otras integrantes son Jeissel María B. quien vende cosméticos en la zona franca desde hace 5 años y Maria Auxiliadora Mejía tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende golosinas, gaseosas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
The “Pitaya” (Red Pitaya) group is composed of three, hard working women. One of them is Antonia del Carmen M. who’s been selling bananas and peanuts for the past five years in Masaya’s market.  She will use the loan to buy larger amounts of bananas and peanuts.

The other group members are Jeissel María B. who has sold cosmetics in the tax-free zone for five years now and María Auxiliadora Mejía who has a small grocery store selling sweets, soft drinks and basic grains.

loans.use: For bananas and peanuts.

loans.name: Bit

texts.en:
Bit R. is a 42-year-old married woman living in Kompong Tom Province.  She earns a living by growing different kinds of crops on her land in the village. She has been running her business over five years and currently earns around $1.5 in profit each day.  Her husband assists her in planting crops. 

Bit R. has five teenage childR., three of whom are employed -- one is a garment worker and two are construction workers. 

Bit R. says that the height of her house is too short and it is not easy to come in and out. Because of this, she is applying for a loan to add to her personal savings to raise the frame of her house.

loans.use: To improve her house

loans.name: Gabriela Hortencia

texts.es:
Gabriela  hortensia P. V., es originaria de Oaxaca y radica en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, vive en unión libre con el  señor Ever Sánchez Cruz, en donde procreo un  hijo de nombre Ghiz-van de quince años en tercero de secundaria.

    Ella es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo  y es para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes, en donde lleva seis años y en la que nos comenta que le va bien ya que le ha estado dejando buenos ingresos para su hogar.

    Para iniciarlo le enseño su suegra ya que vio que es una persona muy trabajadora que se aprende las cosas de manera rápida y así apoyar a su esposo con los ingreso ya que él se encuentra trabajando fuera de la localidad y es para darle un bien estar a su familia.

    Doña Gaby como la llaman en su casa comenta que con la ganancia que baya recaudando de su negocio lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes, como son: harina, huevo, aceite, leche, que son royal, entre otros, para que hace seguir trabajando y día con día aumente más su actividad.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad, pueda tener ahorros para apoyar a su único hijo que está estudiando y ella quiere haces todo lo posible para que el termine una profesión de la que pueda ejercer mas adelante, así también construir su propio horno y pueda  elaborar su panes mas días a la semana.
texts.en:
Gabriela Hortensia P. V. is originally from Oaxaca.  She now lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas, Mexico.  She lives in a civil union with Mr. Ever Sanchez Cruz, and they have a son named Ghiz-van who is 15 years old and in his 3rd year of high school. 

This is the first time that she has asked for a loan, and she will use it to invest in buying ingredients to make bread.  She has been a baker for 6 years and tells us that she likes it since it brings in good income for her household.

At the beginning, her mother-in-law taught her, because she saw that she is a hardworking person and that she learns things very quickly.  This was a way to support her husband with the finances since he finds himself working outside of the area, and it's for her family's well-being. 

Doña Gaby, as they call her at home, tells us that with the earnings that her business is bringing in, she will invest in buying ingredients such as flour, eggs, oil, milk, baking powder, and other things so that she can continue working and day-by-day increase her activity. 

What she wants more than anything is that with this small business activity she will be able to save money to help support her only son in his studies.  She wants to do everything possible to ensure that he leaves school with a profession that he can continue in the future.  She also wants to construct her own oven and to be able to make her breads on more days of the week.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 46  años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la ganadería y ahora  tiene sus propios terrenos que le permiten desarrollar con libertad estas actividades. Trabaja desde horas de la madrugada a entregar lo que ha cosechado y según la temporada del año y cuando es necesario venden animales que posee y son llevados en las ferias ganaderas de su zona. Considera que le gusta esta actividad por que le permite estar en contacto con la naturaleza. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, tiene buenas referencias de trabajos en bancos comunales por lo que se animó a tener  un grupo y del cual se compromete ser un buen socio. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para comprar sacos de abono.
texts.en: Francisco is 46 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own home.  He has been farming and raising livestock since he was very young.  He now owns his own land which allows him to carry out these activities freely.  Francisco works from very early in the morning, delivering what he has harvested and, according to the season and when it is necessary, he sells animals. His animals are taken to the livestock markets in his area.  Francisco enjoys this business because it allows him to be in touch with nature.  This is his first loan from MFP.  He has good references from working with other community banks.  He was keen to join this group and pledges to be a good member.  He will use the loan he is requesting to buy sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Elisa Marina

texts.es:
Elisa es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en la Urbanización El Pescador del Distrito San José de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona  caracterizada por la pesca que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, golosinas, galletas y bebidas gaseosas. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida. Con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Elisa ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Elisa es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Elisa is a 27-year-old mother, single, who resides with her family in the urban area El Pescador of the San José district in the city of Chiclayo, an area characterized by the fishing industry located in the northern part of Peru. 

She has a small general store located in her home. There she sells a variety of consumer staples to the neighbors and customers in the area, including basic staples, groceries, sweets, cookies and soft drinks. The business is doing very well. With this business she is helping her husband provide economic support to the family. 

The growing demand experienced by Elisa's shop has led her to think of expanding it through the purchasing of more products. Thus she has thought it advisable to seek a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. 

Elisa is quite a hard-working woman and of very good character. Those who know her have great respect and affection for her.

loans.use: to purchase products for her shop.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, de 69 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar my duro, para vivir una vejez tranquila. El puesto de comida de Maximiliana es el más concurrido del mercado Virgen de las Mercedes del distrito de Comas, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola.  Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto de comida y así tener más clientes. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas ollas y utensilios, ya que los que usaba, se han deteriorado con el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, 69, is a very humble, hard working woman living in her own house.  What she most wants is to work hard to live a tranquil old age.

Maximiliana’s food stand is the busiest in the Virgen de las Mercedes Market in Comas District.  Her customers come by daily to enjoy the delicious meals she prepares.  She is a very skilled cook who has loved cooking since she was a little girl and now feels fulfilled doing this work.  What she enjoys the most about it is cooking and this is why she does it with so much dedication.  She’s been in this line of work for 26 years and considers the most difficult part of it tending to all the people who come into her restaurant because often she has to work by herself.

With the passage of time she hopes to improve her food stand’s infrastructure so that she can have more customers.  This is her 4th loan with MFP and she intends to be very punctual with her payments because she wants to be able to access more loans; she is a very participative member of her communal bank.

She will use the requested 3000 new sol loan to buy new pots and utensils because the ones she used have deteriorated over time.

loans.use: to buy new kitchen utensils and pots.

loans.name: Lola María

texts.es:
Lola Maria tiene 44 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Lola se dedica a la agricultura tiene un solar, casa propia, siembra maíz, papas, trigo, cebada, tiene dos cerdos además se dedica a la venta de legumbres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es, tener terrenos para sembrar y comprar un vehículo para el negocio.

Le gusta tener limpia la casa.
texts.en:
Lola María is 44 years old and married. She lives with her husband and the children in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. She has five children.

The member belongs to the rural communal bank "Grupo Pucara" located in Pucara, a neighborhood of the parish of Guanujo in the canton of Guaranda, which is 15 minutes away from the office of the microfinance institution Cooperativa San José. This group is composed of 22 members who work in agriculture, rear cattle and sell vegetables.

Lola is a farmer. She has a plot of land and her own house. She grows corn, potatoes, wheat and barley. She has two pigs and she also sells vegetables. She gets her supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells her goods at the wholesale market of the same city.

She applies for a loan to buy agricultural consumables. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to own a few fields to sow and to buy a car for her business. She likes to clean the house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables.

loans.name: Zoriano

texts.es:
Zoriano es un padre de familia de 38 años,  vive en su casa  propia con su esposa e hijos, ubicada en el distrtito de Túcume, que pertenece al departamento de la Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura,   ganadería y turismo.

Desde hace algunos años Zoriano se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, es un alimento sano y rico que se consume diariamente por los pobladores que una vez que cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona, vendiendolo al por mayor y menor, con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos y poder solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo  de 3000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para mejorar las tierras de cultivo como el producto y seguir ofreciendolos a su clientes.   Zoriano es una persona responsable y trabajadora que lo único que quiere es su familia se supere.
texts.en:
Zoriano is a 38 year old father.  He lives in his own house with his wife and children.  They live in the Túcume district, which is in the Lambayeque department.  This area is devoted to agriculture, livestock, and tourism.

Zoriano has devoted himself to agriculture for some years.  He has his own land where he grows corn.  It is a healthy and delicious food that is consumed daily by the inhabitants.  Once the corn is harvested, he sells it at the different markets in the area.  He sells it wholesale and retail.  He does this to increase his income and to be able to pay for the family expenses.

He has requested a loan for 3,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide.  He will do this to improve his farmland and his product in order to continue selling to his customers.  

Zoriano is a responsible and hard-working person.  The only thing he wants is for his family to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide in order to improve his land and his products.

loans.name: Rabah

texts.en:
Due to issues of modesty, Rabah's husband is pictured instead of her in this photo. Rabah is a 36-year-old mother from the Negev. She was trained as a teacher's assistant for young children but was unable to find adequate work in this field. In 2008 she decided to open a business and began with a small grocery store. Over the last three years she has expanded and created a nice mini-market in her neighborhood.

Rabah needed this loan for new shelves and to purchase a larger stock of goods.

Rabah wants eventually to open a full-sized supermarket in the center of her town and serve a larger customer base.

loans.use: to purchase new shelves and a larger stock of goods.

loans.name: Kihara Road Group

texts.en:
Yoweri is a 62-year-old married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in farming and retail business for twenty years and this has facilitated him in providing for his family. 

His hardship is lack of enough capital to meet the increasing customer demand and his vision is a wholesale shop plus educating his children. Yoweri needs the loan  to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es:
María Ernestina siempre ha trabajo en la calle, primero como vendedora de frutas, luego vendía variedad de mercancía y luego fue seleccionada para tener un puesto de ventas en le Parque San Antonio, allí vende todo tipo de mercancía para sus clientes.

Ella se sueña con tener un negocio mas grande donde pueda incrementar sus ingresos y donde pueda generar empleo a otras personas, es por esto que quiere comprar mas mercancía y así podrá tener mas clientes y  mejor nivel económico.
texts.en:
María Cristina has always worked as a street vendor, first selling fruit, and then general merchandise.  She was finally selected to have a stand in the San Antonio Park where she sells all types of merchandise to her customers.

She dreams with having a larger business where she can increase earnings and generate employment for other people.  Because of this she wants to buy more merchandise to have more customers and a better economic level.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Marilou has a retail shop that sells different kinds of fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Marilou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 33 years old and lives in Gatas, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte. She has a general store and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 24,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Marichu joined PMPC this year, 2011. In the future, Marichu hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Cindy, es una mujer alegre y joven, vive en casa de sus suegros junto a su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad. El trabajo de Cindy consiste en la venta de zapatos, ella compra los zapatos de la ciudad de Lima y los vende en la ciudad cerca de su casa y cuando le faltan mercadería por vender busca clientes entre sus familiares y amigos. Este trabajo lo hace sola, únicamente cuando sale en busca de los clientes sale con la compañía de su pareja, quien es músico en una conocida orquesta de la ciudad.
Cindy realiza este trabajo recién hace seis meses, hasta ahora le ha ido bien y espera que le vaya igual. En el futuro ella espera poder consolidar su negocio para así generar ingresos más beneficiosos para su economía.
Este es el segundo préstamo entre Cindy y la institución MFP, le agrada mucho el grupo que esta donde llegó gracias a que la garantizara una señora fundadora, es por eso que espera pueda seguir cumpliendo como hasta ahora.Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, ella comprar zapatos para seguir con el negocio que empezó meses atrás.
texts.en:
Cindy P. is a happy young woman who lives in her in-law's house together with her partner, with whom she has two children aged 3 and 2 years old.  

Cindy's works consists of selling shoes.  She buys the shoes in the city of Lima and sells them in the city near to her home, and when she needs sales she looks for customers among her friends and family.  She does this work on her own; it is only when she goes out to look for customers that her husband comes with her.  He is a musician in a well-known orchestra in the city.

Cindy has been doing this work for the last six months.  So far, it has been going well, and she hopes it will continue to do so.  In the future, she hopes to be able to solidify her business so as to generate more beneficial earnings for her financial situation.

This is the second loan for Cindy with the MFP institution; she is very grateful for the group which she joined thanks to the assurances of one of the founding ladies.  For this reason, she hopes to continue being compliant with her repayments, as she has up to this point.

With the requested amount of 800 New Soles, she will buy shoes so as to be able to continue with the business that she started a few months back.

loans.use: to buy shoes so as to continue with the business that she started a few months ago.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Oyotún que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace  varios años Hector se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos), frutas, verduras y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en casa para su  seguridad y comodidad, ya que puede atender a la hora que desea, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones familiares.  Hector es una persona responsable y dedicada que se preocupa por tener más cosas que ofrecerle a su familia al igual que tener mejoras económicas para brindarle otras opciones a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hector, 47 years of age, lives with his wife and children in his own home.  It has all the basic services, such as water and electricity, and is located in the urban zone of Oyotún, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo.  This zone is characterized for its agriculture and livestock activities.

For several years, Hector has dedicated himself to selling groceries (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs), fruits, vegetables and beverages.  He has located his business in his house for security and comfort reasons, as he can tend to it the hours he wishes.  He uses his earnings to cover all the expenses and needs of his household. 

In order to implement his business, he has requested a loan of 1500 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise to supply his store.  His goal is to continue growing his business and have a supply of products to offer his customers so he can cover his loan and family obligations.  Hector is a very responsible and dedicated person who is preoccupied with having more to offer his family, and concurrently improving financially to give more opportunities to his children.

loans.use: buy merchandise to supply his store.

loans.name: Guia

texts.en:
Guia is 54 years old and lives in Caloocan City, Philippines. Her husband works overseas and her one child has already graduated from college. She earns a living by running a variety store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers are neighbors, and she brings in about PHP 360 in sales every day. She is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is a faithful member of our group, attending meetings to learn about business and study the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 30-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling fish in the town of Jigomoni, Yei county, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more fish for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Merlita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Merlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitilda, de 47 años, es una mujer buena y alegre, convive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Solo uno de ellos vive con ella, ya aún estudia. Juntos habitan en casa de su  Madre. El trabajo de Domitilda, consiste en la venta de frutas regionales, pues diariamente sale a la vereda de su casa y ahí exhibe las deliciosas frutas seleccionadas por ella misma, cuando son comprados en el mercado mayorista regional. Y durante la noche expende comida regional, desde las 5pm empieza con la preparación de sus alimentos, como: patasca, pollo a la parrilla, chorizo ahumado, tacacho, Juanes, comida que solo en esa región se consume. Tiene diez años realizando este trabajo, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Disfruta mucho cocinar además que recibe ingresos que eso la convierte en una mujer independiente. Solo espera ampliar mas adelante su negocio y montar un espacio para vender golosinas. Este será el crédito número 18 con MFP, ella es socia fundadora de este banco comunal y creció mucho desde el primer préstamo recibido. Por ello se siente agradecida con ustedes por la confianza que le han dado. y ahora espera de su apoyo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará golosinas en general ya que esta empezando a montar este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Domitilda is 47 years old and is a good and happy woman who lives with her partner and they have three children who are older and independent. Only one of them lives with her as he is still in school. They live in her mother’s house.
 
Domitilda sells regional fruit. Every day she goes to the path outside her house and there she displays her delicious fruit, which she selected herself when she bought them at the local wholesale market.

In the evening she sells local food. She begins at 5:00 PM with the preparation of the food such as pork stew with corn, grilled chicken, smoked sausage, grilled banana and bacon balls, Juanas (chicken, rice, spices, olives, and boiled eggs, wrapped in a bijao leaf and boiled)—food that is only eaten locally. 

She has been doing this work for ten years and up until now has done it alone. She enjoys cooking very much and she also likes earning income that gives her independence. She wants to enlarge her business and to put together a space for selling sweets. This will be her 18th loan with MFP. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she has grown a lot since receiving her first loan. She feels grateful to you for the trust you have placed in her, and now waits for her help. She will use the money from the loan by and large to buy sweets and is already beginning to try out this new activity.

loans.use: to buy sweets

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 38-year-old married woman who has seven children, six of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Yei, South Sudan for six years.

Jane requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, sugar, and rice. She will use her extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa, aged 38, lives in West Point. She is married and has eight children aged between 3 and 22. For 20 years now she has been selling bonnie fish, spear rid and pig's feet in the market. She received a small amount from her husband to start her business, and learnt it from her mother.  She likes her business because it helps her to feed her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bonnie fish, spear rid and pig's feet for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bonnie fish, spear rid and pig's feet for her business

loans.name: Fabian Antonio

texts.es:
Fabián Antonio tiene 29 años D. edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con L. esposa y con los hijos D. 7, 5 y un año D. edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia D. los Ríos.

L. VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Fabián  se dedica a L. agricultura desD.  hace 14 años, Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para L. agricultura, compra D. abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, urea, Con el dinero del crédito le ayudaría a obtener mejores beneficios. 

El sueño es poder comprarse un terreno no se le ha presentado ningún tipo D. problema. 

En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Fabián Antonio is 29 years old and is married with three children.  He lives with his wife and children, aged 7,5, and 1 year, in the Ventanas Canton in the Province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank "LUCHANDO JUNTOS" ["Striving Together"] is located in the new Zapotal district, in the Ventanas Canton.  The majority of its members work in retail-related businesses.

Fabián has been working in agriculture for the last 14 years.  He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan for his farming.  The money from the loan will help him to earn better profits.

His dream is to be able to buy some land.  He hasn't experienced any problems with his business.

In his free time, he likes to watch television.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and urea

loans.name: Ana Aida

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de tamales, su negocio lo instala en el mercado municipal, ella vive con sus tres hijos menores. Ana administra el negocio desde hace varios años, en un horario de 8:00am hasta que los vende todos, aprendió a elaborarlos porque su madre le dedico tiempo para enseñarle.
Actualmente Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz (en elote), para hacer tamales de maíz tierno, el préstamo le ayudara para comprar varios canastos de maíz, para poder preparar tamales y tener disponibilidad de materia prima.
La aspiración de ella es continuar trabajando, poco a poco ganar más clientes, mejorando así las condiciones económicas de la familia.
texts.en:
Ana sells tamales from her business at the municipal market. She lives with her three young children. Ana has managed her business for several years. Her schedule starts at 8am and continues until she sells everything. She learned how to make tamales from her mother who took the time to teach her.

Ana is currently requesting a loan to buy fresh corn for making tamales. This loan will help her to buy several baskets of corn so that she can prepare the tamales and have enough supplies on hand. She aspires to continue working, gradually gaining more customers, and improving her family’s financial condition.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Susan has a shop that sells food seasoning, spices and vegetables. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy spices, food seasoning and vegetables to sell.

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasoning and vegetables to sell

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
María es una mujer honrada, trabajadora y alegre, tiene 68 años de edad y es viuda. Vive con su hija en Ibarra Provincia de Imbabura, al norte de Ecuador.

María trabaja sola en la crianza de pollos, debido a que no tiene otro ingreso económico, además ella tiene que sustentar los gastos diarios de su familia y de su casa. Trabaja con Fodemi desde el año 2007, el actual crédito que solicita es para la compra de materiales como madera, cemento, arena para reconstruir el galpón de sus pollos ya que el actual está en malas condiciones y sus animales pueden enfermarse ocacionando pérdidas en sus ingresos.

El sueño de María es poder construir un galpón grande para incrementar su negocio y poder sistribuir a grandes empresas.
texts.en:
María is an honest, hard-working and cheerful woman. She is 68, and a widow. She lives with her son in the town of Ibarra, in Imbabura province, in northern Ecuador. 

Maria works on her own, raising chickens. This is because she doesn't have other income, and also has to support the daily expenses of her family and household. She has been working with Fodemi since 2007. 

The current loan she is applying for, is to buy materials such as wood, cement, and sand for rebuilding her chicken shed. The present one is in poor condition, and the animals can get sick, resulting in losses to her income. 

María's dream is to build a large shed, in order to increase her business, and be able to distribute to large companies.

loans.use: To buy material, such as wood, cement, and sand, to build a new shed for her chickens, since the current one is in very bad condition.

loans.name: Stanslous

texts.en:
Stanslous is 35 years old, married to Elizabeth, and they have three children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kes 6000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET ltd for Kes 20,000. He plans to purchase another motorcycle for the business. With the anticipated profits he will educate his children and expand his business. His hopes are to grow his business beyond his locality.

loans.use: To buy another motor cycle

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Juvy is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Juvy runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home products used in the local community. Juvy has been in her business for  three years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Juvy is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Juvy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: With the money, I will be able to grow my business of hamburger sales by buying tables and chairs for my customers' use, and purchasing new kitchen pots and pans and utensils to improve the quality of my hamburgers.

loans.use: Purchase new furniture and kitchen appliances to improve business

loans.name: Mashuga

texts.en: Mashuga is  an IDP from the Fizuli region and now her family is living in Beylagan region. In 2003 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $400 and bought one cow. She sells milk now. She is in need of new loans to increase the number of cows.

loans.use: To buy two new cows

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem P. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 3 children. Her husband earns $3/day as a construction worker, while 2 of her children work with their father and each make $2/day.

The recycling system in Phnom Penh is not very organized, and consists of people buying and reselling plastic/paper/metal and other recyclables until they finally reach a place (and bulk quantity) where they will actually be recycled.

Sem P. will use this loan to buy recyclable products and resell them in bulk for a small profit. In the future, she feels she can use CREDIT to have the ability to buy larger quantities and make more money. She hopes to earn enough to send all of her children to high school.

loans.use: To buy recyclable items

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: H. Araz is 42 years old, is married and has 3 children. He sells spare parts for cars and rents a small garage. His business has brought him income since 2000 and he would now like to build his own garage to continue running his business. He has applied to borrow 1200 USD from Aqroinvest CU to begin building the new garage for his shop.

loans.use: Going to build his own auto shop

loans.name: Lilik

texts.id:
Lilik, who lives in Guritama Road no. 32, owns a cookie shop. She needs about $10 daily to buy the ingredients for the cookies she sells. She expects to make $2.50 profit daily. Lilik plans to use part of that profit to pay installment for this loan from DINARI and the rest to pay school fees for her two children, currently in primary school. With her baking skill, Lilik can also help her husband in sustain their family's economic situation.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilik yang tinggal di jalan Guritama no. 32 ini mempunyai usaha menjual kue, dengan biaya yang dibutuhkan 100.000 rupiah/hari untuk membeli bahan baku untuk membuat kue Lilik mendapatkan keuntungan 25.000 rupiah/harinya yang nantinya akan digunakan untuk mencicil pinjaman yang ada di DINARI dan untuk biaya sekolah kedua anaknya yang masih SD. dengan keahlian membuat kue mentah Lilik dapat membantu suaminya dalam menjalankan perekonomian keluarga.

loans.use: Purchase cookie ingredients

loans.name: Toribia Hernández

texts.en: Toribia and her sister own a small store and they sell women’s clothes, shoes, beauty, and toilet products, and also products for the hair.  They started the business ten years ago.  Toribia is 47, and a single mother with three children (a boy and two girls).  She needs a loan which will help supply the business with a variety of products like soap, deodorants, hand and body lotion, shoes for women, and clothes to sell during the holiday season.  Given this loan, the entrepreneur will increase her income and will be in a condition to continue providing a good education and food to her children.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of a large amount of clothes, shoes, beauty, and toilet products to sell during the holiday season so as to increase her income.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablavi A. was born in Tannou in 1971. Married with eight (8) children, the production of gari (a type of cassava flour) is her chief business. It is with the income from this business that she meets the needs of her children. Well regarded in her area for the quality of her gari, she has recently received many orders. As a result, she is seizing this opportunity to ask for a loan of $350 in order to buy lots of manioc. The benefits derived from the sale of gari will allow her to better meet the needs of her children with regards to health and education.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Ablavi est née à Tannou en 1971. Mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants, la production du gari est son activité principale. C’est d’ailleurs de revenu de cette activité qu’elle subvient aux besoins de ses enfants. Bien appréciée dans la localité pour la qualité de son gari, elle a reçu à cette période beaucoup de commandes. Pour cela, elle saisi cette opportunité pour solliciter un crédit de $350 afin d’acheter beaucoup de manioc. Les bénéfices qui seront issus de la vente du gari, lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants en matière de santé et d’éducation.

loans.use: To buy cassava for the production of gari (cassava flour)

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz I. has been married for 28 years and has five children: three sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in a brick house in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan.
