Her husband earns money making marble stones for graves. Marble is very expensive, and, therefore, Shahnaz is asking for a loan of US$175 to buy marble in a sufficient quantity for her husband to be able to continue his work. She has once before taken a loan at a very high interest rate from a local money lender, and yet managed to pay it back. Shahnaz hopes that she will receive a loan this time as well.

loans.use: Purchase of marble

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita Gisela is a worthy woman dedicated to what she does. She works selling bijao leaves in small quantities. Juanita also exports this product to the capital, which allows her fellow Peruvians use the leaves to prepare traditional dishes. Juanita Gisela is 29 years old and has two children, 2 and 4 years of age, who love her very much. Her husband, Rusber, agrees with and supports her in every one of her goals. What is more, he also supports her in her business and is in charge of finding clients who require the product (bijao leaves) in quantity. She wants to keep progressing and lately she wants to venture into the braid and tassel business. In order to achieve these goals, she would appreciate some capital that will make her goal into reality in the shortest amount of time possible. Let’s support Juanita Gisela with her effort and dedication to keep working hard in order keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Juanita Gisela, es una mujer cabal y decidida en sus propósitos, se dedica a la venta de hojas de bijao al por menor. Juanita exporta también este producto a la capital y los deja a sus paisanos que le dan el uso correspondiente, para sus preparados típicos. La señora Juanita Gisela de 29 años de edad es mamá de 02 hijos 4 y 2 años de edad, que la aman mucho, su esposo el señor Rusber esta de acuerdo y apoyo todos y cada uno de sus propósitos, y lo que es más también la apoya en su negocio, él es el encargado de buscar a los clientes que requieren este producto (hojas de bijao) por cantidad. Ella quiere seguir surgiendo y posteriormente quiere incursionar en el negocio de pasamanería; para cumplir estos propósitos estima de un capital de trabajo que hará realidad su objetivo en el tiempo menos pensado. Apoyemos a la señora Juanita Gisela que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por seguir adelante.

loans.use: Improver her small sale space

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en: I am a mother of six: four boys and two girls. I operate a boutique in which I sell embroidered clothes. I have a forte at my work and I create very unique and beautiful clothes. The boutique generates decent profits for me.  I would like to borrow in a group of few other women all of whom are my neighbors and play an important role to get incomes for their families.  Rukkiah B. plans to invest loan in her grocery store. Naseem B. will buy a donkey cart with her share of loan. Saeeda B. needs loan to expand her stitching business.

loans.use: Improve and expand boutique

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson (standing serving a client) is a 24-year-old married man with one child. He lives with his family at Nyamasaria in Kisumu, Kenya. He is the proprietor of a barber shop located along the Kisumu - Nairobi road. He initiated his current business in 2002. His business has done quite well due to its location and his access to loan funds. Samson is proud of his accomplishments and that he is now able to contribute to paying household expenses. He requires US $500 to further expand his business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Akuffu

texts.en:
Akuffu is forty years old and the mother of five children. Four of her children are in school. She has been buying beans, rice and groundnuts (peanuts) from the northern part of Ghana. She then travels to Koforidua, the eastern part of Ghana, to sell her products. She travels twice a week to buy her products and it takes her twelve hours to arrive in the north. She therefore wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of beans, groundnuts, and bags of brown rice to avoid price hikes and also to reduce her frequent travel.

She is a member of the group called “Eye Nyame” (meaning it is God). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Akuffu’s photo was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more beans, bags of rice, and groundnuts

loans.name: Naveeda's Group

texts.en:
Naveeda B., wife of Mr. M., is a mother of two sons. Both are not yet of school-going age. She needs a loan to buy a laundry shop because her husband is a washer man by profession.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Abida B. wants a loan to buy land and to buy an iron press and iron stands; Shamim B. wants a loan to expand her Pan Shop business; Safia B. wants a loan to buy a vegetable cart; Naseem B. wants a loan to improve the condition of workshop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah M., 52 years old, is married with 6 children. She is a very experienced mother who demonstrates motherhood with a sense of responsibility. For the past 15 years, she has been selling kenkey locally. As a responsible mother, she supported 3 children who graduated from teacher training college and then started working. Kenkey is a favorite food for many Ghanaians. It is tasty and so satisfying. It is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked, and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish.

Hannah will be using the loan to purchase raw materials, such as maize, vegetable oil, vegetables, and firewood, in bulk. This will help her to avoid constant price hikes resulting from the current food crisis in the country. She is a member of the community group called Blessing Trust group. The group guarantees loans through a repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay, and if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount. Hannah's photograph was taken at her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials, such as maize, vegetable oil, vegetables, and firewood, in bulk

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru:
Safarali M. lives in the Shahrinav region of Tajikistan. He is married with four children. In addition to his work as a taxi driver, Safarali repairs vehicles. He has fifteen years of experience in this field. He plans to obtain a loan for 12 months. He needs the loan to purchase spare parts for passenger cars. This would help him in his work.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Муродов Сафарали проживает в районе Шахринау. Таксист, а так же занимается ремонтом автомобилей. Опыт работы в данной сфере 15 лет. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Кредит ему необходим для того , чтобы закупить зап части для легковых автомашин. Это поможет ему в работе.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Santos Pedro

texts.es:
Mr. Santos Pedro, age 48, is married and is a craft weaver who creates traditional fabric for women. He has a workshop with two looms and employs one weaver. He lives together with his six children and wife. Since his childhood he has worked on as a craftsman and through loans has been able to help his family succeed and become a well known person who resides in the Aldea Vásquez of the municipality and department of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He has asked the ASDIR association for a loan to purchase raw materials and generate more jobs in his community, doing so will help young people who need work and will also generate income for their own families. With his loan he will be able to meet the demand of his customers and improve his family's living conditions, and will also provide his children an education; Mr. Santos did not have the opportunity to study due to previous cultural beliefs in his community that are now very different.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Santos Pedro de 48 años de edad, casado de oficios tejedor, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto a sus 6 hijos conjuntamente con su esposa, cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los prestamos a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es una persona muy conocida, con residencia en la Aldea Vásquez del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un crédito para la compra de materia prima y generar mas empleos en su comunidad haciendo a que los jóvenes que necesitan trabajo también generen ingresos para sus familias, con esto podrá cubrir la demanda de su clientela y así podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida a su familia, dandoles estudios a sus hijos, ya que don santos pedro no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, porque anteriormente la cultura en su comunidad era muy diferente.

loans.use: Capital to purchase raw materials for crafts

loans.name: Stefani Group

texts.en:
"Stefani" group is composed of women who plan to work for the improvement of their families' livelihoods. This loan will be the third with A. Majmoua for these women.

Fatmeh is 29 years old, married, and lives in the suburbs of Beirut. Fatmeh runs a cotton clothing shop in her neighborhood. Fatmeh has requested a loan of $400 to help her purchase additionA. inventory to sell in order to expand her business. Fatmeh is pictured here.

Zahra, not pictured, is 29 years old, married with 2 children, and lives in the suburbs of Beirut. Zahra is a beautician in her neighborhood and has benefited much from loans she has received in the past. This new loan will continue to help her business be successful and provide much needed income for her family. Zahra has also requested $400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To help the women of Stefani group develop their small businesses

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a married and an educated man who has a vehicle paint shop. He got his first-cycle loan and completed his stock and still he is furthering his business. He is a good client. When a Kiva fellow came to Afghanistan and saw this business, he was really very happy. Mohammad wants to continue his partnership with both Kiva and Ariana.

He has requested his second-cycle loan to enlarge his shop and complete his materials and also hire one or two more workers for his shop because now he is improving, he can be a good vehicle painter among other shopkeepers in the town.

He is happy with this loan process. When he found AFSG and started his partnership and until now: during this time he has never been faced with any difficulty, therefore he would like to thank lenders around the world who help those who really want to expand their business.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop and complete his materials

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge C. vive en la casa de su hermano en el barrio San Martín (El Torno), Santa Cruz  desde el año 2003, su esposa la señora Mónica López con la que tiene 4 hijos, se dedica a labores del hogar y a la crianza de sus pequeños niños. Su actividad principal es la venta de materiales de construcción (arena, ripio, piedra, otros). Trabaja con nuestra Institución desde el año 2005, en una charla con él, nos comento que con el microcrédito ha podido hacer crecer su negocio, el comenzó con un capital pequeño,  por lo que hoy en día ya cuenta con su propia draga (motor que sirve para seleccionar materiales del río).
texts.en:
Señor Jorge C. has lived in his brother's house in the neighborhood of San Martín (El Torno) in Santa Cruz since 2003. His wife is señora Mónica López, with whom he has 4 children. She is a housewife and is dedicated to raising their young children. His main business activity is selling construction materials (sand, rubble, stone, etc.) He has worked with our institution since 2005. In a chat with him, he told us that with microcredit, he has grown his business. He started with a small amount of capital, and now he has his own dredge (a machine that is used to remove materials from the river).

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator and stove

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe lives in Antagan 1st, one of the farthest barangays ("districts") in Tumauini, Isabela, an area rich in agricultural land. Farmers in the community benefit from the non-stop availability of water even during drought since their water irrigation comes from Magoli river wherein water comes from the mountain.

Fe is married to Aquino A. Sr. who is also a farmer. The couple have six children of which five are already studying. Their children are: Albert - 18, high School graduate; Aquino Jr. - 16, high school level; Daisy - 13, freshman high school student; Kelvin - 11, grade five elementary student; and their youngest, Jericho, 4 years old.

Fe is a member of the ANSAFA group in Antagan 1st. ANSAFA is composed of people engaged in the farming business.

Fe asks for a loan of PHP12,000.00 (USD$250) to support their farming needs. This amount would mean a lot to them for it will give them the opportunity to increase their income which would benefit their family and also allow them to save for the college education of their children. Moreover, they can avoid borrowing from traders who are offering higher interest.

According to Fe, working together is one of the best ways to fulfill their ambitions in life. Thus, she works hard in the farm to help her husband minimize their labor expenses in terms of cultivating and maintaining their rice field.

loans.use: Additional capital to support her farm.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa D. Calcuta. 
María es casada, tiene  53 años y tres hijos  D. 25, 23 y 15 años, dos D. sus hijos trabajan y el menor está en el colegio.
María  tiene un negocio D. venta D. jugo D. caña D. azúcar que se llama “Milagritos” en un puesto del merado 5 D. Mayo, venD. todos los días con su  esposo también venD. ropa por campañas, primero empezó con el negocio D. la venta D. ropa, pero como no vendía mucho decidió invertir en otra cosa.
DesD. que esta en Finca se ha superado ha podido ahorrar, tiene un negocio estable y con el capital que ha obtenido  pueD. comprar más mercadería para cuando hay fiestas. 

Ella solicita un préstamo D. 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa al por mayor.
María sueña con  superarse, que su negocio crezca y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Teresa D. Calcutta Community Bank. She is 53 years old, married, and has three children aged 25, 23, and 15. Two of her children have jobs and the youngest one is in college.María has a stall selling sugar cane juice. Her business is called Milagritos and is located in the 5 D. Mayo market. She and her husband work there every day and also sell clothes there. At first she sold clothes only but because sales were poor, she decided to put her money into something else.Since she’s been with Kiva partner Finca, she’s done well and managed to put asiD. some savings. She has a steady business and with the money she has obtained, she is able to buy more merchandise to sell when there are festivals. She is asking for a loan of 1400 soles which she will use to buy clothing at wholesale prices.María’s dream is to get ahead, to expand her business, and to have her daughter employed in a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es:
Silvia María S. tiene la edad de 43 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Silvia tiene 1 hija su edad es de 9 años y cursa 5 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora fuera del país, sus propósitos son de establecerse en un local para que así pueda hacerse cargo de su vivienda y de estar pendiente con sus hijos por lo que así podrá cuidarlos sus sueños son de incrementar sus productos para ofrecer lo mejor ya que así sus clientes recurrirán a la calidad que ofrece ya que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le hacen pedidos de fragancias nuevas por lo que ella tiene que buscarlas para satisfacer a su clientela, sus deseos son que su hija logre finalizar un carrera profesional con el fin de que para el día de mañana pueda destacarse con sus estudios logre acceder a permanecer en trabajo estable.


La actividad económica a la que Doña Silvia se dedica es venta de mercadería en general como: ropa, calzado, perfumes y cosméticos, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 9 años, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante ya que es la metodología mas rápida y efectiva para comercializar la venta, Doña Silvia inicio este negocio por motivación propia ya que desde pequeña su familia le habían enseñado a trabajar fuerte por lo que desde la edad de 20 años por lo que tenia que ayudar en los gastos de su casa cuando inicio viajaba sola a Managua en busca de los productos ya que ella no conocía muy bien lo que le ocasiono problemas porque no podía realizar las diferentes compras de los productos pero gracias a los vendedores que le tomaron cariño logro encontrarse con los lugares que ofrecían de forma mas favorable sus productos por lo que con la experiencias obtenidas ha logrado ha adquirir experiencia y así comienza a incrementarse en este negocio por lo que decide continuar con esta actividad, el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que aprovechar la temporada de la entrada a clases por lo que ya tiene suficientes encargos además quiere realizar la compra de calzado.
texts.en:
Silvia María S. is 43 years old, and is married. Silvia has one daughter aged 9 and studying in the fifth grade of primary school. Her partner works outside the country. Her aim is to establish an office-site so that from there she can take care of her home and be with her children so she will be able to care for them. Her dream is to increase the number of products in order to offer the best so that her customers will turn to the quality that she offers as already the majority of her customers always order new fragrances from her, so she needs to look them out in order to satisfy her clientèle. Her hope is that her daughter will manage to enter into a professional career, following her studies intensely in order to obtain in the future a stable job. Silvia's economic activity is the sale of general merchandise such as: clothes, shoes, perfume and cosmetics.Her business is ambulatory as this is the most rapid and effective means of making sales. Silvia began this business off her own back as from when she was small her family had taught her to work hard, as a result of which from the age of 20 she had to work helping within the household expenses, so started travelling alone to Managua searching for products even though she wasn't very expert which caused some problems as she wasn't able to make the different product purchases, but thanks to the sellers who took her under their wing she was able to find the places which offered the products in the most favourable forms. Through the experiences she went, she had managed to acquire experience and thus began to improve her business, so she decided to continue with this activity. Her motive for asking a loan is to increase her work capital so she is able to take advantage of the school-entry season for which she already has many orders: she also wants to purchase shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 40-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Walid has been a car electrician for eighteen years. He also sells cars batteries. Walid requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools and merchandise for his work. Walid has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business. Walid is very satisfied and grateful for the opportunity to work with A. Majmoua. Walid is speciA. in his work because of his experience in his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Walid decided on doing his business because he wanted to be independent in his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his garage.

loans.use: Walid will use the loan to purchase tools and merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
"Hardworking woman" best describes Mrs. Ermelinda B., a 54-year-old widow who lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Blessed with four children, Mrs. Ermelinda remains strong in order to survive. Being a single parent is not that easy for her. After the death of her husband, she found ways to earn a living. That’s why she opened a “carenderia,” or small restaurant.

The business is doing so well with hard work and God’s help. She was able to send her children to school and able to sustain the needs of her family. She got her capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative when she joined the organization in June 2003. She has availed herself of several loans already. Now she applies for a PHP 15,000 loan to buy kilos of meat and spices for her carenderia and grocery items for her sari-sari (variety) store. She really wants to have a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: To buy kilos of meat and spices for her restaurant

loans.name: German

texts.en:
German is a member of the Sayhua 2 Village Bank, an experienced group that has been taking loans from Asociacion Arariwa for many years. He has been a member of the group for the past three years. He is 64 years old and is married with seven children, all of whom are now adults. German sells basic grocery items like rice, sugar, oil and flour at a stall in the market in Urubamba as well as from a store in his home. On most days, he tends one location while his wife tends the other. The couple works seven days a week. 

German is requesting a loan of 3,000 soles (US $950) to buy more grocery items. He doesn’t know specifically what products he will buy with the loan, since he has yet to do a thorough inventory of his stock. He has pledged to repay his Kiva loan in full and on time. 

German is considering changing his business some time in the future, in hopes of finding a more profitable activity, but he hasn’t made any decisions yet, and doesn’t know what kind of business he might like to open. 

German is pictured above with his wife.

loans.use: Buy basic grocery items to restock store

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La señora Adela es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando por el Desarrollo”, del distrito Cabanilla, Provincia de Lampa, en el departamento de Puno; ella tiene 42 años de edad, ella madre es soltera, tiene 8 hijos, estudio hasta segundo grado de secundaria.

La señora Adela  viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado menor, ella solicito su primer préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invirtió en comprar ovejas para el engorde, indica que las vende en la feria de Cabanillas, a veces ella vende en carne y lo lleva a la ciudad de Arequipa.

Ahora viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, este dinero piensa invertirlo en capital y comprar ganado mayor.  Este crédito será pagado en 06 cuotas.
 Ella se siente  contenta por pertenecer a Movimiento Manuela Ramos y agradece por confiar en ellas. Adela desea seguir mejorando en su negocio para educar a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Adela is an associate of the comunal bank "Mujeres Trabajando por el Desarrollo" (Women working for Development), of the district Cabanilla, in the Lamp Provence, in the State of Puno. She is a 42 year old single mother, has 8 chldren, and studied up until the second level of secondary school. Adela has worked with Movimento Maunela Ramos for 3 years. She buys and sells small livestock. Her first loan was of 300 new soles, which she invested in buying sheep to fatten them and sell in the fair of Cbanillas. Sometimes she sells it in the form of meat in the city of Arequipa. Now she is asking for a new loan of 3000 new soles, that she thinks she iwll invest in capital and more livestock. This loan will be paid in 6 quotas. Adela is happy that she belongs to Movimiento Manuela Ramos and is grateful that she can confide in them. Adela wishes to continue improving her business so that she can provide education to her younger children.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell livestock.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Mrs. Marietta N. is a 36-year-old resident of Dipolog City.  She is married and blessed with three children.  One of them is still in school.  She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for three years and has already received six loans.  The major source of income for her family comes from her husband's motorcycle taxi business (this motorcycle is known as a "habal-habal").  Marietta earns additional income for the family with her backyard garden planted with root crops, vegetables, and bananas.  She plans to use this loan to purchase spare parts and accessories for their motorcycle so it will run better and generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda U. is from the city of Cagayan de Oro. She is 44 years old. Erlinda is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture by selling bananas. Erlinda is just starting this business.

In 2008, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This loan will be the secnd loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Las Amapolas
Juana es viuda, desde hace doce  años, tiene 60 años, tiene 8 hijos, todos mayores y trabajan  
Juana  dedica hace quince años a lavar ropa puso su cartel en la puerta de su casa se lava ropa, hace ocho años se compro su lavadora y da servicio de lavado a sus vecinas, tiene ya sus  clientelas, también alquila la cochera de su casa y  hace un año compro dos chanchitos para criar, le esta yendo bien    
Desde que Juana esta en Finca, conoció mas personas, perdió la timidez, ha recibido charlas de autoestima que le han ayudado en su vida personal. 
Juana necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, para arreglo de su puerta de garaje y  el arreglo del techo de su garaje.
El sueño de Juana es poner una tienda bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Las Amapolas” communal bank. She has been a widow for two years. She is 60 years old and has 8 children, all of whom are grown and work. Juana has been washing clothes for fifteen years. She put a sign on the door of her house that says “Clothes washed here.” Eight years ago she bought a washing machine and provides laundry services to her neighbors. She already has her customers and she also rents out her garage. A year ago she also bought two piglets to raise and things are going well for her. Since Juana has been working with Finca, she has met more people, has lost her shyness, and has received classes about self-esteem that have helped her in her personal life. Juana needs a loan of 600 PEN for fixing her garage door and her garage roof. Juana’s dream to open a variety goods store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix her garage door and her garage roof

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is twenty years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her mother and siblings in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Sarah has just completed the senior high school and is awaiting her results. At the moment, she sells super glue in a shop by a roadside in her community. Sarah buys gallons of glue from Kumasi. She has been in business for barely a year and wants a loan to buy more gallons of glue to expand her business. She wants to save some money and further her education.

loans.use: To buy super glue

loans.name: Imilda

texts.es: Imilda tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en todas sus variantes, desde moda casual, hasta deportiva. Esta actividad la realiza en su propio taller de costura, el cual implementó en su propia casa. Imilda trabaja según los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes, quienes generalmente son comerciantes. Recientemente ha incorporado en su negocio el alquiler de trajes de fiesta para damas, que está teniendo mucha acogida entre sus vecinas y amistades. Para un futuro cercano Imilda quiere mejorar las máquinas de coser que tiene a nivel industrial. Esta es la décima oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP,  por lo que está muy contenta de seguir siendo parte de su grupo, pues su deseo es continuar con una actitud positiva y responsable. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de tela y cierres para su trabajo textil.
texts.en:
Imilda is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 children. For 10 years she has been making all types of clothing, everything from casual fashion to sportswear. She operates out of a workshop located in her home. Imilda receives orders from her customers, who are retail merchants. Recently she added women’s party dress rentals to her business, which has been well received by her neighbors and friends. In the future, Imilda would like to upgrade her equipment by purchasing industrial sewing machines.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. She is happy to be a part of her communal bank group and hopes that they continue to be positive and responsible. The money she is requesting will be used to buy fabric and zippers for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & zippers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, four sons and two daughters, who are all still in school. Janet works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a petty trader.

Janet sells smoked fish. She hawks to sell in her community. She procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices. Janet has been in business for over fifteen years now and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Ronavel

texts.en:
Ronavel O. is from the village of Alangilan in Sagay Camiguin. She is 33 years old. Ronavel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ronavel owns an operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Ronavel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ronavel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronavel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Ronavel is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ronavel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a seamstress. She lives in the village of San Juan Aurora, Isabela, with her husband Rolando and their children. She serves her community as a Barangay Health Worker (BHW) in their barangay. In addition to her sewing work, Nora supplements her husband's income through her direct selling business of Avon cosmetics products.

Because she wants to become a productive entrepreneur, Nora is seeking the support of lenders to allow her to borrow additional business capital amounting to PHP 5,000, to be used for the improvement of her direct selling and sewing businesses. Her business income is a great help but not enough for their daily needs, so Nora is doing her best to become progressive in her business planning.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Trevol Group

texts.es: El grupo  “Trevol” Esta representado por la señora Katherine y conformado por 13 miembros la mayoría se dedica a vender productos cosméticos, otras venden comida, otras como la presidenta hacen tortas para su venta y distribución y otras se dedican al alquiler D. transporte público. La competencia esta siempre presente pero las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia a la diversificación D. sus productos. El destino del  crédito es para adquirir más variedad D. productos, aumentar su producción, ellas esperan que en el futuro el dinero que les brindamos le sirva D. apoyo económico para mejorar sus negocios y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Este es su primer crédito comunal que adquieren como grupo se ve en las reuniones que son gente responsable y con ganas D. salir adelante.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Jamilla Bisher

texts.en:
Jamilla Bisher is fifty-one years old and has two children (aged 22 and 12). She operates a small boutique in which she stocks mainly ladies' and children's wear, being the most profitable segment of the market, according to her. She has been in this business for six years, four of which she dealt in very small stock due to a lack of capital.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a neighbour and friend, who noticed her business potential. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd and she will use it to stock more clothing and diversify into beauty products in preparation for the fast approaching festive season. She also intends to include some jewelery in her stock, to enable her to serve her customers' needs effectively.

Jamilla aspires to purchase a plot of land in the urban neighbourhood, develop it, and ultimately open a wholesale boutique with support from KADET Ltd.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock and diversify into beauty products.

loans.name: Djafar

texts.en:
D. Djafar has always been a hardworking man who has made sure from a young age that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with two children. Djafar has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff like sweets, bread, soft drinks, juices, preserved food and many others. With starting capital of $100 US, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 15 years ago.

Today, he needs to buy additional foodstuff to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose, Djafar is requesting a loan of $800 US. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for increasing his range of goods

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna, 40, is a farmer who owns a rice field in Surallah, South Cotabato. She tills the land in order to have a good harvest. She's married to Jelson and has three children. She lacks capital to improve her business; that's why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to seek a loan. She requested 15,000 Philippine pesos to support her business needs. This loan will enable her to have fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía es recientemente socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli”, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secunadrios incompletos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de chifles.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar detergente, jabón, 5 cuchillos y ayudin.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse su carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las facilidades de préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a recent member of the communal bank, "Santa Rosa of Lima - Juli" in the district of Juil, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 33 years old, did not complete her secondary education, is married and has 3 children. She sells chifles (a local food like fried bananas). She is asking for a credit 500.00 soles with which she will buy detergent, soap, 5 knives, and ayudin (a type of cleaning product). Her dream for the future is to buy a car and for her children to be professionals. The thing she likes most about her communal bank is the ease of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soap, detergent, 5 knives, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime y su esposa la señora Juana son clientes distinguidos de nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente se le había otorgado un crédito para la inversión de su negocio que es una estética donde además imparten clases de belleza. Ellos nuevamente están solicitando este crédito para la inversión en compra de algunos aparatos eléctricos de belleza como secadoras, y tintes para mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime and his wife, Juana, are honored customers of our Institution, since they have previously been given a loan to invest in their business. They have a beauty salon where they also offer cosmetology classes. They are again asking for a loan to invest in purchasing electrical appliances like hair dryers, as well as dyes, to provide service to their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hair dye and electrical beauty appliances

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene supports her family with a hog and duck-raising business. She's from Norala, South Cotabato. She is 37 years old and has two children, her eldest being 12 years old. She is thankful for her business because it sustains the finances of her family.

Arlene is now requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This will be very helpful in providing feeds and supplies necessary for her businesses.

loans.use: To buy feeds and supplies

loans.name: Luz Esther

texts.es: Luz Esther, es una mujer emprendedora, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 51 años, es madre de cuatro hijos y tres son todavía dependientes, ella se dedica a la venta de cervezas, golosinas y gaseosas, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja manejando su motocar. Luz Esther forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desde hace 5 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de golosinas, ahora necesita un crédito de 800 soles, que será invertido en la compra de cerveza, gaseosas, golosinas y ropas usadas. La meta de Luz Esther es tener una fuente de soda-restaurant y crecer en su negocio de venta de ropas usadas.
texts.en:
Luz Esther is a very hardworking woman; she lives in the district of Yarina cocha, Ucayali region. She is 51 years old and is a mother to 4 children, 3 still depend on her economically, she sells beers, candy and refreshments, she does this at home and has the support of her husband who works driving a motorcycle taxi. Luz Esther is part of “Las Dinámicas” (The Dynamics) Communal Bank for some 5 years, the first loan that she received was of 300 soles, it was invested in candy, and she now needs a loan of 800 soles that will be invested to buy beer, refreshments, candy, and used clothing. Luz Esther’s goals are to have a soda fountain-restaurant and to see her business in used clothing grow.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy refreshments, candy, and used clothing.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.fr: G. Basilia est née vers 1969 et vit au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 25 ans.  Mariée à HOUETON Léon, Basilia est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Basilia a un autre enfant à sa charge.  Basilia vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Basilia vend des vivres par le système de distribution. Il y a 20 ans que Basilia exerce cette activité.  Basilia a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Elle sollicite un autre crédit pour élever le niveau de son activité et acheter des vivres.  Dans l’avenir, Basilia envisage acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Basilia G. was born around 1969 and for the past 25 years has lived in the Agla district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Basilia is the mother of three children who are enrolled in school and takes care of an additional child. Basilia lives with her children and her husband, Léon Houeton. As a couple, they work together to meet the needs of the family. To meet their needs, Basilia sells food supplies via the local distribution network. She started this business 20 years ago. Basilia has repaid her previous ALIDé loan. She is requesting a new loan to prop up her business activities and increase her food supply inventory. In the future, Basilia hopes to buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food supplies

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. S., 41, is married to Yout, age 46, and they are currently construction laborers in a building place located in the middle of Phnom Penh capital. Usually they both are able to generate around $7 each day to cover their family’s daily living expense. S. now has five children; one is married and the others are single. Two of her children are employed. Her daughter is a garment worker and son works in construction. (S. was not available at that time so her husband is shown instead in the picture above.) S. has a single son who needs a life partner in his wife and the condition requires him to get married but he doesn’t have money. So, S. requested a loan to allow her son to arrange a wedding party.

loans.use: To arrange a wedding party for her son.

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Development Group, Jinja

texts.en:
At the top left in the small photo is K. Stephen, as he also appears in the big group photo. He is a 30-year-old married man with two kindergarten children aged 5 and 2. He also has one dependent he takes care of.

To shoulder his responsibility of taking care of these kids well, Stephen sells farm produce, operating his modest business in Jinja’s central market. He started off his business with capital of 400,000 Ugandan shillings in 2008, under the auspices of the Kamu Kamu Development Group.

Currently, Stephen says he makes profits to the tune of 80,000 shillings per week although he is constantly accosted by customers who want to take goods on credit and the destructive rainy seasons are just some of the challenges he has faced. Despite all this, he says he remains an individual with huge reserves of optimism and good relationship skills. This has played in his favor most of the times and his future plans are to own a shop and to build his permanent residence.

With a loan of 300,000 shillings, Stephen envisages a bright business future for himself on the horizon, as he will use the loan to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Rainbow

texts.en:
Rainbow V. is from the village of Kinoguitan in Misamis Oriental. She is 20 years old and married with 2 infant children. To make a living, Rainbow has been selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community for more than one year now and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.  Rainbow has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities, and is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick O. M. is 38 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. He lives in Nambale, Busia district, where he runs a charcoal business which he started in 1999. He says he started this business to be his own source of income after his casual labor job started taking a toll on his life.

Patrick buys his stock once a month in bulk from Busia district. He would like a loan of 20,000 KES to build up his stock as a strategy to expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his stock

loans.name: Jean Carlos

texts.es: Jean Carlos P. S., tiene la edad de 25 años, está en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos de 4,2 años y otro de 2 meses, los son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra y la compra de insumos para el desarrollo del cultivo de tiquisque. La idea es  darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de tiquisque, para que cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias. El desea poder asistir el cultivo para lograr un mejor desarrollo del mismo,  y así lograr una mejor producción.Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jean Carlos tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura.El está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo  proyecto.El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Jean Carlos P. S. is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 4, 2, and 2 months) who are his highest priority. This loan will be used to buy supplies for planting and growing “tiquisque” (a tuber crop similar taro root). He plans to adequately maintain his crops so that he can generate better earnings when it is time to harvest and sell his output. Jean Carlos attends to his crops as a means of self-development so that he can improve production. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided. Don Jean Carlos has several years of experience in agriculture. He is sure that he will do well in this new project. Jean Carlos hopes in the future to provide his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. In addition, he want to continue growing as a person and a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies for planting and growing "tiquisque"

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
At the age of 56, Benedicta L. from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City is still working hard. Benedicta is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Benedicta owns & operates a tailoring business providing general alterations & tailoring services to local community members. Benedicta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Benedicta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. Benedicta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. Benedicta is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Benedicta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase seeds for his farm and also fresh foods like beans for resale

loans.name: Zeinap

texts.en:
Zeinap G. is currently in the business of selling plastic chairs and tables at a shop and is requesting a loan to stock television screens to sell.  Zeinap is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a clerk. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her shop by stocking mattresses and beds. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock television screens to sell

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en:
Sumaira belongs to a poor family living in the city of Pakpattan in Pakistan. It is not easy for an illiterate person to survive financially due to the high cost of living, but Sumaira will never give up. She started embroidering for her neighborhood clients to financially help her husband. She is also a good housewife and takes care her family very well. She is the mother of one daughter and one son, both of whom are very young and have not yet started their education. Sumaira wants to give them a quality education. That’s why she wants to save money for their secure future, but this is possible only when she has a large enough household income for saving money. 

Her husband is a fruit seller; he sells fruits from a cart. He needs more fruit to offer to his clients and for this reason Sumaira has applied for a loan from Asasah. She has been an Asasah client for the last three years and maintained good credit behavior. She hopes that this loan will be profitable like the previous ones.

loans.use: Purchase fruits for reselling

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa D. is from the village of Gusa Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. This 39-year-old married mother of two school-aged children owns and operates a general store selling daily food in the local community. Engaged in her business for eight years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jesusa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 8000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital and for the tuition of her two children. This loan will be Jesusa's seventh from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products and goods and to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena A. sells fried fish at Takoradi. She is married and has three children. She has received senior high education.  Mena’s husband is a stores officer.  Mena uses her income to help her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Mena will use the loan to purchase extra fresh fish to fry to sell. With the fresh profits from her extended business, Mena plans to save to build a shop to sell in.

loans.use: purchase extra fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Sewing clothes are the main part of 23-year-old Mrs. Yet S.’s daily duties in the garment industry. Yet S. has been engaged in her job since 2008 and receives $90 a month. She has a life partner in her husband (pictured) who has skills in repairing electronic materials. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their two children. Both of the children attend school.

S.’s husband is very busy in his business activities.  However, he needs more materials to perform his service. Because he lacks funds, Mrs. Yet S. has decided to request a loan for her husband to use to buy any materials required.

loans.use: To buy any materials required.

loans.name: Rubaare Twimukye Tukore Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: Used clothing is in high demand in Uganda. Jolly A., a hard-working and energetic woman of 30, has begun tapping into that demand by buying consignments of used clothing for resale. She is a member of the Rubaare Twimukye Tukore loan group, whose eight members we see here. Jolly has done very well with her business, as proved by the 160,000 Ugandan shillings she makes monthly. She is taking a long view and has drawn up a plan to expand her used clothing business into a much larger operation, and is applying for this loan to help make that expansion possible.  Her goal is to be able to pay for the education of her four children, and help her family live a better life.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 52 years old and is married with four children who are 14, 16, 17 and 18 years old.

Theogene has owned a shop selling a variety of electronic and electrical items since 2007 and his business hours are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Theogene needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to increase the size of his business by adding more electrical and electronic items such as electric cables, loudspeakers, etc. With these additional items for sale, Theogene will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and enable him to continue taking care of his family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of electrical and electronic items such as loudspeakers, torches, cables, etc.

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es: María del Pilar G. de 26 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee un negocio propio en el cual se encarga de elaborar y vender pupusas, uno de los platillos típicos salvadoreños que tienen mayor demanda por parte de las personas de este lugar. Su negocio está ubicado en las afueras de su casa de habitación, en donde cada día María saca de su hogar la cocina, mesas, sillas y todos los utensilios necesarios para iniciar su trabajo. Ella es una mujer con mucha experiencia, ya que posee 5 años de realizar este oficio, razón por la cual posee muchos clientes, los cuales prefieren sus pupusas ya que es una persona la cual se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, frijoles, chicharrón y queso, los cuales son la materia prima para la elaboración de las pupusas, así mismo desea surtir el negocio con bebidas heladas y calientes, esto con el fin de que las personas no solo compren su productos para llevar a sus casa, sino también para que ellas opten por comer en el lugar, esto le brindaría  muchos beneficios a María puesto que aumentaría sus ventas los cual es de mucha ayuda para su economía familia, la cual necesita mejorar en gran manera.
texts.en: María del Pilar G., 26, lives in the municipality of San Martín with her 2 children aged 10 and 9.  They are both in school.  She has her own business making and selling pupusas, a traditional Salvadoran dish for which there is a lot of demand on the part of the people who live in this area.  Her business is located outside her house, where every day Maria takes from her kitchen tables, chairs and all of the utensils she needs to start her work.  Since she has been in this line of work for 5 years, she now has a lot of experience, and as a result she has a lot of customers who prefer her pupusas because she has gained the confidence of her customers.  Maria requests a loan to buy a large quantity of corn, beans, pork rinds and cheese, the raw materials to make pupusas.  She also wants to stock her business with hot and cold drinks.  She wants to do this so that people will not only buy her products to take to their houses, but also will eat at her establishment.  With the increased sales that this would bring Maria would benefit, because this would help her family's finances, which are in great need of improvement.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork rinds and cheese

loans.name: Mwadiga

texts.en:
Mwadiga is a married man with seven children, three of whom attend school while four have already graduated. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He operates a retail shop selling sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour. His potential customers are the local residents. Mwadiga faces a challenge of transportation. He incurs a high cost while transporting goods from the market to the shop for resale. He hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase more stock of wheat flour and maize flour for resale. Mwadiga decided to join Yehu to gain knowledge of business operations and to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and maize flour for his retail shop.

loans.name: Beatrice Akello

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 48 year-old woman living in Dandora. She has run her general store for ten years.

She intends to use the loan to buy more stock, including bananas, avocado, vegetables, and for transport. She will sell these goods at a retail market and sell her supplies to fruit vendors at Muthurwa Market. 

She was introduced to KADET through a friend. Beatrice's dream is to own a store in the heart of Gikomba Market.

loans.use: To buy fruits & vegetables, and transport them to market

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter hails from Kisii Town in western Kenya, where he is engaged in mixed farming. He sells his produce of bananas, maize, tea, beans, and vegetables at the local market. He has five children, two of whom attend school.

He has applied for this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes the cow will produce enough milk for family consumption and that it will help him earn more so that he may educate his children. He aspires to to have three dairy cows and run a retail business within the local market in five years' time.

His challenge is hostile weather conditions, particularly the hailstorms and droughts that affect his crops.

loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Alba Lorena

texts.es: Alba Lorena tiene 41 años, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos pues han sido beneficiosos. Alba se dedica a la venta de leche, desde hace más de 6 años, que comenzó con este negocio. Inicio como un medio de vida necesario para su hogar, ya que este tipo de negocio es muy común, ella habita en la comarca agua fría en donde muchos vecinos son clientes estables ya que es un producto que diariamente se consume. Este crédito es para la compra de leche y así con el paso del tiempo aumentar su producción y su negocio.
texts.en:
This isn’t the first time Alba Lorena, 41, has requested a loan because they have been very beneficial.  She has sold milk for over six years.  She started the business as a way to earn a living for her household because this is a very typical kind of occupation.

She lives in the Agua Fría area where many of her neighbors are regular customers that buy from her daily.

The loan is to buy milk so that with the passage of time production and her business will increase.

loans.use: To buy milk.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta P. sells smoked fish at Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a palm wine tapper. 

Atta has been selling smoked fish for twelve years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Demand for her kenkey is high and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profit. She will use the loan to buy more fish for sale. 

She hopes to buy land using her expanded capital.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie G. is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children.  She is from the town of Sta. Josefa and is a rice farmer. She and her husband help each other build their business. Elvie wants to improve her family's living conditions. She hopes for their harvest to increase.

Elvie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and fuel for the tractor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchas seeds, fertilizers, and fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Maria Reina

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 50 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, donde vive con su hijo y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida como pollo asado, hot dog, tortas mexicanas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en las afueras de una Universidad Migueleña, este negocio es rentable ya que los estudiantes universitarios siempre llegan a consumir sus alimentos.
Ella actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar productos y surtir el negocio su compra será en bebidas, carnes, pan, verduras y condimentos, este préstamo le ayudara ha prepararse ya que la Universidad comienza clases en este mes, lo que para ella es momento de ordenar sus productos y comenzar a realizar las ventas.
Su objetivo es que a través de su trabajo pueda ir mejorando su vida y las condiciones en general de su familia obteniendo mayores beneficios o ganancias.
texts.en:
María, who is 50 years old, resides in San Miguel, where she lives with her son and husband. She sells food such as grilled chicken, hot dogs, and sub sandwiches. Her business is located on the fringes of a university in San Miguel. This business is profitable because the university students always come to eat her food.

She now is requesting a loan to buy products and stock her business. Her purchases will consist of beverages, meats, bread, vegetables, and condiments. This loan will help her get ready since university classes begin this month, and for her, this is the time to buy her products and begin to make sales.

Her hope is that through her work she will able to keep improving her life and general conditions for her family by earning better revenues.

loans.use: Purchase beverages, meats, bread, vegetables, and condiments

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena tiene 50 años. Ella nació en Lima y ha vivido en San Juan de Miraflores por casi toda su vida. Ella está separada de su esposo y ahora vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa de su padre

Filomena, desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de menús en la puerta de su casa, ahí prepara variedad de platos criollos, que los vende a 5 soles por plato,  y por las tardes en el mismo lugar vende anticuchos a solo  3 soles por la porción, y tiene muchos clientes que gustan de su sazón. Le gusta mucho su negocio, pero estaría más feliz; si no se hubiera malogrado su refrigeradora, por lo que dejó de vender gaseosas heladas. En la actualidad, si es que le piden gaseosas sus clientes después de almorzar; de su vecina se provee y las vende, a cambio de nada, pero si, para tenerlos contentos a sus comensales. Lo que más desea en el futuro Filomena, es tener su puesto en un mercado, para incrementar sus ventas, aunque dice ella “haber encontrado, pero no lo alquiló por ser muy costoso” mientas tanto continuará trabajando en el mismo lugar. 

Filomena, es nueva integrante al grupo comunal, y de obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará su ansiada refrigeradora, para retomar su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias. Asimismo desea comprar más sillas y mesas, para recibir a más clientes que disfruten de su buena sazón.
texts.en:
Filomena is 50 years old.  She was born in Lima, and she has lived in San Juan de Miraflores for almost her whole life.  She is separated from her husband.  She now lives with her three children in her father’s house.

For five years Filomena has been selling prepared meals at the door to her house.  She prepares a variety of Creole dishes at her house.  She sells them for five soles a plate.  In the afternoons, at the same place, she sells kebabs for only three soles a serving.  She has a lot of customers who like her tasty food.  

She really likes her business.  However, she would be happier if her refrigerator had not broken.  That is why she stopped selling chilled soft drinks.  Now, if her customers order soft drinks after eating lunch, her neighbor supplies and sells the soft drinks. Filomena gets nothing for this, but she does it so that her diners will be happy.

What Filomena wants most of all in the future is to have a stand in the market in order to increase her sales.  Although, she says she has found a place, but she did not rent it because it is very expensive.  Meanwhile, she will continue working in the same place.

Filomena is a new member of the communal bank.  When she gets the requested loan she will buy her yearned for refrigerator in order to retake her business and increase her earnings.  At the same time, she wants to buy chairs and tables to welcome more customers to enjoy her tasty food.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy a new refrigerator and tables and chairs.

loans.name: Asdrubal

texts.es:
Asdrúbal P. M., tiene la edad de 47 años, está casado y tiene 1 hijo que es su mayor prioridad al igual que su señora esposa. El con el dinero pretende comprar ganado para su posterior venta y mejorar su camión pues el brinda servicio de trasporte de estos animales a la subasta ganadera a diferentes personas. El pretende generar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Asdrúbal es intermediaro de ganado y tiene muchos años de experiencia en este tipo de trabajo. El quiere brindarle a su hijo el estudio para que pueda llegar  a ser un profesional en alguna  area y no tenga tantos dificultades para lograrlo. 
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  ha tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales como el Banco de Costa Rica, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Asdrúbal P. M., 47, is married and has a son who is his greatest priority as is his wife.  He intends to use the money to buy livestock for subsequent sale as well as to repair the truck he uses to transport the animals for different people to the livestock auction.  He intends to earn greater income for his family’s wellbeing and to have a better quality of life.

Asdrúbal is a livestock middleman and has many years experience in this line of work.  He wants to provide schooling for his son so that he will become a professional in some area and not have so many difficulties to attain this.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has had prior loans in state banks, like the Bank of Costa Rica, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: For truck repair and to buy livestock to sell.

loans.name: Jannat's Group

texts.en:
Jannat resides in Fateh Sher colony which is located in Sahiwal. Sahiwal is a small Pakistani town, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 20 years. She is 53 years of age and a housewife. It is not easy for her to operate a business and to support her family financially but she makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She is married to A. D. who is a mason by profession. Jannat is the mother of a son who is 27 years old and also does the same business as his father. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son. With the loan, he will buy masonry tools which will help him to work better and earn better profit. 

Jannat is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her son and he will be able to gain maximum benefit from his business. She is a regular loan user with Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: to buy masonry tools for her son.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Creciendo Para El Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el sector conocido como Parque Forestal en la ciudad de Portoviejo, este lugar se lo conoce porque en él hay un bello parque, además por su exuberante vegetación y por sus bellos paisajes.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Benedicta, ella tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 8 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y solo el menor de sus hijos vive con ella. Su esposo es maestro albañil.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveres de consumo en su casa, allí vende de todo un poco desde  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes hasta embutidos y carnes, nos cuenta que poco a poco con los créditos cada vez surte más su tiendita. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría los recibe en su local. Nos comenta que lleva cinco años en su negocio y que en él se entretiene mucho.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres  años y le gusta porque le ha sacado de muchos apuros.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y que su tienda sea la mejor de su localidad.
texts.en:
The “Creciendo Para El Futuro” (Growing For The Futre) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the sector known as Parque Forestal in the city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for its beautiful park, its exuberant vegetation, and its beautiful scenery.

We meet Benedicta here.  She is 57 years old, married, and has eight children.  All of her children are adults, and only the youngest lives with her.  Her husband is a master bricklayer.

She has a small grocery store in her house.  She sells a little of everything from rice, sugar, oil, and detergent to sausages and meat.  She tells us that with each loan she, little by little, stocks her little store more.  She works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  She buys products in the Portoviejo center, although she receives most of the products at her store.  She tells us that she has had her business for five years, and it keeps her very busy.

She will use the loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other basic needs items.  She has been in the communal bank for three years.  She likes it because it has relieved her of many hardships. 

Her goals are to get ahead and for her store to be the best in her area.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, and other basic needs items

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda I. is from the village of Tagpako, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Luzminda is single and has two adult children. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Mrs. Neng is married to Mr. Mey. She was born in 1972.  They have one child who is attending local public school. They are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice to support for their own family. Besides farming, they are rice middlemen and fishermen. 

Although they try to work a lot, they can earn only a little income. So to improve their family's living standard, Mrs. Neng is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 39 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 65 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Ella tiene una renovadora de calzado, negocio que puso con su esposo ya que él tenía experiencia en este oficio, es así que ya son 17 años los que trabajan incansablemente durante todo el día para poder lograr los ingresos necesarios a su familia.
