A ellos les gusta mucho su trabajo ya que son personas que siempre han trabajado y por ende no se les hace complicado aunque muchas veces les resulta cansado, pero eso no hace que se den por vencidos sino todo lo contrario que trabajen mucho para conseguir sus tan ansiados sueños de poner una librería bazar por su domicilio ya que se esta empezando a hacer muy comercial, además de que cerca construirán hospitales por la zona, por lo que pronto será un lugar muy concurrido. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y está dispuesta a pagar puntualmente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará material para fabricar zapatos y así producir de mejor manera.
texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 65 year-old José, and her five beloved children who she would like to provide with a better future.

Juana owns a cobbler's.  She set up her business together with her husband because he had experience in this trade.  They have now been working untiringly in this business for 17 years.  They work all day long in order to make the income they need for their family.  Juana and her husband enjoy their work a lot since they are people who have always worked and therefore it is not difficult for them, although it often proves tiring.  However, they do not give up.  On the contrary, they work hard in order to fulfill their dream of setting up a book store / general store in their home since their area is starting to become very commercial.  They are building hospitals nearby in the area and it will soon be a very busy place.

This is Juana's eleventh loan from MFP.  She feels very happy to have obtained it and is ready to make her repayments on time.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy materials for making shoes and thereby improve her production.

loans.use: to buy material to make footwear

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Maria; ella es casada y tiene 44 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, polos, blusas y chompas en forma independiente y también la socia trabaja como preventista, la socia lleva la ropa a diferentes lugares para vender la ropa, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos al por mayor.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de ferretería, venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de repuestos de carro.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the "San Antonio" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Ana Maria is 44 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a business selling clothes.  She is self employed and sells pants, polo shirts, blouses and sweaters.  She also works as pre-sales agent.  She takes the clothes to different places to sell them.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Ana Maria would like to expand her clothes business.  She is requesting a loan to buy pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts wholesale.

The other members of this group run a hardware store, sell handicrafts, sell beauty products and sell car parts.

Ana Maria is grateful to those who will take part in her dream in this way and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts wholesale

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 45 años de edad, casado hace 15 años tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, dueño de casa hace 3 años, se dedica al transporte  por más de 7  años, teniendo su micro de una línea  que el mismo lo trabaja. Su esposa es costurera y con esa actividad le ayuda con los gastos familiares. Al Sr. Juan el destino del crédito es para el mantenimiento de su micro (arreglo de la caja y compra de tambores). El sr. esta muy agradecido con la institución por la rapidez y facilidad que se le otorga el crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan, 45, has been married for 15 years and has three school-aged children.  He bought his house three years ago and has been working in the transportation business for over seven years.  He has a microbus line.  His wife is a seamstress and helps with family expenses.

Juan plans to use the loan for mini-bus maintenance (to fix the gearbox and buy new drums).  He is very grateful to the institution for the prompt and easy loan terms.

loans.use: To provide maintenance for his microbus.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Zainab.  She is married and has five children aged 19, 17, 12, 8 and 5. She has one additional dependent, who live with her because he is her nephew.  

In 2005, Zainab established her plastic bowls, buckets and baskets business. She inherited her business from her late mother. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 6,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. 

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy additional plastic bowls, buckets and baskets. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Zainab plans to educate her children to university level.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy  plastic bowls, buckets and baskets.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 31 years old and married. He has owned a motorcycle transport business for the past 11 years. His business is well organized and open daily from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m.
 
Jean Pierre has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy essential materials like tires and engine for his motorcycle. With his profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To buy essential materials like tires and engine.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Teresa vive en la comunidad de San Pedro, vive en el barrios de la comunidad, pero no es un barrio que este cerca del centro si no todo lo contrario esta muy alejada del centro, cabe mencionar que no hay transporte que llegue al barrio, solo  carros particulares y en ocaciones taxis especiales que llegue a pagar la gente pero esto sucede raras vaces ya que los taxistas cobran caro un viaje especial porque la cerretera esta en malas condiciones y tambien porque esta un poco retirado.
Doña Teresa se dedica a criar puercos para venderlos despues de que esten listos los animales lleva poco mas de 3 años criando los animales pero nos dice que no es una actividad facil de hacer ya que depende mucho del cuidado que se le tenga para que el puerco pueda crecer sano y tambien gordito, los trabajos que hay que hacer con el animales son varios desde tener limpio el lugar donde estan como barrerles y hacer aun lado el excremento, luego ese excremento hay guardarlo para que sirva como abono para las milpas, tambien hay que vacunar a los animales, darles de comer, beber y tambien ordenarles el lugar para que no coman mas que le echa uno, doña Teresa tambien en sus ratos que tiene libres sala a vender dulces y elotes, es lo que esta haciendo para poder ayudar con el gasto en su casa, doña Tere tiene 5 hijos ya son grandes pero no quisieron estudiar y por el momento dependen de doña Tere, estan buscando un trabajo para hacer algo y ganar dinero, doña tere es casada lleva 18 años de casada y tiene 34 años de edad vive en casa propia y su esposo es empleado en una empresa que se dedica a tablaroca.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa lives in the community of San Pedro.  She lives in one of the neighborhoods of the community, but it isn't a neighborhood that is close to the center; if anything it's the opposite and is far away from the center.  It is worth noting that there is no public transport to get to the neighborhood, only private cars and occasionally special taxis that people can pay for, but this is rare because the taxi drivers charge a lot for a special trip because the roads are in poor condition and also because the neighborhood is somewhat removed.

Doña Teresa works raising pigs for sale once the animals are ready.  It takes just over 3 years to raise the animals but she says that it is not an easy activity to do because it depends on the care given to the pig so that it can grow healthy and fat.  The tasks to be done for the animals are varied, from keeping the sty clean by sweeping, removing the excrement and then saving this excrement to serve as fertilizer for the fields.  She also has to vaccinate the animals, feed and water them, and also keep them in place so they don't eat more than she throws to each one.  

Doña Teresa, also in any time she has spare, sells sweets and corn, this is what she is doing to help with household expenses.  Doña Teresa has 5 children who are older but they don't want to study, and for the moment are dependent on Doña Teresa.  They are looking for work to do something and make money.  

Doña Teresa has been married for 18 years, and is 34 years old.  She lives in their own house, and her husband is employed by a company dedicated to drywall.

loans.use: to raise pigs for sale.

loans.name: Bat-Togtokh

texts.en:
Battogtokh is a 41-year-old married man who lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He operated a butcher shop at Kharkhorin, a local outdoor market, for eight years. Since June 2010, he has been working as a security guard at Metropolitan Public Service in Ulaanbaatar.

Battogtokh is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase necessary construction materials to finish his housing project. In order to complete the construction work, he needs to buy materials for the roof covering and interior structure as well. His family is currently living in a ger (Mongolian Yurt) at his sister’s plot of land until he finishes the construction. 

Battogtokh's 11-year-old son attends the local secondary school while his wife looks after their 3-year-old daughter and stays at home. He is a responsible and ambitious man who is willing to provide a good quality life for his family. He is very thankful to the lenders who are giving him an opportunity to finish the housing project.

loans.use: to buy essential building materials to complete his housing project.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Marlyn has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. She is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 46 years old and married with 4 children. The oldest child is 25 years old.

Emily is a farmer working in the town of Banga, in the province of South Cotabato. She and her husband own the land that they till together. They primarily grow rice crops for sale, and farming is their main source of income. Emily does her best to improve their business and earnings.

Emily has requested a loan to purchase 3 sacks of seed, 2 sacks of fertilizer, and 2 quarts of herbicide. She hopes for her business to be stable. She also wishes to live longer and have many grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of seed, 2 sacks of fertilizer, and 2 quarts of herbicide

loans.name: Elba Maria

texts.es: Elba D. 58 años D. edad vive en la ciudad D. Cartagena D. Indias, con su esposo y tiene 5 hijos en las edades D. 23 a 37 respectivamente. DesD. allí se dedica al comercio D. ropa y otras mercancías en su pequeña variedades, la cual inició hace 2 años vendiendo vestidos para damas, caballeros y en la línea infantil,  y poco a poco fue agregando otras mercancías D. acuerdo a lo que registraba en sus libros, cuando sus clientes pedían y no tenia existencia D. la mercancía solicitada. Su negocio está ubicado en un local comercial, dotado D. vitrinas surtidas con cosméticos, ropas, útiles escolares y diversos accesorios. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha logrado un completo surtido, con el que ha logrado vender más. Como Elba María quiere seguir creciendo, aprovechando la demanda del mercado en esta época, D. gran despliegue comercial, a propósito D. acercarse el día del amor y D. la amistad, está  solicitando su credikiva, con el cual responderá a pedidos D. ropa por parte D. sus clientes,  quienes esperan hacer demostraciones D. cariño a sus familiares y amigos,  mediante obsequios comprados en la miscelánea D. Elba María.
texts.en:
Elba is 58 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena D. Indias with her husband. They have five children who range in age from 23 to 37 respectively. She has a small variety store where she sells clothes and other merchandise. Two years ago, she started selling clothing of various brands for women, men, and children. Gradually she added other merchandise according to the records kept in her books. Whenever she did not have an existing product in stock, Elba would keep a record of her customers’ requests.

Her business is located in a commercial building, equipped with display cases stocked with cosmetics, clothes, school supplies, and various accessories. Her Kiva loan is the second occurrence of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the organization that has helped her complete her inventory so that she can sell more. Since she wants to continue growing, Elba Maria is taking advantage of the demand of the market during this time of year when a great number of products are introduced because of the Day of Love and Friendship (the Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day). By requesting a Kiva loan, Elba Maria will be able to fulfill the clothing orders from her customers who are waiting to demonstrate their affection to loved ones, such as relatives and friends. These products will be presented as gifts that were purchased at Elba Maria’s variety store.

loans.use: to purchase clothing so that she can fulfill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 5 children.  Noel has a food shop that makes & sells viands like caldereta, afritada & halang-halang.  He has had this business for 21 years. 

Noel has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking viands.  He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Noel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking viands

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a farmer. Damira is a heroic mother. Together with her husband, she brings up nine children. The older children are employed, the two younger daughters are preschool age and the other children study at school. Seven years ago with an initial investment of 3000 soms, the family started to cultivate agricultural products. By selling some part of the harvest, the family earns about 2,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Damira wants to purchase 35 liters of fuel to use in collecting potatoes and to pay for the services of a tractor driver. In the future with the profits gained, Damira plans to purchase furniture to improve their living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and to pay for tractor driver's services

loans.name: Petivia

texts.en:
Petivia is 33 years old, married, and has four children. She owns and operates a business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has been in this business for two years.  

Petivia is requesting a loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profits from her business, estimated to be 200 talas or $83 per week, to improve and expand her business.

Petivia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Petivia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers.

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer emprendedora que ha trabajado durante 17 como comerciante, labor que aprendió gracias a su familia que desde que ella era una niña se han dedicado a este trabajo, actualmente Gladys tiene una miscelánea donde ofrece gran variedad de productos como ropa, zapatos, productos de papelería, y otras variedades que sus clientes requieren, sueña con sacar su negocio adelante y ofrecerle a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

A sus 42 años de edad, y con la ilusión de ver crecer su negocio Gladys quiere comprar mercancía al por mayor para surtir el negocio, con insumos como: Zapatos, sandalias y cosméticos, pues estos productos son de gran demanda en las ventas, pero debido a la difícil situación económica Gladys no cuenta con la suma de dinero necesaria para comprar un buen surtido que le deje mejores utilidades por lo que solicita un préstamo para hacer dichas comprar obtener las ganancias generar mas ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys is an entrepreneurial woman who has worked as a retailer for 17 years.  She learned this business thanks to her family who have been in this line of work since she was a little girl.  Gladys currently has a general store where she sells a wide variety of products such as clothes, shoes, stationery products and other items that her customers need.  She dreams of making progress in her business and offering her two children a better quality of life.

At 42 years of age, and with the hope of seeing her business grow, Gladys would like to buy merchandise wholesale so that she can stock her business.  She will buy products such as shoes, sandals and cosmetics as these products sell well.  However, owing to her difficult financial situation, she doesn't have the money she needs to buy a good selection of products which will make her better profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can make her purchases, make a profit, make more income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics and other products with which to stock her business

loans.name: Tujijure I Group

texts.fr:
Sylvestre est un commerçant âgé de 50ans qui habite la localité de Rutoki de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Il fait le commerce de bière locale de bananes et du sorgho il ya de cela 25 ans. Il faisait le commerce d’articles divers de boutique avant de commencer cette activité. Il a fait ses études jusqu'en 6e année primaire. Il est marie a Mélanie et ont ensemble 8 enfants dont 5 sont a l’école. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 440,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bière locale à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies pour subvenir a ses besoins essentiels en l’occurrence les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Tujijure I»
texts.en:
Sylvestre is a 50-year-old merchant who lives in the town of Rutoki in Gitega Province, in the middle of the country. He has been doing commerce in local beer, bananas, and sorghum for 25 years now. He used to deal in store goods before beginning this current business. 

Sylvestre has attended school and reached the 6th grade. He is married to Mélanie, and together they have eight children. Five of the children are in school. 

The Kiva loan of 440,000 Burundi francs that he obtained has enabled him to increase his capital to buy large amounts of local beer to resell, so as to make a large profit and to increase his savings. Thus, he can cover his essential expenses, in this case, the  costs of his children's schooling.

loans.use: to increase his capital to buy large amounts of local beer to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Mammadali

texts.en:
Mammadali is a 34-year-old man, who has engaged in farming for the last six years.  He is an Internally Displaced Person.  He is married and has three sons. He grows pomegranates and seasonal vegetables and sells them in the local market.  This is a profitable business, especially his pomegranates, which are popular not only in Azerbijan, but also in Russia. This product is in high demand. 

His monthly income from his business is 200 AZN and this is the only financial income for his family.  He has applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase fertilizers and seeds as well as garden tools and to improve his irrigation system.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La socia Antonia continua con su panadería y la elaboracion de panes, ella ahora que comienzan las fiestas navideñas; desea comprar harina, al por mayor, manteca por kilos, levadura, leña para el horno y elaborar panes, tortas, kekes tipo panetones. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de harinas, levadura, leña para el horno, manteca al por mayor. La socia esta creciendo y ahora desea invertir mas para poder abastecer a sus clientes. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, leña para el horno.
texts.en: Antonia continues with her bakery and baking bread.  Now that the Christmas holidays are starting she wants to buy flour at wholesale, shortening by the kilogram, yeast and firewood for the oven to bake bread, cakes, Panettone-type cakes.  She requests the loan to buy flour, yeast, firewood for the oven and shortening at wholesale.  She is growing and wants to invest more to meet customer demand.  She is requesting the loan to buy flour, yeast, shortening and firewood for the oven.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, shortening and firewood for the oven.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.es:
La señora Carmelita se dedica a la  venta de  carne desde hace  tres  meses, ella nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de u negocio es seguir trabajando día a día  en lo que es la matanza de vaca y marrano para  ofrecerle a sus clientes carne fresca y de calidad.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres  hijos Mirsha de catorce años de edad, Evelyn de diez años de edad y Yandel de tres años de edad.
Pidió el préstamo para  la compra  de  vacas y marrano para la matanza  ya que  gracias a fundación ya cuenta con lo que es refrigerador y molino  para la carne molida.
texts.en:
Carmelita has been selling meat for three months. She says that what she likes best about her business is that she continues to work from day to day, slaughtering cows and pigs, in order to sell fresh, high quality meat to her customers.

She has three children, Mirsha 14, Evelyn, 10, and Yandel, 3. She asked for the loan in order to buy cows and pigs to slaughter, as thanks to the Foundation, she has a refrigerator and a grinder for making ground meat.

loans.use: To buy cows for slaughter.

loans.name: Biacca

texts.en: Biacca is 21-year-old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food from a stall in Malakiya yambio, South Sudan for two years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, rice and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice and onions.

loans.name: Julio C. Tello Al Progreso Group

texts.es: Juliana es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Julio C. Tello al Progreso” grupo conformado por 07 socios responsables y trabajadores. Juliana tiene 19 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01hijo la cual ha sido su motivo para seguir mejorando cada día, actualmente Juliana trabaja como mesera en un restaurante, gracias a su trabajo le ha permitido mejorar su economía, ya que puede aportar con los gastos de su hogar. El deseo de Juliana es de comprarse su propio terreno, ya que por el momento vive en casa de sus suegros. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de víveres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar, fideos y leche. La Alcancía Comunal “Julio C. Tello al Progreso” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa- Prosperidad. Adjuntamos la fotografía de Floriana.
texts.en: Juliana is a member of the “Julio C. Tello al Progreso” Communal Bank, which has seven responsible and hard-working members. Juliana is 19, lives with her partner, and has one daughter who has always been her inspiration to continue improving every day. Juliana works as a waitress in a restaurant. Thanks to her job, she has been able to improve her income and contribute to the household income. Juliana wants to buy her own plot of land, since she currently lives in her in-laws' home. She requested this loan for the purchase of groceries for her home, such as rice, sugar, pasta and milk. The “Julio C. Tello al Progreso” Communal Bank are grateful for this loan and promise to continue to work well with the Programa Prosperidad. We have added in the photo of Floriana.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, pasta and milk.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is married and has six children ranging from five to twenty-nine years of age. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She has been running a general retail stall and sells items such as plates, paper, slippers, etc. She has been in this business for the last three years. Previously she was involved in a farming activity. 

Her business challenge is the high cost of items sold. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more paper, plates, etc. In the next five years, Julia hopes to expand her business and run another one near her town area.

loans.use: To buy more paper, plates, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 37 years old and lives in Minlasag, Sibutad. She is married with 4 children.

Evelyn has a small scale mining business and earns approximately 4,300 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase a horse.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase a horse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of retail shop.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira is living in Baku city. She and her husband started their family business in 2000. In 2005-2006 she borrowed two loans from Normicro Baku branch, for a total amount of $1100. She used these loans for business expansion. Now she wants to borrow  an additional $700. This loan will mainly be used for increasing the variety of goods and increasing the volume of sales. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of materials she buys.

loans.name: Sayed Hussin

texts.en: S. Hussin is 32 years old and has a household of three.  He lives in District 6 in Kabul, Afghanistan. His main business is operating a garden but he has established an agricultural component as well. He has a lot of land for his garden. He needs a loan from AFS to buy different trees and materials for his garden. After growing the trees, he will sell them at the bazaar.  A successful business will ensure a good future for his family and himself and  will help to create a happy family life.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Santos Veronica

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Santos Verónica and my main activity is sales. I have a traveling makeup business in which I sell by taking orders. I have dedicated many years to this type of activity. I am a single mother and with the income I earn, I am able to cover our family’s expenses. I need to increase the variety of my products, because of the increase of my products’ demand. I need to make a larger investment, but I don’t have enough funds.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Santos Veronica, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de cosmeticos de manera ambulante y por encargo, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, soy madre soltera y con los ingresos que persibo de este negocio, cubro los gastos de mi familia, actualmente necesito surtir mas ya que el volumen de venta cada día es mayor, por lo que necesito mayor inversión y no cuento con el capital suficiente.

loans.use: Purchase of body lotions, shampoo, lip gloss, and lipstick.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena and her teenage son Alexei live in Vasilyevka, Zaporozhye region. Yelena runs a small business selling women’s lingerie in one of the local markets. She tries to increase the selection of her inventory regularly as it always attracts new clients. Yelena’s vending stall is well known in the market because with the variety of merchandise she has for sale, she can always meet the needs of even the most demanding clients.

Yelena is a fairly new entrepreneur. However, her trade is constantly growing. Yelena has been a market vendor for 9 months and has about $1,500 in inventory.

Yelena is notable for her immense willingness to work -she is not afraid of hard labor. She works day and night to earn enough to give her son everything he needs for a normal life, as well as to develop her small business. She believes her business can bring her a good profit by helping women be more feminine and beautiful. Yelena is requesting a loan of $500 to open a new vending facility and expand her trade.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
ELVA is 42 years old and has four children. She and her husband process flower nectar to make a tasty and nutritious food called pollen, honey and jelly. Adding this to milk shakes with any type of fruit or to fruit cocktails is delicious. These products are on display and sold from her home. Elva is a member of the Santiago 5 group with Maria Cecilia Hernández Velasco (fruit and vegetable sales), Olga Lidia Hernández Mijangos (traditional food sales), Yolanda Estrada Martines (animal breeding) and Hortensia Hernández Vázquez (grocery store). Each of them invests in the businesses, to help where needed and make improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

ELVA tiene 42 años, cuatro hijos. Ella junto con su esposo procesa el néctar de las flores convirtiendo en un rico y nutritivo alimento llamado polen, miel y jalea. Esto se puede poner a los licuados de leche con cualquier fruta o a los cócteles de fruta y sale muy rico. Estos productos los exhiben y vende en su casa. Pertenece al grupo llamado Santiago 5 junto con: Maria Cecilia Hernández Velasco (venta de frutas y verduras), Olga Lidia Hernández Mijangos (venta de comida típica), Yolanda Estrada Martines (crianza de animales) y doña Hortensia Hernández Vázquez (tienda de abarrotes). Cada una de ellas invertirá en sus negocios supliendo alguna necesidad y mejorando.

loans.use:
SALE OF HONEY

VENTA DE MIEL DE ABEJA

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Mr. Komi K. is an active 26-year-old. He is a talented farmer, and his crops are sought after by many local women who would like to sell them. The income he earns from this business allows him to take care of his small family of four (4) people. He would like to increase his harvest in order to maximize his income, and to do so he needs to buy fertilizer. As he lacks the financial means to do so, he is requesting a loan of $500 to help him with this purchase.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Komi est un jeune très actif de 26 ans. Très doué dans la culture des produits vivriers, il est sollicité par beaucoup de bonnes femmes exerçant le commerce de ces produits. Le revenu de cette activité lui permet de s’occuper de sa petite famille de quatre (4) personnes. Dans le souci d’augmenter ses récoltes afin de maximiser son revenu, il voudrait acheter des engrais. Par manque de moyens financiers, il vient solliciter un apport financier de $500 pour l’achat des engrais.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Tes

texts.en: Mrs. Tes D., 39, is the mother of four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling a wide variety of grocery products to the people in her area, earning on average around US$ 7 each day in revenue. Her husband is currently unemployed, while one of her children works as a construction worker and another one is enrolled in school. In order to generate more income, Mrs. Tes D. would like to purchase a car for her husband to use to operate a taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her husband to use as a taxi to generate more income for her family

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene, Felicitas, and Elizabeth are members of the community bank “Dignidad”.  Irene and Felicitas have been members for several years, and Elizabeth joined eight months ago.  In their community bank they have learned about punctuality, saving, self-esteem, nutrition, and how to care for their families health.
Irene is 58 years old.  She is a widow and has eight children, only one of whom lives with her.  Irene makes a variety of desserts and sells them to different stores and cafes.  She has been doing this for the past seven years.
Felicitas is 33 years old.  She lives with her partner and two children who are nine and two.  Felicitas has been selling firewood from her home for four years.  
Meanwhile, Elizabeth is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and two young children.  Elizabeth sells prepared food from a stand that belongs to her mother.  She started this business one year ago.
Irene, Felicitas, and Elizabeth need loans of 1000, 1200, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying flour, butter, eggs, oil, wood, rice, sugar, and noodles.  
The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Rosa, Inés, and Faustina plan to use their savings to build a kitchen and make improvements on their homes.  Their dreams are to travel to another country, see their children become professionals, and have happy families.

loans.use: Irene, Felicitas, and Elizabeth need loans of 1000, 1200, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying flour, butter, eggs, oil, wood, rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
S. Bahodur is 44 years old. He and his wife raised two children. 

Bahodur is selling DVDs and CDs. He works in the market. Bahodur orders the delivery of the disks from Russia and tries to have all new movies, concerts of popular singers, and others. The business is successful, generating the main income for the family. 

Today Bahodur requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase DVDs and CDs for selling. Bahodur thanks all supporting him and promises to be accurate in loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing DVDs and CDs for selling

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta F. is a trader who sells fruit. She is a single parent of one child. Business is going very well and she wishes to increase her sales, which will increase her income, but she lacks enough funds.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is 27 years old and is married with 2 children, 9 and 5 years old. Sauda is a fish seller. She started her business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Mayna

texts.en:
N. Mayna is 57 years old. She is widow. She’s the loving mother of eight children.  
Mayna is a market vendor. She is selling clothes and shoes for men in the local market. Her two sons help her with the business. Mayna has been in this business for five years already. For these years, she managed to make her business stable and profitable, generating the main incomes for her family. When we wanted take her picture she was busy servicing her clients. That is why in the photo she is standing in the background and is not clearly seen and the men standing in the foreground are her clients. She is trying to satisfy the needs of any client with various tastes and income levels. She works very hard to give her dearest children good educations and to make them happy. In order to cover the higher education expenses of her daughter who is going to enter the university, Mayna is planning to increase her working capital in order to purchase new summer shoes for selling. With this purpose Mayna requests 400 $ US Dollars for the term of 4 months. She promises to repay the loan in accurate manner. Mayna and her hopeful son are counting on your help. Be important in the growth of Mayna’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new shoes for men in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr:
Abdourahmane is a hay merchant in the town of Concord. He is originally from Sanghé and lives the city of Lamy, is married and a father of 5 children. With the end of the crop season, he wants to build his stock of hay since his main income is drawn from this commercial activity. This is his second loan and he is a loyal client of the mutual funds company.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Abdourahmane est un commerçant de foin à Concorde. Il est originaire de Sanghé et habite à cité lamy, il est marié et père de 5 enfants. Avec l'hivernage il veut accroitre son stock car ses principaux revenus sont tirés de son activité commercial.Il est à son 2ème prêt et un fidèle client de la mutuelle.

loans.use: Purchase and selling of hay

loans.name: Rayo De Luz Group

texts.en:
Claribel M. is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children (ages 13, 7, and 6) in a small community called Las Palmillas in the eastern province of Hato Mayor in the Dominican Republic. She began a small business selling clothing earlier this year and wants to use the loan to increase her inventory.

Claribel travels by bus from town to town selling her products to the small communities in the countrysiD., as many of these rural people do not have the means to travel to town to do their shopping. Claribel also has a small hair salon in her house where she serves friends and neighbors when she is not out selling the clothing. She has started this clothing business to earn additional income so that she can proviD. her children with a good education and comfortable home. It is her hope that they become professionals one day. In Claribel’s free time, she enjoys reading and spending time with her family.

Claribel is the leader of the 10-person micro-bank group, Rayo D. Luz. In English, this means `ray of light´. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. On behalf of Claribel, the Rayo D. Luz group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, and undergarments

loans.name: Caitana

texts.es:
Caitana is 37 years old. She studied until the fifth year of primary school. She is married and she has five young children. She lives in the Centro Poblado de Ccotos Sector Nº 1.

Since the year 2004 she has been a part of the Banco Comunal de Juchuy Niño – Capachica. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, she bought 3 spindles of alpaca wool and 3 kilos of synthetic wool in order to make sweaters, jackets, etc. For the past two years she has made her products independently and sold them to the tourists that come to the Centro Poblado.

With this loan of S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, that she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy 10 spindles of alpaca wool and 10 kilos of synthetic wool in order to continue making sweaters, jackets, and woolen hats.

Her vision is to have her artisan’s shop; made by hand and embroidered in cloth in the Centro Poblado for the affluence of tourism, so her children can study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Caitana cumplió 37 años de edad, estudió quinto de primaria, es casada y tiene cinco hijos menores de edad, ella vive en el Centro Poblado de Ccotos Sector Nº 1. Desde el año 2004 integra el Banco Comunal de Juchuy Niño – Capachica, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró 03 conos de lana de alpaca y 03 kilos de lana sintética para tejer chompas, chalecos, etc. Desde los doce años teje individualmente y vende sus productos a los turistas que van a su Centro Poblado. Con este crédito de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 10 conos de lana de alpaca y 10 kilos de lana sintética para seguir tejiendo chompas, chalecos y chullos. Su visión es poner su tienda de artesanía; tejido a mano y bordados en bayeta en el mismo Centro Poblado por la afluencia de turismo, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

loans.use: To buy better wool

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene is 46 years old and lives in Beirut where she works as secretary in a doctor's clinic. Recently, Marlene was forced to move because her home was too far from her office. She has requested a US$ 700 loan to perform maintenance on her new apartment that she has rented near the clinic. This will be Marlene's second loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To help with the costs of maintenance on Marlene's new apartment

loans.name: Cheung

texts.en:
Cheung M., age 33, is married and lives in Prey Veng, about 80 miles from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Mrs. M. typically makes $8 each day by selling vegetables in the village. Her husband, Rous Phirun, age 34, is a security guard who makes $2 each day. This couple has four children, one of whom is employed as garment factory worker with a salary $60 per month. 

Cheung would like to take a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband for commute to work. The motorbike will cost around $600. With the remaining $200, she will repair the leaky roof of her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Fortalecimiento Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL BANCO COMUNAL "FORTALECIMIENTO" TIENEN COMO REPRESENTANTE A LA SEÑORA VERÓNICA QUIEN TIENE PARIENTES DENTRO DEL GRUPO PERO ESO NO REPRESENTA PROBLEMAS EN LOS PAGOS DEBIDO A LA INDEPENDENCIA ECONÓMICA D. CADA UNA D. LAS FAMILIAS. LAS SOCIAS DESARROLLAN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES COMERCIALES Y D. SERVICIO. COMO SER PROMOTORAS D. COSMÉTICOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES, D. MASITAS Y VENTA D. COMIDA, TAMBIÉN SE DEDICA A LA PELUQUERÍA, COSTURERA Y TRANSPORTE PUBLICO EN LO QUE RESPECTA A LOS SOCIOS PARTICIPANTES. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA. EL CRÉDITO FINANCIADO ESTA DESTINADO PARA INCREMENTAR SU MERCADERÍA Y A LA COMPRA D. HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO. LAS SOCIAS COMENTAN QUE YA TRABAJARON CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS, UNA MAYORÍA D. LAS SOCIAS YA TRABAJARON CON AGROCAPITAL EN OTROS GRUPOS POR QUE SABEN LA MODALIDAD D. TRABAJO QUE SE MANEJA EN LA FUNDACIÓN.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Fortalecimiento” have as a representative Veronica who has relatives within the group but this is not a problem as each of the families is economically independent. The members have different commercial business and services, such as selling cosmetics, groceries, food, beauty salon, sewing, and public transportation. As with all business there exists competition and customer demand. The loan will be used to increase merchandise and buy tools and supplies needed for their work. The members say that they have worked with support groups, a majority of the members have worked in agrocapital groups and they know how these community groups function.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase merchandise and supplies for their respective businesses.

loans.name: Rahimberdi

texts.en: I. Rahimberdi is 44 years old. He is married with two children. He has been a father for 21 years, which has helped him to understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house. Rahimberdi works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. He grows potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables in his garden. Rahimberdi dreams of a good education and a bright future for his children. That is why he works from early morning until late at night. He wants to borrow 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) for the term of 7 months so he can buy mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. This request is in support of making his dream come true, and Rahimberdi is asking for help from your generous heart.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer and other farming supplies

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy es madre de 3 hijos, vive con su conviviente quien la apoya mucho. Ella brinda servicios de radiofonía a las personas que quieren conversar con sus familiares que se encuentran por los caseríos alejados, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años atrás y le gusta porque conoce a muchas personas, además le es rentable, debido a que es ella la única persona en su zona que tiene este tipo de servicio que es de gran utilidad para muchas personas. Este ya es su 3er préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita quiere ampliar su local e implementarlo para que sea cómodo para recibir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucy is the mother of 3 children, she lives with her significant other who supports her very much. She manages a radio call center for people who want to speak to relatives that live in far away hamlets. She has been doing this for the past 4 years and enjoys it as she gets to meet many people, and besides it is profitable as she is the only person in the area that offers this kind of service necessary for many people. This is her 3rd loan with MFP. With the money she will extend her premises and remodel to make it more comfortable for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Extend and remodel premises.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Gracias a su padre Karina se hace acreedora de una fracción de una chacra familiar hace siete años. Desde que obtuvo la propiedad no  dudo en trabajar la tierra para poder cosechar diversos alimentos. Actualmente, ella se dedica a sembrar, cosechar y vender frutas en la ciudad y en su misma casa.

Su esposo es chofer de un carro alquilado. Junto con él ayuda a mantener los gastos de su casa. Una parte de sus ganancias las ahorra para invertirlo en su negocio. En base a su esfuerzo la producción de su cosecha ha crecido por lo que eventualmente contrata a una persona quien la ayude a manejar su negocio.

Más adelante quisiera aumentar la siembra y cosecha de su chacra pero al mismo tiempo desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Thanks to her father, Karina has been an investor in a part of the family farm for seven years. From the time she received her property, she has dedicated herself to working the land to raise a variety of crops. Currently, she plants, harvests and sells fruits in the city and from her own home.

Her husband is a chauffeur for a car rental service. Both she and her husband contribute to the household expenses. They are saving a part of their earnings to invest in their business. As a result of their efforts, the harvest has increased to the point where they now need to hire a person to help them manage their business.

In the future, she would like to increase her farm's production and open a grocery store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Rabie

texts.en:
Rabie is an 18-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Rabie has been working as a mason since 2003. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Rabie has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started, he had difficulty purchasing his tools. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Anna W.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Anna M., a 42-year-old woman from Mbeya. She is single, and she has one child. Since 2007, has been operating a crop-selling business: she purchases crops from the farming villages and then sells the crops in her town. She works at her business 1-4 hours per day, 6 days per week, and she is assisted by one employee. Anna currently earns approximately $380 per month from her business.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 in order to purchase a large quantity of crops from the village. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Anna thanks you for your support.

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional crops fpr resale purposes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is 52 years old. She is married with four children, all of whom have completed school. Some are working while others are learning trades. She lives with some of her children and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Elmina, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Mary is a trader. She sells vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc. on a table top in the market square. She procures the vegetables from farmers in nearby small communities at effective prices. She says she supplies the greatest percentage of the vegetables to food vendors. Mary has been in this business for three years. She wants a loan to procure more goods.

loans.use: Procure vegetables.

loans.name: Ozor

texts.ru: Озору 29 лет, он женат и недавно у него родился второй ребенок. Озор не имеет постоянной работы и занимается транспортными перевозками – он таксист. Для этого он использует свою собственную машину, которую он приобрел на деньги, заработанные им в России. Приехав сюда в Таджикистан он решил таксовать. Заработок небольшой, но семью кормит. Озор решил получить займ на переоборудование своей машины с бензина на природный газ, который дешевле по цене и позволит ему увеличить свою прибыль.
texts.en:
Ozor is 29 years old, he is married and recently he had a second baby. Ozor does not have a permanent job and works in transportation – he is a taxi driver. He uses his personal car for this, which he purchased using money that he earned in Russia. After coming here to Tajikistan he decided to become a taxi driver. His earnings are small but he feeds his family. Ozor decided to take out a loan in order to convert his car from using gasoline to using hydrogen gas which is cheaper and will allow him to increase his earnings.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert automobile

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is married with two grown-up children. She sells women's clothing – underwear, T-shirts, slippers, etc. Her kiosk is located very close to the food market, bringing many customers her way. Katerina has been in this business for 8 years. She used to work in construction, but as the salary was small, she decided to start her own business. Today it is the only source of income for her family.


Katerina would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She believes that a larger assortment would allow her to increase her sales and make a greater profit.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Mrs. Hak D. is 22 and just married to Mr. Chanthou, 22. They have no children. They both live in Pursat Province, where they have jobs as rice farmers. They use their own farmland to grow rice crops, which they plant twice a year, including the rainy and dry seasons. To help meet the hard physical labor of farming work, Hak D. is applying for a loan to buy a pair of water buffalo in order to plow the farmland and to raise its offspring in the future.

loans.use: To buy a pair of water buffalo in order to plow the farmland

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito G. is married to Marina who is a domestic helper in Taiwan. He manages a hog-raising business and a rice farm to help her provide their family with better living in the future and to sustain the education of their two children namely: Maiden Wella - 21 years old and Wilmar Grace - 15 years old. They live simply in the village of Tandul, which is a rural and peaceful area of Cabatuan, Isabela.

Warlito’s business has already existed for about ten years now and he wants the business to grow more to give his children all their needs and to save for their future. He is asking to borrow PHP 5,000 as additional business capital to purchase enough feed for him to raise his pigs to grow healthy.

loans.use: To purchase enough feed for him to raise his pigs to grow healthy

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel A. is 36 years old. She is married with a child who is currently in school. Rachel trades in eggs and has been selling for the past five years to support her family. She treks to big poultry farms to buy her stock of eggs. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy crates of eggs to serve her customers. Rachel hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. She supplies to beverage sellers and other food vendors in her community.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs
